description: Broncos (9-3) at Raiders (3-9)

title: S.S. Badger Is Left to Sink or Sail on Its Own
description: The S.S. Badger, the last coal-fired ferry in the United States, will have to sink or sail on its own.

title: The Next Debt-Limit Debacle
description: Republicans clearly sense that they are being outmaneuvered in the fiscal talks by the Obama administration, unable to stop the inevitable rise in tax rates for the rich. But they have one last card to play and they intend to use it, knowing it will endanger economic progress: They are threatening once again to default on the credit of the United States if President Obama doesnt do their bidding.

title: The Bobcats Were the Worst, but Much Has Changed
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The Charlotte Bobcats took the Bob off their uniforms, adjusted the design and altered the team colors for 2012-13. So at least they no longer look like the franchise that posted the worst record in the history of the N.B.A.

title: Below the Line: Editing the Crash in Flight
description: In some ways, the job of film editors is to make their work invisible. They hope that audiences dont notice the editing and see only that a clear path has been drawn to the heart of the films story.

title: Fired Up About the Kindle Fire
description: When Amazon.com introduced its first tablet last year, one of the harshest reviews came from Jakob Nielsen, the usability expert. He slammed the Kindle Fire for offering a disappointingly poor experience.

title: Cuomo Says Only Time Will Tell if Senate Coalition Will Succeed
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday said that Democrats had squandered the opportunity the last time they controlled the State Senate, but that only time will tell whether an unusual power-sharing arrangement forged Tuesday by Senate Republicans and a group of dissident Democrats will succeed.

title: K.K.R.s Roberts Gives $50 Million to Claremont McKenna
description: Kohlberg Kravis Robertss co-founders have poured their money into scores of deals over their nearly four decades together. But one area near and dear to them is education.

title: For Fighting Foreclosures, a $100,000 Award
description: In 1989, Tom Cox, a lawyer for a Maine bank at the time, wrote the book on mortgage foreclosures (Maine Real Estate Foreclosure Procedures for Lenders and Workout Officers), detailing the most effective legal methods for seizing peoples homes.

title: India Is Not a Secular Republic
description: MUMBAI  Twenty is somehow a newsworthy round number and it is inevitable that the 20th anniversary of an event that shook India will be observed by the nation with deeper introspection than usual on this Dec. 6. On this date in 1992, a mob of Hindu demonstrators tore down the Babri Masjid, a mosque more than 450 years old that they claimed was built over a Hindu temple. Hundreds of Muslims and Hindus died. Using the anniversary of this tragedy as the peg, my latest column questions Indias constitutional claim and aspiration that it is a secular republic.

title: How to Read Like a War Reporter
description: Luke Mogelson, a contributing writer based in Kabul, last wrote for the magazine about Nimruz, an isolated province in Afghanistan where there is more than one war going on.

title: As Ever, Money Worries Pervade Climate Talks
description: DOHA, Qatar  The United Nations climate conference here has settled into its typical doldrums, with most major questions unresolved as a Friday evening deadline for concluding the talks approaches. One of the thorniest issues is money, which has often bedeviled these affairs.

title: An Evening of Dance for Wendy Whelan and More at Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival
description: One ballerina, four dance-making partners. A new work inspired and performed by Wendy Whelan, the New York City Ballet principal dancer, called Restless Creature will be unveiled this summer at the Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival, organizers said on Wednesday. Ms. Whelan will dance four duets with a different male partner, each of whom choreographed their number. The partners are Kyle Abraham, Joshua Beamish, Brian Brooks and Alejandro Cerrudo. Performances run Aug. 14 to 18. Jacobs Pillow also said in announcing part of its lineup that the recently resurrected Dance Theater of Harlem would open the season with a run from June 19 to 23. Repertory includes George Balanchines Agon, Alvin Aileys Lark Ascending and John Alleynes Far but Close.

title: Novelists Debut Is Newest Pick for Oprahs Book Club
description: It is a dream come true for a first-time novelist: a call from Oprah Winfrey with the news that your novel has been chosen for her book club. That dream recently came true for Ayana Mathis, the author of The Twelve Tribes of Hattie (Alfred A. Knopf). Ms. Winfrey announced Wednesday that she has chosen the novel for the book club famously associated with her former TV talk show. In response to the endorsement, the publishers increased the books first printing to 125,000 copies.

title: A Yoga High With a Little Help
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Look of The Moment | Cold Weather Coral
description: Coral, a color once relegated to spring/summer collections and clothes for warmer climes, has been venturing out into colder evenings recently. Applied to heavier fabrics, the happy hue makes a festive holiday statement. The model Alek Weks Kenzo mini proved that coral can play a supporting role to darker, more wintry colors like navy; Keira Knightley wore a Richard Nicoll jacquard dress to the after-party for her film Anna Karenina; and the model Miranda Kerr added a layer of black  and a sweetheart neckline  to a long Giulietta dress.

title: Dave Brubeck, Whose Distinctive Sound Gave Jazz New Pop, Dies at 91
description: Dave Brubeck, the pianist and composer who helped make jazz popular again in the 1950s and 60s with recordings like Time Out, the first jazz album to sell a million copies, and Take Five, the still instantly recognizable hit single that was that albums centerpiece, died on Wednesday in Norwalk, Conn. He would have turned 92 on Thursday.

title: Elisabeth Murdoch, Matriarch of a Journalism Family, Dies at 103
description: Dame Elisabeth Murdoch, the 103-year-old mother of the media tycoon Rupert Murdoch, the widow of an Australian newspaper baron and one of her nations most noted philanthropists, died on Wednesday at her estate near Melbourne.

title: Shares of Freeport Sink as Investors Assail Deals

description: Law school has been in the news a bit lately, as the number of applicants declines and the difficulty of finding a six-figure salary commensurate with six-figure student loans has grown.

title: Grand Bargain Express
description: David Brooks: Gail, Im out in Los Angeles. Did you know that the celebrity set has moved beyond nerd glasses, and now Simpson-Bowles-style bipartisan budget plans are all the rage? Ke$ha and Kobe have been showing theirs off at parties, relying heavily on means testing Medicare and preserving the negative income tax. Snoop Dogg and Kendrick Lamar have come together for one raising an immense amount of money on a Bugatti tax. Taylor Swift and Chuck Norris have one, but I hear they didnt write it themselves.

title: In Mexico, a New Champion and More
description: Last Sunday, Tijuana won its first Mexican league title, triumphing at a listless Toluca , 2-0 on goals by Richard Ruiz and Duvier Reascos, to capture the championship, 4-1 on aggregate. Then, two days after the conclusion of the Apertura season, Mexican soccer was rocked by the death of the former Pachuca goalkeeper Miguel Calero, 41.

title: New Chinese Leader Meets Military Nuclear Officers
description: BEIJING  The new Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, met Wednesday with officers of the military unit that oversees the land-based ballistic and cruise missiles of Chinas nuclear force, the state-run news agency Xinhua said, in the latest indication that Mr. Xi is moving quickly to solidify his control of the armed forces.

title: Obama Appeals to Business for Support on Tax Plan
description: WASHINGTON  After a campaign that drove a deep wedge between them, President Obama is now trying to rebuild relations with the business community in hopes of enlisting it in his showdown with Republicans in Congress over the looming fiscal crisis.

title: How to Bypass Instagrams Twitter Barrier

title: The Fate of an American City: Mark Binelli Talks About Detroit
description: Detroit has become the most visibly distressed symbol of our hard economic times. In his new book, Detroit City Is the Place to Be: The Afterlife of an American Metropolis, Mark Binelli traces the long history of racial and financial struggles there, documents the current crisis, and investigates the many ways  innovative, desperate and otherwise  that residents are trying to turn things around. In a recent e-mail interview, Mr. Binelli discussed the rise of urban agriculture in Detroit, apportioning blame for the citys problems and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: The Whale in a Tank
description: Count Adam Gurowski cut a striking figure as he stormed about Washington in a broad-brimmed hat, flowing overcoat and colored spectacles. The Polish exile, who had lived in Berlin, St. Petersburg and Paris before coming to the United States in 1849, was the author of 1854s Russia As It Is, a work praised as original and striking. The son of Count Wladyslaw Gurowski, who fought alongside Tadeusz Kosciuszko in the failed attempt to free Poland of Russian influence in 1794, Adam, according to his obituary in The New York Times, imbibed the revolutionary spirit possessed by his father, and carried his patriotism to such an extent as to render himself obnoxious to the ruling powers. When war broke out, Gurowski took a minor position in the State Department.

title: Heat, Lacking Urgency, Are Stung by Wizards

The Heat fell behind early and could not get going until it was too late. The result was an embarrassing 105-101 loss to a terrible team that doubled its victory total for the season from one to two.

Her story, set in 20th-century Philadelphia, is one of terrible loss and grief and survival, a story of endurance in the face of disappointment, heartbreak and harrowing adversity.

title: 36 Hours in Steamboat Springs, Colo.
description: STEAMBOAT SPRINGS evokes an era when cattle ranchers roamed its streets and locals preferred Stetsons to ski vests. But in recent years, Steamboat has sought to shed a bit of its family-friendly image as a cowboy theme park and embrace its inner Breckenridge. The town, nestled along the Yampa River in northwest Colorado, has installed an array of new aprs-ski bars, haute cuisine restaurants and late-night haunts, as well as upscale lodgings, like One Steamboat Place, that can rival anything at Vail or Aspen. The centerpiece of Steamboats face-lift, which coincides with the resorts 50th anniversary, is a redeveloped promenade at the base of its gondola, with a heated walkway, a musical stage and a three-tiered ice castle. Families still flock to Steamboat for its dude ranches and hot springs. But after the children are put to bed, its downtown comes alive with an impressive night life and innovative culinary scene. Its still a cowboy ski town, said Gerry Verdoner, bar manager of Sweetwater Grill. But now theres more balance.

title: For Some Visitors to Art Basel Miami Beach, a Reminder of Sandys Ravages
description: Few events at Art Basel Miami Beach start before 11 a.m., so that everyone can recover from the previous evenings partying.

title: YouTube Ban, Spurred by Anti-Islamic Video, Is Met With Shrugs
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When it comes to YouTube, the government of Afghanistan intends to keep its hand on the switch for now.

title: The Holidays With This Bunch? Its Murder
description: Lets Kill Grandma This Christmas is the theatrical equivalent of a mediocre holiday movie.

title: With Chavez Gone, Yankees Could Look at Youkilis
description: NASHVILLE  Yankees General Manager Brian Cashmans assertion that the teams search for a replacement at third base for Alex Rodriguez could drag for awhile appeared much more realistic with Wednesdays news that two of the teams top targets had signed elsewhere.

title: Who's Hurt by the Fiscal Impasse? You Decide
description: The tax increases and spending cuts scheduled for the end of the year could cause a recession if they remain in effect through 2013, analysts say, but reversing them would add to the deficit. Decide for yourself which policies to keep and see the impact.

title: How to Control an Army of Zombies
description: In the rain forests of Costa Rica lives Anelosimus octavius, a species of spider that sometimes displays a strange and ghoulish habit.

title: Documents Found at the Tazreen Apparel Factory
description: Documents found at the Tazreen apparel factory in Bangladesh, where 112 workers died in a fire nearly two weeks ago.

title: The Giving Spree | Rick Owens
description: Who: The Paris-based fashion designer Rick Owens, whose T made of fog and plexiglass was featured in the fall mens issue.

title: Interest Groups Push to Fill Margins of Health Coverage
description: The chiropractors were out in force, lobbying for months to get their services included in every states package of essential health benefits that will be guaranteed under the new health care law.

title: Describing the View From the Sidelines
description: FRANKLIN FOERS latest book is a giant game of Jewish geography. An almost indecent number of the 50 writers he and his co-editor, Marc Tracy, recruited to write profiles for Jewish Jocks: An Unorthodox Hall of Fame are friends and sometime colleagues. And the panel discussion held recently at the Union Square Barnes & Noble, just a few hundred feet from where Emma Goldman once roused crowds in Yiddish, felt kind of like a bar mitzvah.

title: U.S.-Approved Arms for Libya Rebels Fell Into Jihadis Hands
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration secretly gave its blessing to arms shipments to Libyan rebels from Qatar last year, but American officials later grew alarmed as evidence grew that Qatar was turning some of the weapons over to Islamic militants, according to United States officials and foreign diplomats.

title: At Climate Talks, a Struggle Over Aid for Poorer Nations
description: DOHA, Qatar  The United Nations climate conference here has settled into its typical doldrums, with most major questions unresolved as a Friday evening deadline for concluding the talks approaches. One of the thorniest issues is money, which has often bedeviled these affairs.

title: Bob Costas Keeps His Focus on Guns and Violence
description: Breaking sports news video. MLB, NFL, NBA, NHL highlights and more.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Philippines, Lebanon and Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: You Never Know Wholl Sit Beside You on the Train. Right, Jay-Z?
description: O.K., so Ellen Grossman didnt recognize Jay-Z when she sat next to him on the subway the other week, as touchingly demonstrated in the video below thats been making the rounds. (Are you famous? Ms. Grossman asks her seatmate as the cameras roll? Not very famous, he replies. You dont know me. But Ill get there someday.)

title: Help for Sleep-Deprived Students
description: Thanh-Tran Nguyen, a high school student who is sleep-deprived in Seattle, is blogging about her college search on The Choice blog's student-led series, The Envelope, Please.

title: Getty Museum Acquires Rare Illuminated Manuscript
description: The J. Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles bought an illuminated manuscript by the Flemish master Lieven van Lathem at a Sothebys auction in London on Wednesday night for nearly $6.2 million.

title: Metropolitan Opera Renovation
description: A $60 million plan for a gut renovation of the building at Lincoln Center in New York City.

title: Alicia Keys Has a Fifth No. 1
description: Alicia Keys has earned her fifth No. 1 on the Billboard album chart with her latest, Girl on Fire (RCA), topping recent titles by Taylor Swift, Rod Stewart and One Direction in the relatively slow sales week after Thanksgiving.

title: For Greece, Oligarchs Are Obstacle to Recovery
description: ATHENS  A dynamic entrepreneur, Lavrentis Lavrentiadis seemed to represent a promising new era for Greece. He dazzled the countrys traditionally insular business world by spinning together a multibillion-dollar empire just a few years after inheriting a small family firm at 18. Seeking acceptance in elite circles, he gave lavishly to charities and cultivated ties to the leading political parties.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: A Mobile Paradox, and the App Elite
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: The Rolling Stones: The Difference in the Clothes They Wear
description: Mick, Keith and the boys are celebrating their 50th year together  and an improbable half-century run as fashion avatars. Here, a look at their style through the ages.

title: Wells Fargo Banker and 9 Others Charged With Insider Trading
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission accused a Wells Fargo investment banker of insider trading on Wednesday, saying that he and others took advantage of nonpublic information he obtained about merger deals involving clients.

title: Mets Technology to Get With the Program
description: In the Metropolitan Opera production of Berliozs Troyens two harnessed dancers representing Dido and Aeneas take flight in an aerial ballet. But dont look for it when the opera returns to the Met stage on Dec. 13.

title: Fighting the Resource Curse
description: About a year ago, in the aftermath of the revolution that drove Muammar el-Qaddafi from power in Libya, journalists crowded into a press conference called by the transitional governments Oil Ministry. Among the reporters was a small contingent of Libyan journalists. Yet it was only the foreigners who peppered a government minister with questions about when production would resume and other issues; the Libyans remained silent.

title: Gossip Girl
description: HAS there ever been a celebrity more suited for Twitterati stardom than Lindsay Lohan? From her brawls to her arrests to her bad career choices and busted romances, LiLo is the gift that keeps on giving. Her arrest on Nov. 29, following the altercation she reportedly got into with another woman at a Manhattan night club over the boy band heartthrob Max George (The Wanted), and her widely panned role as Elizabeth Taylor in the Lifetime movie Liz & Dick, had people posting comments on Twitter at the rate of nearly one every 8 seconds. Below, a sampling.

title: One Big Cocktail Before the Art Is Served
description: HOW many parties could one possibly go to during one night of Art Basel Miami Beach? To raise the odds, consider that it was only Tuesday, two days before the fair officially opens, and a work night for most.

title: The Design Team Roman & Williams Gets Around
description: Black-pipe flanges, filament bulbs and vintage turntables  these industrial-chic tropes have come to signify good taste today, and much of it can be traced to Stephen Alesch and Robin Standefer.

title: They Get Around
description: IF one was wondering at whose feet to lay the blame for the cannibalization of the nations old barns and derelict schoolhouses to meet the voracious appetite for reclaimed wood by trendy cocktail dens and restaurants, Stephen Alesch and Robin Standefer are a good place to start.

title: Brazil Steps Up Investments in Overlooked Tech Start-Ups
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  For the last few years, Brazilian start-ups have begun to successfully draw blue-chip Silicon Valley venture firms. But in the process, promising technology segments have been ignored.

title: Raphael Drawing Fetches Nearly $50 Million
description: A Renaissance drawing from one of the most famous collections in Britain sold at Sothebys in London on Wednesday night for $47.8 million, slightly more than twice its high $23.8 million estimate.

title: 10 Composers to Celebrate One Topic
description: The problems with Women, a new program performed by the New York Festival of Song on Tuesday evening at Merkin Concert Hall, began with the note in the playbill. In it, Steven Blier, the festivals artistic director and main piano accompanist, wrote that after the success of Manning the Canon, an evening of songs by and about gay men, he felt the need to balance the account with an evening celebrating women.

title: You Can Dance to It: Roots of Tradition With Improvisational Freedom
description: Dance rhythms teased throughout the concert at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night: a summit of Latin jazz pianists with Chucho Valds and Gonzalo Rubalcaba from Cuba, Danilo Prez from Panama and Egberto Gismonti from Brazil.

title: Six Performers Moving Through a Labyrinth of Perceptions
description: Miguel Gutierrezs And lose the name of action seeks to demonstrate facets of a mind that has come apart. The title phrase concludes the To be, or not to be soliloquy in Hamlet; a long program note by Mr. Gutierrez begins with that speechs final five lines and tells us of neurological problems afflicting his father, which in turn led Mr. Gutierrez to investigate the connections of body and mind. His note also variously addresses neurology, philosophy and somatics, and examines the role perception plays in reality. Mr. Gutierrez goes on to hope that his work may be a bridge connecting these various fields of inquiry.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Dec. 6
description: Theres nothing wrong with some sparkle in your seasonal get-up. But theres a fine line between arriving in festive glitter and looking like a Grammy Awards nominee.

title: Newspaper Born of a Fire Is Back in Ink After a Storm
description: Never has the name of The Wave, the weekly newspaper of the Rockaways, seemed so apt.

title: A Soul Singer Following in the Family Tradition
description: If Only for One Night, Brenda Russells seething pop-soul ballad of longing and desire, is probably best remembered by Luther Vandrosss ornate rendition on his 1985 album, The Night I Fell in Love. On Tuesday evening at 54 Below it was resurrected by Darius de Haas in a fiery, unabashedly abject interpretation whose desperate passion eclipsed even that of Mr. Vandross, the so-called Pavarotti of pop, who died seven years ago.

title: Transcript of David Leonhardts Reddit Chat
description: David Leonhardt, The Timess Washington bureau chief, took questions Wednesday on the popular social news site Reddit. What follows is an edited transcript.

title: Egyptians Protest Plan for Charter
description: In Egypt, demonstrations against President Mohamed Morsi persisted.

title: In Bed With the Flu, and Lots of Information About It
description: I wasnt my usual self earlier this week. Some nasty flu bug had beaten me, reducing your usual quirky, chipper columnist to a feverish, bedridden shadow. Its never fun being ill, and Ive never been a good patient because all the sensible advice to stay warm, hydrated and in bed leads to boredom.

title: Tracking a Body-Rattling Saxophone Storm
description: The biggest brace-yourself moment in Donny McCaslins first set at the Jazz Standard on Tuesday night came at the last possible moment, near the end of the encore, when he uncorked an impromptu tenor saxophone coda that seemed to rattle through his body like a heavy wind. The gathering force of his projection gave every indication of physical abandon, but the speed and complexity of his phrasing stressed otherwise. It was a pretty serious couple of minutes.

title: Champions League: Matchday 6(B)
description: With games on Matchday 6(B) of the group stage of the UEFA Champions League on Wednesday, we continue a featurette in which we hope to bring Goal readers video of the best (and most important) goals of the day, courtesy of Fox Soccer.

title: New York City Opera to Hold Online Auction
description: New York City Opera, seeking to shed decades worth of old sets, costumes and props, has decided to auction off most of the material next month, the companys general manager and artistic director, George Steel, said on Wednesday. An online auction will begin in mid-January and run through Jan. 24.

title: Bet Your Camomile Tea, Peter, Youre a TV Star Now
description: In Beatrix Potters first version of The Tale of Peter Rabbit, a menacing Mrs. McGregor leans over a kitchen table and presented a steaming-hot pie to Mr. McGregor, who holds a knife and fork at the ready. The pie, of course, is stuffed with the remains of Peters father.

title: The iPad as a Hand-Held Darkroom
description: Over the years, Ive been in and out of relationships with dozens of film cameras, Pentax, Canon, Nikon, Minolta and others, as a result of my passion for photography.

title: Fall North American Championships
description: SAN FRANCISCO  On Sunday, the last day of the Fall North American Championships, the Reisinger Board-a-Match Teams was won by Pierre Zimmermann, Franck Multon, Fulvio Fantoni, Claudio Nunes, Geir Helgemo and Tor Helness, who play for Monaco. They finished 3.41 boards ahead of Sabine Auken from Denmark; Roy Welland of New York City; Bart Bramley of Dallas; and Lew Stansby of Dublin, Calif. Third were Bob Blanchard, Shane Blanchard (Bobs son), John Hurd and Joel Wooldridge, all of New York City; Bob Hamman of Dallas; and Justin Lall of Las Vegas.

title: Designing the 21st-Century Synagogue
description: Landau Zinder, a new architecture firm in Princeton, N.J., specializing in synagogues, is a partnership of two architects: Michael Landau, 70, whose four-decade career included a stint with Marcel Breuer, and Joshua Zinder, 44, who worked for Michael Graves, among others, before starting his own firm five years ago. The men, who still have individual practices, met about 10 years at the Princeton Jewish Center, where both are members. They spoke to a reporter about designing the 21st-century synagogue, which like many contemporary homes, involves concerns of technology, green strategies and aging occupants.

title: So Your Flights Delayed? Relax.
description: Louis Vuitton didnt become a successful purveyor of travel goods by sitting on its thumbs. Over the years, the company, which was founded in 1854, has invented steamer trunks that convert into beds and a padlock that it challenged Houdini to pick. Vuitton is recalling the adventurous spirit of those designs with Objets Nomades, a collection that was presented in the Miami Design District on Tuesday and will remain on view through Sunday.

title: Alaska: Future Swing State?
description: The state where President Obama most improved his performance from 2008 was Alaska. He lost it by only 14 percentage points this year, considerably less than his 22-point margin of defeat in 2008.

title: Raising a Paddle for the Gio Pontis
description: On Dec. 13, Wright in Chicago will hold an auction of 20th-century Italian masterworks, with almost half of the pieces by Gio Ponti. He is the overarching figure of Italian design, said Richard Wright, the auction house owner, tracing that arc from the 1920s, when Ponti began his career as an architect, industrial designer and editor in Milan (he founded the Italian magazines Domus and Stile), to the 1970s, the last decade of his life.

title: The Sun Rises Again on Caf Royal
description: In 1865, a nearly penniless Frenchman fleeing his debts opened Caf Royal in London. The clubs heyday lasted more than a century, as celebrities swirled through its sumptuous precincts. (Max Beerbohm described fumes of tobacco ever rising to the painted and pagan ceiling of the Domino Room.) But in 2008, the building was sold, and its lavish appointments  cut-glass chandeliers, heavily varnished oil paintings, even a boxing ring  were auctioned off.

title: Buddy-Buddy: Seasoned Actor and Young Director
description: Michael Caine was doing the eye thing. Its a trick of his, developed over years of film performances and close-ups: Let your gaze rest on your scene partner, but only with one eye. The other eye, the one closest to the camera, can connect with the lens. The camera will not miss anything, he said, including the bad. So you have to watch it.

title: Eva Zeisels Designs Shine On
description: Leucos is producing two glass lamps by Eva Zeisel, who died last year at 105. She first created versions five years ago for a friend of her granddaughter who was designing a coffee shop. Eva was adamant about keeping the shape exactly the way it was said Josie Anthony, Leucos USAs president. And she only wanted to do it in white. (Leucos had to persuade her to make a honey-colored model.) The lamps  Summer (single curve, shown); Spring (double)  display her signature undulations. Available starting Friday at Gracious Home, from $345 for a Spring sconce to $735 for a Summer suspension lamp: (800) 338-7809 or gracioushome.com.

title: Sales at Daniel Levy, Niche Modern and Others
description: From Thursday to Sunday, Daniel Levy porcelain tabletop overstock, seconds and discontinued patterns are up to 95 percent off (a Quadrille buffet plate, usually $275, is $25); 155 West 29th Street, Suite 3N, (212) 268-0878, daniellevyporcelain.com.

title: Street Battles Erupt in Cairo
description: Street battles erupted in Cairo on Wednesday night, after Islamist supporters of President Mohamed Morsi attacked protesters camped outside the gates of the presidential palace.

title: Shopping for a Fir
description: Shopping for a Fir

title: Egypt Makes its Case in Washington
description: Essam al-Haddad, the national security adviser to President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt, is thoughtful, engaging and articulate in both Arabic and English.

title: Trimming the Trees Genes
description: PUYALLUP, Wash.

title: Scouting Report
description: POP-UPS

title: Blood Is Shed as Egyptian Presidents Backers and Rivals Battle in Cairo
description: CAIRO  Angry mobs of Islamists battled secular protesters with fists, rocks and firebombs in the streets around the presidential palace for hours Wednesday night in the first major outbreak of violence between political factions here since the revolt against then-President Hosni Mubarak began nearly two years ago.

title: Zona Style
description: At home with Franci Sagar, the woman behind the home store, Zona, and her daughter Sophie.

title: An 80s Hit Preps for a Comeback
description: IT is a bit of a flashback to walk into Franci Sagars Wooster Street loft. First, it is an unreconstructed 80s-era habitat, with a huge bed at its center and little islands of activity, collections and furniture bobbing about. Then theres the olfactory whomp of the place  toasty, spicy, cedar-inflected  that brings a whiff of Ms. Sagars hit machine, the home store known as Zona.

title: Lions and Tigers and Bears, Oh My
description: In a TriBeCa loft, a menagerie under glass.

title: In San Miguel de Allende, a Hillside Home Built by Artisans
description: This seven-bedroom home is four blocks from the town square in San Miguel. Its on the market for $3.9 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Mexico
description: A MOROCCAN-STYLE HOUSE WITH SEVEN BEDROOMS IN SAN MIGUEL DE ALLENDE

title: What You Get for ... $1.2 Million
description: SPOKANE, WASH.

title: Homes for $1.2 Million
description: Properties in Washington, Massachusetts and Wisconsin.

title: In Inquiry, Drilling Company Chief Quits
description: LONDON  The chief executive of Saipem, the largest European drilling and engineering contractor for the oil industry, resigned Wednesday evening after an Italian prosecutors office said it was investigating possible corruption.

title: Inviting in the Ghosts
description: ITS difficult to pinpoint a design style for a home with an artificial leg in the entry, an oversize medical model of an ear on the Le Corbusier dining table and a metal carnival clown head that doubles as a cat bed.

title: Federal Plan Calls for Overhauling Secrecy Policies
description: WASHINGTON  Declaring the current system for classifying information dysfunctional, a federal advisory panel is calling for the most thorough overhaul of government secrecy since classification procedures were established 70 years ago.

title: A TriBeCa Menagerie
description: A loft in TriBeCa is home to a variety of taxidermied creatures.

title: Mona Ackerman, Advice Columnist, Dies at 66
description: Mona Ackerman, whose experience as a clinical psychologist informed a weekly advice column for The Huffington Post, died on Wednesday in Manhattan. She was 66.

title: For PC Virus Victims, Pay or Else
description: CULVER CITY, Calif.  Kidnappers used to make ransom notes with letters cut out of magazines. Now, notes simply pop up on your computer screen, except the hostage is your PC.

title: Custody Case in Scotland Goes Before U.S. Justices
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday struggled to decide whether it was capable of doing anything to affect the outcome of a custody dispute before the Sheriff Court in Airdrie, Scotland.

title: Driver in Fatal Parade Crash Has Not Yet Been Questioned
description: HOUSTON  Three weeks after a truck carrying wounded veterans was struck by a train at a parade in Midland, Tex., federal investigators say they have been unable to interview the driver of the vehicle.

title: Indias Lower House Votes to Support Foreign Investment
description: NEW DELHI  Indias lower house of Parliament voted in a raucous session on Wednesday evening to support the governments decision to allow Walmart and other major retailers to set up shop here.

title: How Upstart Played Its Way Into B.C.S. Club
description: DEKALB, Ill.  A few hours before Sunday nights Bowl Championship Series selection show, Northern Illinois Athletic Director Jeff Compher sent an intern to buy 100 oranges at a nearby grocery store, then made sure they stayed hidden.

title: Test Your Rolling Stones Style Knowledge
description: Think you know your Stones style history? Test yourself, and no Googling the answers!

title: Things I Saw  No. 46
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: Lawsuit Claims Racial Discrimination at a Building in Sunnyside
description: In February, according to a lawsuit, when Lisa Darden went to a building in Sunnyside, Queens, and inquired about a one-bedroom apartment, the superintendent told her there were none available, and that he did not know when one might be.

title: I Am Not Big Brother
description: CHICAGO

title: Raise the Economys Speed Limit
description: Washington

title: Forgotten in Iraq
description: Kirk Johnson, a former U.S.A.I.D. employee, struggles to help resettle Iraqis whose lives are in danger because of their loyalty to the United States. Is President Obama to blame?

title: Republicans Immigration Bill Blocked by Senate Democrats
description: Democrats in the Senate on Wednesday blocked consideration of a bill Republicans passed last week in the House of Representatives that would give 55,000 permanent resident visas to foreigners graduating from American universities with advanced degrees in science or technology.

title: Forgotten in Iraq
description: As an American, as a journalist and simply as a person who tries to maintain some moral clarity in my life, I felt compelled in this Op-Doc video to tell the story of the workers in Iraq whose lives have been endangered or destroyed because of their loyalty to the United States.

title: State May Oversee Detroits Finances
description: The City of Detroit, straining to manage its debts and meet its payroll, may be nearing circumstances dire enough to require a state-appointed emergency financial manager, Michigan officials cautioned city leaders this week.

title: Deterred by Illness, Driven Ahead by Goals
description: Since he came to the United States from Haiti 23 years ago, Fritz Salomon has spent most of his time hospitalized for a disease he barely understands.

title: Santorum Strikes Again
description: Lately, youve probably been asking: What ever happened to Rick Santorum? The guy who ran for president in the sweater vest? The one who compared homosexuality to bestiality and did 50 push-ups every morning? Its certainly been on my mind.

title: Insider Trading and a Top Hedge Fund
description: Some of the cases involving former employees of SAC Capital Advisors, the fund run by Steven A. Cohen.

title: Win a Trip 2013
description: The Times columnist Nicholas D. Kristof invites students to enter a contest for an international reporting trip in 2013.

title: South Dakota: Tribes Raise Money for Sacred Land
description: Indian tribes that consider a high mountain prairie in the Black Hills of South Dakota to be sacred have raised enough money to purchase the land so that it can be preserved for religious ceremonies, the tribes announced. Three Sioux tribes  the Rosebud and Crow Creek in South Dakota and the Shakopee Mdewakanton in Minnesota  made contributions toward the $9 million cost of the 1.942-acre parcel, which is known as Pe Sla. The Sioux believe that Pe Sla was the scene of an ancient fight in which evil was vanquished.

title: Mississippi: Fourth Guilty Plea in Hate Crime
description: A fourth white man pleaded guilty to hate crime charges on Tuesday in the killing of a black man who was robbed, beaten and run over by a pickup in Jackson. Three others have already pleaded guilty and await sentencing in the death of James C. Anderson, who was assaulted in June 2011. William Montgomery, 23, confessed in Federal District Court in Jackson on Tuesday to assaulting Mr. Anderson but said he did not participate in running him over.Another suspect, Jonathan Gaskamp, 20, also pleaded guilty to hate crimes charges in assaults against other blacks.

title: Recognizing the Opposition in Syria
Bad News on Capitol Hill for Last Coal-Fired Ferry
description: The Badger, the last coal-fired ferry in the United States, will have to sink or sail on its own. A provision in a little-noticed Coast Guard bill in the House would have allowed the ship to continue plying Lake Michigan  and dumping tons of coal ash into the lake each year. But the provision was taken out of the bill this week in negotiations with the Senate. It passed by voice vote in the House on Wednesday and was sent to the Senate. The Badgers owners will have to hope that the Environmental Protection Agency gives the ferry a reprieve before its permit expires on Dec. 19. Otherwise, they will have to put the ferry into dry dock or switch to some other power source at considerable cost.

title: Counterfeit Drugs
description: To the Editor:

title: Just the Facts on Smoking
description: To the Editor:

title: The Toys of My Youth
description: To the Editor:

title: A Synagogues Dissent on Palestine
description: To the Editor:

title: Thomas Jefferson, in a Different Light
What Buckley Would Say
description: To the Editor:

title: A Legendary Modernist
description: Oscar Niemeyer, the Brazilian architect who created flowing designs, infused Modernism with a new sensuality and inspired of generations of architects worldwide, died Wednesday. He was 104.

title: Oscar Niemeyer, Architect Who Gave Braslia Its Flair, Dies at 104
description: Oscar Niemeyer, the celebrated Brazilian architect whose flowing designs infused Modernism with a new sensuality and captured the imaginations of generations of architects around the world, died on Wednesday in Rio de Janeiro. He was 104.

title: In Fine Print of Fiscal Debate, Charities Unite to Defend Deductions
description: WASHINGTON  Proposals to cap or otherwise limit deductions in order to raise tax revenue from the wealthy are gaining bipartisan support in Washington  and making charities and nonprofits very worried.

title: Clipboard Chairman in Focus for Jets
description: Even in todays high-tech N.F.L.  with its aerial cameras and triaxial knee braces  theres still room for the humblest of technologies. You Jets fans know what Im talking about. Im talking about Greg McElroys clipboard.

title: A Check on Bad Eyewitness Identifications
description: The Oregon Supreme Court in a unanimous decision last week upended how eyewitness identification is to be used in criminal trials. The landmark ruling shifts the burden of proof to prosecutors to show that such identification is sufficiently reliable to be admissible as evidence at trial. Misidentification is the countrys leading cause of wrongful convictions. By altering the legal standard, Oregon has set an example that other states and the federal courts would be wise to follow.

title: Race to the Bottom
description: Competition among states and cities to lure businesses in hopes of creating jobs is not new, but it has become more fierce in recent years. An investigation by The Times found that state and local governments are giving out $80 billion a year in tax breaks and other subsidies in a foolhardy, shortsighted race to attract companies. That money could go a long way to improving education, transportation and other public services that would have a far better shot at promoting real economic growth.

title: Njoy Commercial
description: Ads for Njoy King carry the theme Cigarettes, youve met your match.

title: Campaigns for E-Cigarettes Borrow From Tobaccos Heyday
description: IT has been decades since American consumers could watch cigarette commercials, which once filled the airwaves with pitches for brands like Camel, Chesterfield, Kool, Lucky Strike, Pall Mall, Viceroy and Winston. Now, they can watch cigarette spots again, to an extent: the smokes being advertised are electronic rather than made from tobacco.

title: Win a Trip in 2013!
description: My latest column announces my next win-a-trip contest, an annual event in which I take a university student with me on a reporting trip to Africa. The aim is to generate some interest in global poverty issues both with the contest and with the blogging and videos that the winner will contribute to the New York Times website. I started the contest in 2006 and weve had some great trips over the years. For some of the winners, it has been life-changing, and HBO did a documentary called Reporter based on my 2007 trip; its on Amazon if you want to see what youre getting yourself in for.

title: Gifts That Change Lives
description: Looking for an unusual holiday gift? How about a $60 trio of rabbits to a family in Haiti in the name of someone special? Bunnies raise a farming familys income because they, well, reproduce like rabbits  six litters a year! Heifer International arranges the gift on its Web site (heifer.org).

title: Bay May Join Another Mets Castoff in Seattle
description: NASHVILLE  The Seattle Mariners on Wednesday were closing in on a formal agreement with Jason Bay, whose disastrous career with the Mets came to an abrupt end last month.

title: Storm Writes a New Script in Campaigns for New York Mayor
description: This is when the New York City mayors race goes off script.

title: Inspector of Day Care Centers Gets 2 Years in Bribetaking Case
description: A former New York Fire Department employee who supervised safety inspections at day care centers was sentenced on Wednesday to two and a half years in prison for accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from center operators in return for overlooking violations and not performing inspections.

title: Conflicting Views on How to Navigate a River of Cash
description: NASHVILLE

title: An N.F.L. Team at the Rose Bowl? Not if Some Neighbors Have Their Way
description: PASADENA, Calif.  For nearly two years, the battle over bringing the National Football League to Los Angeles has been fought between two business titans competing to build a stadium in either downtown Los Angeles or the nearby City of Industry. No ground has been broken. The N.F.L. has not signaled whether it would approve a new franchise. There is not even a team clamoring to come.

title: An Abduction Shines Light on Ukraine Asylum Policy and on Kremlin Methods
description: KIEV, Ukraine  For two and a half days in October, Leonid Razvozzhayev, a little-known leader of the Russian political opposition, moved furtively from one part of Kiev to another, meeting with political allies and human rights experts about seeking asylum in the West. At times, he was sure he was being followed. He was right.

title: Theme of This Puzzle
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  You know what I like more than anything on a Thursday? I like being fooled. Its not because I enjoy feeling foolish, although God knows thats easy enough. Its because its proof that Im alive and still have things to learn. That puts a smile on my face and, when it happens to you, I truly hope it puts a smile on your face, too.

title: Corrections: December 6, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Young Immigrants Want Dream Warrior Army
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The movement of young immigrants in the country without legal papers, who call themselves Dreamers, is held together by more than a commitment to push Congress for a pathway to citizenship.

title: In Changing Harlem, a Mosque Struggles to Pay Rent
description: Following the suns path over the sky, cabdrivers double-parked outside the mosque for Jumuah, or Friday prayer, in this part of central Harlem known as Little Africa. The worshipers steadily dripped in, men through one entrance, women through another.

title: British Newspapers Agree to Regulator
description: LONDON  The editors of Britains principal national newspapers met Wednesday under pressure from Prime Minister David Cameron and agreed to the establishment of an independent newspaper regulator with far greater powers than those available to the existing watchdog.

title: Trail to a Hedge Fund, From a Cluster of Cases
description: In April 2009, an F.B.I. agent visited the Silicon Valley home of Richard Choo-Beng Lee, a hedge fund manager with deep contacts inside technology companies. The government, the agent said, had overwhelming proof that Mr. Lee had engaged in insider trading. Within weeks, Mr. Lee confessed and began cooperating.

title: Peace Process Pulls at Germany-Israel Ties
description: BERLIN  Growing up as a teenager in Germany, Jonathan Logans opinion of the Middle East conflict was black and white. The Israelis were the good ones, and the Palestinians very clearly the bad ones, he recalled Wednesday, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel arrived here for previously scheduled and suddenly rather tense consultations with Chancellor Angela Merkel.

title: Art Basel Miami Beach Kicks Off
description: On Tuesday night, before the Art Basel Miami Beach fair opened for big collectors and V.I.P.s, the big event was the opening of the exhibition Bill Viola: Liber Insularum at the Museum of Contemporary Art, North Miami.

title: Warm-Up Game Forces Knicks to Sweat
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The Knicks had a stopover in Charlotte on Wednesday night on their way to an Eastern Conference showdown with the Heat in Miami on Thursday.

title: Boehner Gains Strong Backing From House Republicans
description: WASHINGTON  With a daunting fiscal crisis looming and conservatives outside the House torching him at every turn, Speaker John A. Boehner might be assumed to have a shaky hold on his gavel. Instead, it appears he is enjoying the broadest support of his tumultuous two-year speakership from House Republicans.

title: Behind a Flop, a Play(wright) Within a Play
description: A stroll down West 45th Street in the theater district is all it takes to understand the contradictory fortunes facing David Mamet, for years the heavyweight of bare-knuckled American playwrights, as well as the producers who believe that loyalty to the writer makes good business sense.

title: Typhoon Bopha: Hurricane Sandy Times Two
description: HONG KONG  The official death toll from Typhoon Bopha climbed to 325 by Thursday afternoon, and with nearly 400 Filipinos still unaccounted for, the typhoon appeared as if it would be twice as deadly as Hurricane Sandy, the storm that thrashed the Caribbean and the eastern United States six weeks ago.

title: After Fleeing Belize, Software Pioneer Seeks Asylum  in Guatemala
description: John McAfee, the software antivirus pioneer who disappeared from his home in Belize last month after the police there called him a person of interest in their investigation into the murder of his neighbor, has resurfaced in Guatemala City. He has hired a former attorney general and prominent defense lawyer, Telsforo Guerra, to seek political asylum in Guatemala. Mr. Guerra told local reporters that Mr. McAfee, 67, above, is being persecuted because he has refused to give the authorities in Belize any more money. Mr. McAfee had been blogging and sending Twitter messages while on the run, saying he fled because he feared for his life. Prime Minister Dean Barrow of Belize has called Mr. McAfee bonkers.

title: Hasidic Man Denies Abuse of Young Girl He Counseled
description: Nechemya Weberman, the unlicensed ultra-Orthodox Jewish counselor charged with repeatedly sexually abusing a young girl in his care, testified in a Brooklyn courtroom on Wednesday that he had never, ever touched her inappropriately.

title: When Best Still Isnt Good Enough
description: In just over a decade of existence, the Florida International football program has struggled through the growing pains of being a fledging program, moved from Division I-AA to the Football Bowl Subdivision, taken part in the frenzy of conference realignment, had victories vacated by the N.C.A.A. and made two bowl games.

title: 3 Charged With Plotting to Export Sensitive Materials to Iran and China
description: Three people have been charged with conspiring to illegally export to Iran and China a superstrong material called carbon fiber that can be used to make machines that can enrich uranium, federal prosecutors in Manhattan said on Wednesday.

title: Lottery Numbers
In Louisiana, Growing Rice to Trade on Some Creatures That Eat It
description: GUEYDAN, La.  Donald Benoits rice fields are pristine enough for a picture postcard. Long, straight rows of bright green grain protrude from crystal clear water, with not a weed in sight. But one thing looks out of place.

title: Options at Third Base Shrinking for Yankees
description: NASHVILLE  The Yankees options, however unappealing they might be, are dwindling.

title: With Wrights Deal Done, Mets Now Need a Team
description: NASHVILLE  Maybe the Mets will finish their contract negotiations with R. A. Dickey before they depart baseballs winter meetings this week. Maybe they will leave with a new catcher, or a capable outfielder or two.

title: Giants, on Their Turf, Will Try to Slow the Saints Fast-Paced Offense
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Facing the New Orleans Saints has rarely been a rewarding experience for Tom Coughlin. Since becoming the Giants coach in 2004, Coughlin has lost three of the four matchups by a combined 127-58, including a 49-24 thrashing last season.

title: Sports Replay: Dec. 5
description: A view of the day in sports, including sailing in Australia and surfing in Italy.

title: John McAfee, Software Pioneer, Is Arrested in Guatemala
description: MEXICO CITY  The antivirus software pioneer John McAfee was arrested in Guatemala City on Wednesday after he slipped over the border from his home in Belize where police want to question him in their investigation of the murder of his neighbor.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Dec. 6, 2012
description: Were like Rip Van Winkle waking up and saying, This is not O.K.!

title: A Patients Goal: Get Him to the Church on Time
description: As my patient looked on, his wife took the framed photograph out of a nondescript manila mailer, the type with bubble wrap on the inside, and handed it to me gingerly. It was clear they both considered it to be precious cargo.

title: States Cut Antismoking Outlays Despite Record Tobacco Revenue
description: Faced with tight budgets, states have spent less on tobacco prevention over the past two years than in any period since the national tobacco settlement in 1998, despite record high revenues from the settlement and tobacco taxes, according to a report to be released on Thursday.

title: Running in Reverse
description: This column appears in the Dec. 9 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: Frank Ocean, the Black Keys and Fun. Lead Grammy Nominations
description: The rock trio Fun. dominated the nominations for the four most prestigious Grammy Awards on Wednesday, receiving nods for album, song and record of the year, as well as for best new artist.

title: Word of the Day | knell
description: knell \nel\ noun and verb

title: Felton Sheds His Bandages and Helps Topple the Bobcats
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Raymond Felton saw the pass coming, let his instincts take over and soon felt excruciating pain in his left thumb. On only the second play of Wednesdays game against the Charlotte Bobcats, Felton deflected a pass from Kemba Walker out of bounds  and he realized his plan was flawed.

title: A Chat With Michael Caine
description: The cinema fixture Michael Caine gives Melena Ryzik an interview and an acting lesson.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO) IN VOGUE: THE EDITORS EYE (2012) In honor of its 120th anniversary, Vogue magazine pays tribute to some of its most talked-about fashion layouts and the editors who created them  Grace Coddington, Tonne Goodman, Polly Allen Mellen, Camilla Nickerson, Phyllis Posnick and Babs Simpson  all women, whom Anna Wintour, the editor in chief, calls our secret weapon. This documentary, directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato and coinciding with the publication of Vogue: The Editors Eye, also features interviews with women who have graced the magazines cover and pages, like Nicole Kidman and Sarah Jessica Parker, and with the designers Alber Elbaz, Nicolas Ghesquire, Marc Jacobs and Vera Wang, herself a former Vogue fashion editor. (Above, a model wearing Christian Dior Haute Couleur Lipstick in Dazzling Orange.)

title: 20 Years Ago: Riots Sweep India After Babri Mosque Destruction
description: Indias towns and cities were swept by rioting between Muslims and Hindus on Monday, leaving more than 200 people dead and hundreds more injured a day after militant Hindus destroyed a 16th-century mosque in the northern town of Ayodhya, Edward A. Gargan wrote in an article in The New York Times published Dec. 8, 1992.

title: News Quiz | December 6, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: IHT Quick Read: Dec. 6
description: NEWS Rescuers sought to reach isolated villages Wednesday after a typhoon struck the Philippines, killing at least 325 people and leaving thousands homeless. Floyd Whaley reports from Manila.

title: Stalemate and Rancor Stage Rally in N.H.L.
description: Donald Fehr, the executive director of the players union, had just finished a news conference Thursday in which he described the unions latest offer to end the N.H.L. lockout, and how he believed it provided a clear outline for ending the dispute. Players like Sidney Crosby and Brad Richards were expressing guarded optimism to reporters about returning to the ice.

title: Morsi Defends Wide Authority as Turmoil Rises in Egypt
description: CAIRO  Egypt descended deeper into political turmoil on Thursday as the embattled president, Mohamed Morsi, blamed an outbreak of violence on a fifth column and vowed to proceed with a referendum on an Islamist-backed constitution that has prompted deadly street battles between his supporters and their opponents.

title: Minorities Report
description: LONDON  On Monday, a dozen masked gunmen said to be affiliated with the Taliban and Lashkar-e-Taiba broke into a graveyard in an elite neighborhood of Lahore, the historic capital of Punjab Province. They tied up the guard, a caretaker and about 20 visitors, and then vandalized 120 gravestones.

title: Barclays Increases Stake in Absa Group in $2.1 Billion Deal
description: LONDON  The British bank Barclays agreed on Thursday to increase its stake in its South African subsidiary, the Absa Group, as it moved to consolidate its operations across Africa.

title: Standard Chartered to Pay $330 Million to Settle Iran Money Transfer Claims
description: HONG KONG  The British bank Standard Chartered said on Thursday that it expected to pay $330 million to settle claims by United States government agencies that it had moved hundreds of billions of dollars on behalf of Iran.

title: U.N. Envoy Is Seeking a Deal to Oust Assad From Syria
description: DUBLIN  With the support of the United States, the United Nations special envoy on Syria is mounting a diplomatic push for a brokered agreement that would lead to the ouster of the countrys president, Bashar al-Assad, and the installation of a transitional government.

title: In Gujarats Gir Forest, Indias Most Privileged Voter
description: BANEJ, Gujarat  Nestled in the heart of Gir forest, home to the rare Asiatic lion, in Gujarat (where the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party rules), is a hamlet called Banej.

title: Art Basel Miami Beach: Pregame Events
description: Few events at Art Basel Miami Beach start before 11 a.m., so that everyone can recover from the previous evenings partying, Patricia Cohen reports from the fair on our sister blog ArtsBeat.

title: Test Yourself | English, Dec. 6, 2012
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article A Nascent Rivalry for the Fans, Too.

title: Jay-Z, Meet Ellen Grossman
description: In When My Friend Ellen Grossman Met Jay-Z, Tanzina Vega writes about the woman in the video posted above.

title: Lynchings in the West, Erased From History and Photos
description: At first, Disguised Bandit  a life-size reproduction of a century-old postcard by Ken Gonzales-Day  does not suggest anything out of the ordinary. A sparse tree cuts the center of the photograph. A group of white American soldiers flanks the tree. One man grins. The others stare passively into the camera.

title: The Real Fiscal Risks in the United States
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management.

title: Is It Wrong for a Newspaper to Publish a Front-Page Photo of a Man About to Die?
description: Note: This Student Opinion question refers to a photograph that teachers may or may not wish to show to students. We have purposely not republished the photograph here, although we are providing a link to The Times City Room column, which published a photo of the New York Post front page and asked its readers a similar question.

title: Week 14 N.F.L. Game Probabilities: The Sanchez Mistake
description: With Mark Sanchezs benching last Sunday, its time to see how his 2012 production compares with his previous seasons. To be fair, Sanchez is not surrounded with as much talent as he has been in previous years. However, the nature of the quarterback position is such that truly skilled quarterbacks are able to transcend the limitations of the players around them. Just this season, weve seen rookies like Russell Wilson, Robert Griffin III and Andrew Luck instantly and significantly improve their offenses despite having about the same or less supporting talent than their teams had a year before.

title: Tip of the Week: Bookmarks on the Home Screen
description: Googles Android operating system and Apples iOS software both include a Web browser that lets you save bookmarks. For sites you visit frequently, however, it is often faster to get to your favorite page with the mobile equivalent of a desktop shortcut  an icon on the phones home screen  instead of fiddling around with the browsers bookmark menu.

title: Hong Kongs Leader Seeks to Ease Concerns About Mainland Chinas Influence
description: HONG KONG  Seeking to address a local backlash against mainland Chinese control, the chief executive of Hong Kong called Thursday for closer relations with the mainland but also emphasized his willingness to impose limits on mainland visitors and investors.

title: Part 4: College Students Answer Reader Questions on Admissions and Campus Life
description: The Choice has invited two of our former student bloggers of The Envelope, Please series to stop by our virtual Guidance Office and answer reader questions about the admissions process and what college life is like after youve made your choice.

title: Five Americans Who Could Leave M.L.S. and Head Abroad This Winter
description: The Major League Soccer season is over, and December has already seen several players move from one M.L.S. team to another.

title: The Early Word: Togetherness
description: In Todays Times:

title: Enhancing Classics With Old-Car Style and Modern Mechanicals
description: Once shunned by purists, older collector cars and lookalikes fitted with modern engines, transmissions, brakes, electronic controls and sound systems are gaining new respect. Broadly known as restomods, cars that have been updated under the skin are as easy to drive, and often as safe and reliable, as a new model. And after modernization, these sought-after vehicles are unlikely to be garage queens, gathering dust.

title: New eBay Product Aims to Harness User Data to Aid Auto Marketers
description: EBay is joining the growing hordes of companies that are offering even more data to advertisers to help them better reach intended customers, in this instance companies that sell cars, trucks, motorcycles and R.V.s and run digital ads on ebay.com.

title: A Conversation With: Author William Dalrymple
description: The Scottish historian and travel writer William Dalrymples new book Return of a King: The Battle for Afghanistan 1839-1842 is an eloquent, animated account of the first Anglo-Afghan war, long regarded as Britains most disastrous imperial adventure. He spoke with India Ink about writing narrative history; the parallels between the first Anglo-Afghan war and the war on terror; and what the West could learn from his book.

title: Aid Group Hit by Car Bomb in Damascus
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  As fighting raged in the Damascus suburbs, a car bomb exploded in the southern Zahraa district on Thursday, killing one person and damaging the headquarters of the Syrian Arab Red Crescent relief organization, state news media reported.

title: How the Death With Dignity Initiative Failed in Massachusetts
description: On election night, Jim Carberry and others who had worked to put a Death With Dignity law on the Massachusetts ballot gathered in the back room of a Waltham restaurant and watched their effort go down to narrow defeat.

title: Shipping Horses Is Risky, but Hong Kong Race Is Enticing
description: Horses from around the world, and the people who own and look after them, have been traveling over the past week to take part in the Hong Kong International Races, four Group 1 contests at Sha Tin Racecourse on Sunday. Once they land, they get red-carpet treatment that the owners and trainers will probably be talking about for years.

title: Billionaire Sells Stake in Topshop for $805 Million
description: The British billionaire Philip Green sold a 25 percent stake in the Topshop retail chain to the American private equity firm Leonard Green & Partners, which co-owns the J. Crew brand, for about $805 million.

title: Daimler Sells Half Its Stake in EADS for $2.2 Billion
description: LONDON  The German carmaker Daimler sold half of its stake in the aerospace giant European Aeronautic Defense and Space on Thursday in deal worth 1.7 billion euros ($2.2 billion).

title: Eggnog the Hard Way
description: Around this time last year, I advocated forgoing eggnog in favor of glogg, the Scandinavian mulled wine. Im not here to issue a mea culpa, but Im also not proud when it comes to holiday drinks and certainly not above a little backpedaling.

title: How to Tame a Wild Pork Chop
description: Here, then, were two young people climbing through a canyon in morning half-light, Central Texas, stalking hogs. They were private chefs enjoying a morning free of clients, smelling faintly of the Angora sweater one of the chefs wore and also of last nights red wine. They were headachy, and trying not to stumble in the scree that tumbled off the canyons walls as pigs above them rooted amid low oak and thickets of juniper. They had one rifle between them, and they walked slowly, heel to toe, so as not to make noise.

title: A Social Business Strikes a Deal With Big Tobacco
description: A few months ago I wrote a blog post about TerraCycles intention to create a national recycling program for all waste, even including cigarette butts. As our programs have grown, we have had frequent internal debates about what kinds of companies we want to partner with to help them make their waste recyclable (which in turn makes their products greener).

title: Afghan Spy Chief Is Wounded in Attack, Officials Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A Taliban suicide bomber tried to assassinate the influential new chief of Afghanistans intelligence service at an agency guesthouse in Kabul on Thursday, officials said, in a brazen attack that left him seriously wounded and underscored the insurgencys ability to go after those at the highest levels of the government.

title: Morsi and the Balance of Power
description: Egypt erupted in violent clashes after President Morsi seized temporary powers beyond the review of any court.

title: View From Boston on Sanchez: Thanks, Rex
description: Perhaps its the holiday spirit, but Patriots fans and Jets management seem to be in rare agreement these days. Any rancor in an intense rivalry has been replaced by thanks, deep thanks. The Jets want Mark Sanchez to be the starting quarterback. And so, it turns out, do Patriots fans.

title: Deutsche Bank Says Report That It Hid Losses Lacks Merit
description: PARIS  The big German lender Deutsche Bank on Thursday denied a report that it had hidden $12 billion in losses during the financial crisis. The bank said charges made by whistle-blowers had been investigated previously and found to be without merit.

title: Thai Ex-Premier Charged With Murder Over Crackdown in 2010
description: HONG KONG  The former prime minister of Thailand, Abhisit Vejjajiva, was charged with murder on Thursday in connection with his role in a military crackdown on antigovernment protesters in Bangkok two and a half years ago.

title: Congo Peace Talks Set to Open in Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Congolese rebels and government officials prepared on Thursday for direct peace talks in the Ugandan capital, Kampala, their first face-to-face encounter since the rebels relinquished Goma, one of the Democratic Republic of Congos principal cities, after capturing it last month.

title: Simpson-Bowles Explained
description: Alex Pareene gets it:

title: On Dwindling Savannas, Lions at Risk
description: When armchair travelers think of the African savanna, they may conjure images of vast expanses of untouched wilderness.

title: Pressure Grows on Swiss Banks to Expose Tax Cheats Billions
description: LONDON  Spare a thought for wealthy tax cheats.

title: European Central Bank Cuts Growth Forecast
description: FRANKFURT  Acknowledging that the economy is likely to remain weak well into next year, the European Central Bank sharply reduced its growth forecast for the euro zone Thursday, and left its main interest rate unchanged at a record low of 0.75 percent.

title: Kissing Cousins: One Is President
description: Peering into famous bedrooms is a pastime of biographers and filmmakers alike, and this season offers several opportunities for the nosily inclined. Alfred Hitchcock, as well as Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton, have all recently received the keyhole treatment; even Abraham Lincoln helps loosen Marys corset in the otherwise buttoned-up Lincoln. And in Hyde Park on Hudson, filmgoers can watch some presidential pleasuring, courtesy of Franklin Delano Roosevelt (Bill Murray) and his obliging cousin, Daisy Suckley (Laura Linney).

title: Week 13 Film Review, Horror Edition
description: Andy Benoit takes a closer look at some Week 13 matchups, with the benefit of film analysis.

title: In Shift of Jobs, Apple Will Make Some Macs in U.S.
description: Apple plans to join a small but growing number of companies that are bringing some manufacturing jobs back to the United States, drawn by the growing economic and political advantages of producing in their home market.

title: Notes on Current Research
description: Busy today, so just quick notes on two recent working papers.

title: Thursday Reading: Avoiding Too Much Stuff at the Holidays
Technology in the Classroom
description: Dear Diary:

title: Recurring Name in Insider Trading Inquiry: SAC
description: In the governments long-running investigation into insider trading, one hedge fund has continued to surface: SAC Capital Advisors, the $14 billion firm run by Steven A. Cohen. With federal prosecutors now going after a former SAC portfolio manager, DealBooks Peter Lattman reports that the trail to SAC has emerged out of a cluster of cases, many of them connected to the prosecution of the fallen titan Raj Rajaratnam. Investigators heard SAC traders on incriminating wiretaps; in other instances, cooperators and informants accused the fund of misconduct.

title: Toronto-Dominion to Buy Epoch for $668 Million
description: The Canadian lender Toronto-Dominion Bank agreed on Thursday to buy the parent company of Epoch Investment Partners for $668 million, as it moved to bolster its asset management operations in the United States.

title: Diamondback to Close After Investors Withdraw $520 Million
description: Diamondback Capital Management, one of several hedge funds ensnared in the governments insider-trading investigations, will close down after investors asked to withdraw $520 million in capital, the firm wrote in a letter to investors on Thursday.

title: Daily Report: Apple to Bring Some Manufacturing to U.S.
description: For the first time in years, Apple will manufacture computers in the United States, the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, said in interviews with NBC and Bloomberg Businessweek.

title: A Note for the Transit Chief: Beware the Endorsement From Giuliani
description: If the mass-transit chief, Joseph J. Lhota, is serious about running for mayor next year, he ought to start worrying about the enthusiastic support he is getting from former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani. As Mr. Lhota surely knows  he was Mr. Giulianis deputy at City Hall, after all  a blessing from his old boss is a political version of the kiss of death.

title: The Brotherhood of Combat
description: Marine Corps boot camp inundated us with footage from Iwo Jima, images from Chosin Reservoir and stories of Khe Sanh. As I deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan I pondered what it is during the horrors of combat that drives us on, and if the experiences of war are the same across generations.

title: Viva la Villa | Vampires in Volterra
description: Adventures in house-hunting: a writer chronicles her attempt to find the perfect home in Italy.

title: General Atlantic Takes Stake in Brazilian Firm
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The American private equity firm General Atlantic has agreed to invest $200 million for a minority stake in the Brazilian financial services firm XP Investimentos.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: British Newspapers Regulation Plan; and Brubeck, Jazz Popularizer
description: Britains main national newspapers on Wednesday agreed to the establishment of an independent newspaper regulator with far greater powers than the current, much-criticized regulation system, John F. Burns reports. The agreement came after pressure from Prime Minister David Cameron, who has agreed with the publishers that any change in regulation should be voluntary, and not be written into law, as was recommended by the Leveson inquiry, which investigated press abuses in Britain. Mr. Burns writes:

title: Trust Women Conference: A Delegates Reflections
description: LONDON  The first Trust Women conference, hosted by Thomson Reuters Foundation and the International Herald Tribune in London this week, boasted an impressive line up of speakers  from Melanne Verveer, the U.S. ambassador-at-large for global womens issues to Christy Turlington Burns of Every Mother Counts to Queen Noor of Jordan, to name a few.

title: TimesTalks: 'Promised Land'
description: Hugo Lindgren talks with Matt Damon, John Krasinski and Gus Van Sant about "Promised Land."

title: Week 14 in Fantasy Football: Thursdays Matchup
description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: What Were Reading
description: NPR: The dairy cliff: milk producers, who have no safety net, would be hit hard if Congress does not pass a new farm bill.  Maria Newman

title: Sorry, Lincoln, That Wasnt Your Day
description: The National Board of Review had its say on Wednesday, and it was a good day for everyone except the more than 100 actors (not to mention the hundreds of crew members, dozens of producers and one very important writer and celebrated director) in Lincoln.

title: Starbucks Offers to Pay More British Tax Than Required
description: PARIS  Starbucks offered on Wednesday to pay about 10 million ($16.05 million) a year in corporate taxes in Britain  or 10 million more than it paid last year  in an effort to defuse protests against its lack of contributions to public coffers at a time when ordinary taxpayers are feeling the effects of government spending cuts.

title: A Fresh Look at the Not-So-Dark Side of Earth
description: Fresh imagery showing the increasingly illuminated night side of Earth has been produced by NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. This is one of the clearest visible signs of the Anthropocene  an era in which one species, us, is becoming a planet-scale influence. The imagery also shows big dark gaps in populous places  reflecting the reality that some 1.3 billion people still lack access to electricity.

title: Searching for Latinos in Childrens Literature: A Reading List
description: Where are all the Latinos? Thats the question raised in an article published Wednesday in The Times that focused on the dearth of books with Latino characters that are aimed at school-age children. (No disrespect meant to the hugely popular Dora the Explorer or her cousin Diego, who started as cartoons.) This is an especially relevant issue given the increasing number of the countrys public school seats occupied by Latinos.

title: An Age-Old Question: Readers Debate Science and Theology
description: Last weeks essay, Between Rock of Ages and a Hard Place, by Nicholas Wade, on a comment by Senator Marco Rubio of Florida that the age of the earth was one of the great mysteries, prompted dozens of letters. Here are some of them, followed by a response from Mr. Wade.

title: Opinion Report: Another Hurdle for Debt Talks
description: From the editorial page

title: Partners Stake in Goldman Sachs Rises
description: The number of partners at Goldman Sachs has remained steady. But the elite groups ownership in the Wall Street firm is rising.

title: A Money Saving Phone Service Is Revived
description: In past years I have advised people looking to lower their phone bills to try the Web site Validas. It let them electronically enter their phone bills, which it analyzed, then suggested lower-priced plans that still gave them the same service or better.

title: Mayor Pledges to Rebuild and Fortify Coast
description: New York City, still reeling from the impact of Hurricane Sandy, will expand its evacuation zones, tighten building codes and look for ways to fortify critical infrastructure like transportation and electrical networks from future natural disasters, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Thursday.

title: Carnegie Hall Dream Comes True for Medgar Everss Widow
description: Myrlie Evers-Williams, the widow of the slain civil rights leader Medgar Evers, has long shared the dream of many an aspiring musician: playing Carnegie Hall. Now, at age 79, Ms. Evers-Williams will get that chance, thanks to the persuasive power of the pop orchestra Pink Martini.

title: Up in the Air
description: BERLIN  Its the citys biggest construction project since the Berlin Wall. But 20 years after it was first conceived and almost $4 billion dollars later, Berlins new airport is a hulking empty terminal with no planes and no passengers.

title: Ian McEwan: By the Book
description: The author of Atonement and, most recently, Sweet Tooth, believes the greatest reading pleasure has an element of self-annihilation.

title: A King of Art With the Midas Touch
description: NEW HAVEN

title: Yale University Art Gallery
description: Images of renovations at the museum.

title: Ben Brantley Answers Readers Questions, Part 2
description: Yesterday Ben Brantley, the chief theater critic of The New York Times, answered readers questions about new scores, populist theater and other topics. Following is the final installment of his responses.

title: Feeling For | Woodcut Notecards
description: Beautiful and strangely emotive, Woodcut was easily one of 2012s best coffee table books. It collected the artist Bryan Nash Gills dramatic relief prints of tree-trunk cross sections in his native Connecticut. Ahead of the holiday giving season, Princeton Architectural Press has turned Gills images into a lovely set of 12 notecards and envelopes. $16; papress.com.

title: Tea Party Hero Is Leaving the Senate for a New Pulpit
description: WASHINGTON  With a disappointing election in his rear view mirror and a budget compromise he could never swallow on the horizon, SenatorJim DeMint, the conservative Republican from South Carolina who helped ignite the Tea Party movement, is leaving the Senate to become president of theHeritage Foundation, a conservative research group.

title: Keeping Score: Early Contenders for Most Improved Player
description: With the first full month of the 2012-13 N.B.A. season in the books, many pundits have pegged Jrue Holiday, who leads the Philadelphia 76ers in scoring and is second in the league in assists (but also leads the league in turnovers), as their early choice for most improved player.

title: How Should New York Rebuild?
description: On Wednesday night, New York Universitys Institute for Public Knowledge sponsored a public forum on the recent superstorms implications for New York City, where many low-lying areas face a long and painful recovery  if full recovery is indeed the goal. Moderated by Chelsea Clinton, now a special correspondent for NBC News, the forum included four panelists from the fields of earth science, climate science, philosophy and sociology who reflected on how the likelihood of more frequent storm surges might be woven into the citys urban planning.

title: Blocks From Art Basel, Artists with More Modest Hopes
description: MIAMI BEACH  As dealers in the main fair at Art Basel Miami Beach were counting up six- and seven-figure sales from Wednesdays V.I.P. preview, participants in SELECT, one of the numerous nearby satellite fairs here, were welcoming guests at the Catalina Hotel.
