The hopeful artists and gallery owners who paid $4,000 to $5,000 to transform one of the hotels 64 rooms into a mini gallery, installation space or performance site had different expectations than their brethren a few blocks away.

title: Image of the Day: Dec. 6
Video: Van Catches Fire Outside St. Patricks
description: File this one under common occurrence in uncommon location: a van caught fire and burned for an hour Wednesday night on Fifth Avenue and 50th Street, in front of St. Patricks Cathedral and across from Rockefeller Center. No one was injured in the fire, which was reported around 6:50 p.m. and put out by 7:48, the Fire Department said.

title: Michael Caine, Scene Partner
description: In the annals of things the Bagger never expected to do  a long list including but not limited to hugging R2-D2; playing paintball with the star of an Oscar-winning film; and dressing up like a demented ballet demon  acting opposite Michael Caine ranked pretty high.

title: Elizabeth Warren Still Carrying Campaign Debt
description: BOSTON  A final fund-raising haul of more than $42 million was not enough to keep Elizabeth Warrens Senate campaign out of debt.

title: Following the Debt Talks
description: What both sides have offered in the negotiations over the nations fiscal path.

title: BMW Recalling 30,000 X5 Sport Utilities
description: BMW is recalling almost 30,000 of its diesel-powered 2009-12 X5 sport utilities because the power-assist for the steering may fail, according to a report from the automaker posted on the Web site of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Hollywood Heroines
description: Ingnues, icons, action heroes, divas and the worlds next great comedy star: 13 actresses who gave the dreamiest performances of 2012.

title: Remembering the Helping Hands of a Subway Hero
description: Sometimes people do step up and help.

title: The Portrait of a Lady
description: Thats amazing! Youre amazing! Thats astonishing! Youre astonishing!

title: Hollywoods Year of Heroine Worship
description: Ordinarily, the unemployment of a film critic would be the very definition of a dog-bites-man story, but the circumstances that separated Michael Calleri from his job at The Niagara Falls Reporter, a small weekly newspaper in upstate New York, were sufficiently peculiar  and also sufficiently resonant  to go a bit viral, stirring up a minor storm on the Internet and attracting the attention of a network morning-news show. This was a man-bites-man story that also turned out to be a man-freaks-out-about-women story. In a long narrative uploaded in November by Roger Ebert on The Chicago Sun-Timess Web site, Calleri quoted an e-mail from his boss, Frank Parlato (curiously unnamed in the article), who had recently taken over as editor and publisher of The Reporter. Parlato was not, to put it mildly, a fan of Calleris movie reviews, but his real problem was with the movies themselves. I dont want to publish reviews of films where women are alpha and men are beta, he wrote. Where women are heroes and villains and men are just lesser versions or shadows of females.

title: Hollywood Heroines
description: Ingnues, icons, action heroes, divas and the worlds next great comedy star: 13 actresses who gave the dreamiest performances of 2012.

title: Jennifer Lawrence in 'The Hunger Games'
description: A performance by one of the magazines heroic heroines of 2012.

title: Naomi Watts in 'The Impossible'
description: A performance by one of the magazines heroic heroines of 2012.

title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
description: A performance from "Beasts of the Southern Wild" by one of the magazine's heroic heroines of 2012.

title: Netanyahu, in Visit to Germany, Defends Settlement Plans
description: BERLIN  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel gave no ground on Thursday over his plans to expand Jewish settlements, which have been widely criticized by European allies.

title: Ideas for English Language Learners | Celebrate the Holidays
description: This months edition of Ideas for E.L.Ls celebrates the holidays  Christmas, Hanukkah, Kwanzaa, New Years, even winter break  but, of course, just as you can pick, choose and adapt ideas from previous posts in this series, much of what we suggest below can be taught any time of year.

title: Research: Parents Less Likely to Die Young
description: From the annals of Research Studies We Appreciate, Even Though We Arent Quite Sure What to Do With the Information, via The Atlantic: being a parent means youre less likely to die before your time.

title: N.H.L. Owners and Players Expected to Resume Talks
description: 3:21 p.m. | Updated The hard work of hammering out a settlement to the N.H.L. lockout resumed on its 82nd day Thursday morning, as players reconvened to consider the owners latest counteroffer.

title: Yankees Offer Youkilis One-Year Deal to Play Third
description: NASHVILLE  The Yankees took a step toward filling their hole at third base Thursday by making a one-year, $12 million offer to the free agent Kevin Youkilis.

title: Not a Member of the Kathryn Bigelow Fan Club
description: As she has made Oscar history as the first woman to win an Academy Award for directing, Kathryn Bigelow, the filmmaker behind The Hurt Locker and the forthcoming Zero Dark Thirty, has remained gracious and graceful about her place in the cinematic canon. Not so Bret Easton Ellis, who took to Twitter to deliver his opinion on her films, her gender and her looks:

title: Soccers Celluoid Antihero: Heleno
description: Heleno de Freitas tortured defenders to distraction and himself to death.

title: Why Does My Food Have Less Flavor?
description: They are a ghastly orange color when they tumble out of their crinkly package with its flamelike logo, and salt mines and chemical plants may come to mind when you eat the first one, but, man, those tortilla chips are tasty. Or maybe its just that you can actually taste them. Because sorry, Charlie: as we get older, there may come a time when we find ourselves drawn not to food with good taste or food that tastes good but simply to food that has any flavor at all.

title: Open Source Science Fair Video
description: Did you miss our Open Source Science Fair last month? Or are you just ready to relive all the fun of it? Either way, youll want to watch the videos of the event. Thanks to NYT developer David Seguin for his excellent camera work. Enjoy!

title: U.S. Military to Monitor for Rocket
description: WASHINGTON  The commander of American military forces in the Pacific region said Thursday that warships equipped with advanced radar and other ballistic-missile defense systems were being relocated to monitor a potential rocket launching by North Korea.

title: Rabbis Apologize for Tone of E-Mail on U.N. Vote
description: Facing outrage from some of their members, the rabbis who lead Congregation Bnai Jeshurun, a prominent synagogue in Manhattan, expressed regret Thursday at the tone of an e-mail that they sent last week celebrating the controversial vote by the United Nations to upgrade Palestine to observer-state status.

title: Memo From Miami | Design Now
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Love Unleashed on the London Stage
description: LONDONLove may or may not make the world go round, but its certainly doing its bit for the London theater. On stages large and small, across new plays and revivals and musicals, too, the vagaries of passion are fueling one show after another. Cantiamo DAmore  we sing of love  or so announces a number in Kiss Me, Kate, the Cole Porter musical that has been newly revived in a Trevor Nunn-directed production at the Old Vic that, truth be told, is a mixed bag.

title: Does Apples Tim Cook Want an Apple Television?
description: Apple customers have beenyearningfor it for years. And now, it seems,the chief executive of Apple, Timothy D. Cook, wants one too: an Apple-made television.

title: Huffington Post Names New C.E.O.
description: The Huffington Post has a new day-to-day business boss.

title: Art Basel Miami Beach
description: The annual contemporary art fair kicked off on Wednesday with a public event.

title: Clinton Praises Rice, a Possible Successor
description: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton praised Susan E. Rice, the United Nations ambassador and a leading contender to be the next secretary of state, during a news conference in Dublin on Thursday.

title: Excerpt: 'Golden Boy'
description: Seth Numrich, Tony Shalhoub and Danny Burstein in a scene from Lincoln Center Theater's revival of the Clifford Odets play.

title: Crusading New Orleans Prosecutor to Quit, Facing Staff Misconduct
description: NEW ORLEANS  Once again, as he has for over a decade, Jim Letten, the chief federal prosecutor here, appeared before reporters, just as he regularly has to announce that some suspiciously well-connected city contractor was facing a lengthy spell behind bars. But this time was different.

title: Why Breaking Up H.P. Makes Sense
description: David Packard and William Hewlett may be Silicon Valleys answer to Romulus and Remus in Romes founding story, but the era of their brainchild, Hewlett-Packard, as an everything-to-everyone conglomerate is coming to an end. Its chief executive, Meg Whitman, and its board, not to mention investors, wont stick around for an arduous and risky five-year turnaround project. Breaking the company into good bits and selling bad ones must be on the agenda for 2013.

title: Doing the Shareholder Sidestep
description: It may be an ego-bruising realization, but sometimes in a deal public shareholders just dont matter.

title: Best Bets for Finding the Snow
description: Forget racing down the slopes. The sport skiers have had to master in recent years has been chasing the snow.

title: Creating Winter for Cross-Country Skiers
description: THEY came by the dozens, drawn to a white oasis in a land of green and brown. A high school teacher and eight students drove halfway across Vermont. A lawyer made the trip from his home, an hour away. Three vans pulled into the dirt parking lot at noon and disgorged 22 Bates College students, bleary-eyed after the four-hour drive from Maine.

title: Jazz Impresario to Present Shows at Iridium
description: One of the most celebrated jazz impresarios in the country is starting over, booking a new series of concerts at Iridium in Midtown Manhattan after stepping down from his longtime post at Jazz at Lincoln Center.

title: Second Bnai Jeshurun Leadership E-mail on Palestine
description: The text of an e-mail from a Manhattan synagogues rabbis to congregants to clarify an earlier e-mail on the U.N.s decision to upgrade Palestine to observer state status.

title: Deadly Clashes in Cairo
description: TimesCast: Chaos and violence spread in Egypt. | American arms fall into Jihadis hands. |  Can the N.H.L. save itself? | Inviting in the ghosts in TriBeCa.

title: T-Mobile Will Sell Apple Devices in 2013
description: 3:28 p.m. | Updated  Adding analyst comment.

title: U.S. Senate Passes Russian Trade Bill, With a Human Rights Caveat
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate voted on Thursday to finally eliminate cold war-era trade restrictions on Russia, but at the same time it condemned Moscow for human rights abuses, threatening to further strain an already delicate relationship with the Kremlin.

title: The Whale Shark
description: tk

title: Honeymooners Musical to Open in San Diego
description: A new musical based on the beloved 1950s sitcom The Honeymooners will be produced next fall at the Old Globe theater in San Diego.

title: Trisha Brown to Retire From Making New Work
description: Two new dances by the choreographer Trisha Brown to be performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music beginning in January will be the final works of her career, a spokesperson for the Trisha Brown Dance Company said on Thursday.

title: Snapshots From Doha and Elsewhere
description: DOHA, Qatar  Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton is not attending the annual United Nations climate change summit meeting under way here in the Qatari capital. In fact, she has not attended one since the largely unsuccessful conclave in Copenhagen three years ago, which was supposed to produce a new global agreement on climate change but instead dissolved into near chaos.

title: The Meaning of Kobe Bryant at 30,000
description: If you read the headlines, you know that Kobe Bryant became the youngest N.B.A. player to score 30,000 points after dropping 29 Wednesday night in a victory over the New Orleans Hornets. Only four other players  Michael Jordan, Karl Malone, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Wilt Chamberlain  hit that mark, so it is a meaningful accomplishment.

title: Wider Chaos Feared as Syrian Rebels Clash With Kurds
description: CEYLANPINAR, Turkey  In plain view of the patrons at an outdoor cafe here in this border town, the convoy of gun trucks waving the flag of the Syrian rebels whizzed through the Syrian village of Ras al-Ain. They had not come to fight their primary enemy, the soldiers of Bashar al-Assads government. They had rushed in to battle the ethnic Kurds.

title: Living Under Great Expectations
description: In Great Expectations the illustrious book editor Robert Gottlieb examines the long shadow cast by Charles Dickens over the lives of his children. This sketchy group biography could not have a better title, but Mr. Gottlieb takes an oddly equivocal position toward his material. On the one hand, the famously unhappy union between Dickens and Catherine Hogarth  who was cast off bitterly by her husband after she bore 10 children and experienced several miscarriages, all in a period of 15 years  makes him think of his own parents marriage. On the other, he is a father who identifies with Dickens and can sympathize to a certain extent with his frustrations.

title: A Small Victory for Whale Sharks
description: A video clip of a whale shark caught in a purse seine net.

title: CBS Tweaks Its Lineup, Adding a Drama and Returning to Rules of Engagement
description: CBS will make its usual complement of modest changes to its prime-time schedule for the second half of the television season, adding one new series and bringing back an old reliable bench player.

title: Look of The Moment | Anne Hathaway
description: The Look: Golden Revolution. A navy and gold bustier leads. The black pencil skirt, pointy-toe pumps and clutch follow suit.

title: Original Review: Golden Boy
description: Brooks Atkinsons original 1937 review of the Clifford Odets play.

title: A Big Art Lover, and Moneyman, Is Missing at the Fair
description: MIAMI BEACH  The opening of Art Basel Miami Beach, under way here this week, looked like the start of the most glamorous doorbuster sale in history, with hundreds of V.I.P.s streaming into the convention center wearing high-end resort casual, ready to rummage through more than 200 of the worlds most prestigious galleries.

title: Sounds of the Season
description: For better or for worse, the Miser was raised on rock n roll and, despite one opera-smitten grandfathers valiant efforts, grew up almost completely deprived of serious exposure to classical music.

title: Visit to West Bank by King Gives Palestinians a Lift
description: JERUSALEM  King Abdullah II of Jordan on Thursday became the first head of state to visit the West Bank since last weeks vote by the United Nations General Assembly upgraded the status of the Palestinians to nonmember observer state. It was a gesture of support that also underlined the importance of the vote to Jordan, analysts said.

title: A Liberal Take on Family and Opportunity
description: In the latest Foreign Affairs, Lane Kenworthy has an essay on opportunity in America that brings a liberal perspective to bear on themes that will be familiar to my readers in particular, the link between marriage and social mobility, and the ways in which family structure rather than race or gender is emerging as the biggest cleavage in 21st century America. The essay is well worth reading in full, both for its analysis and its policy prescriptions: Kenworthy ranges across marriage promotion, the child tax credit, education costs, mass incarceration, and class-based affirmative action, offering a more left-of-center (that is, somewhat more goverment-centric and free-spending) alternative to the pro-family, Party of Sams Club populism that certain writers have been urging on the Republican Party unsuccessfully for some time.

title: Dramatic Nuggets With a Certain Glow
description: WHO knows exactly when the golden age of New York theater was? But looking at Broadway and Off Broadway marquees this month you might think it was happening now, if only because of the titles of four recently opened shows.

title: A Coming-Out Story Starring the Filipino Clint Eastwood
description: The story is one familiar to filmgoers: a gay man afraid to come out of the closet because his Roman Catholic guilt wont let him acknowledge his true sexuality. But the setting of Bwakaw, the Philippines submission for the Oscar for best foreign-language film, is hardly typical: a quiet village in the tropics of Southeast Asia. Not only that, but also, the main characters co-star, for whom the film is named, is a stray dog.

title: Out With the New in South Carolina
description: Senator Jim DeMint, the South Carolina Republican and chief torch-and-pitchfork-carrier for the Tea Party, is resigning only two years into his second term to cash in on his public service with a high-paying job at that quintessential bastion of Washington establishment, the Heritage Foundation.

title: History Suggests Sanchez May Be Better Off Elsewhere
description: Coach Rex Ryan announced on Wednesday that Mark Sanchez would be the Jets starting quarterback on Sunday at Jacksonville. Ryan threw his support behind the incumbent quarterback, even saying that he was looking forward to seeing Mark play.

title: The Perfect Warm Drink for a Cold Night
description: If youre like me, you love the eggy, spicy flavor of chilled eggnog, which I write about in this months Drink column, but sometimes nothing but a warm drink will do on a cold winters night. Thats what makes the Tom & Jerry an excellent alternative (though some might bristle at the notion that its an alternative to anything  it stands on its own merits just fine).

title: A Disaster Scenario, Rewritten
description: I HAVE disaster fantasies.

title: The Fiscal Ignoramus Factor
description: Some of us had fun with the Business Insider poll finding that by a large margin, people who thought they knew something about the fiscal cliff believed that it would increase, not reduce, the deficit. Ha ha ha  although I actually have a lot of sympathy for ordinary voters, who dont follow these things closely but know that everyone important has been warning for years that the budget deficit is Worse than H!lter or something. How are they supposed to know that those very same people are now screaming that the deficit is coming down too fast?

title: European Leaders Oppose Issuing Common Debt
description: BRUSSELS  Four of the European Unions top officials delivered their judgment Thursday on how best to shore up the euro zone  and seemed to do so in a German accent.

title: Drafters of Communications Treaty Are Split on Issue of Internet Governance
description: PARIS  Nearly a week into a global conference to draft a treaty on the future of international telecommunications, delegates remain divided on a fundamental question: should the Internet feature in the discussions?

title: To Elf or Not to Elf
description: The Elf on the Shelf first entered my consciousness a few years ago, when my oldest daughter came home from a clearly hip-and-ahead-of-the-curve friends house after Thanksgiving and declared that the family had an elf.

title: In Obamas Plan to Tax Rich, $250,000 Figure May Mislead
description: President Obamas insistence that marginal tax rates rise for families making more than $250,000 has convinced millions of affluent Americans that they are likely to be writing larger checks to the government next year.

title: Memo From Miami | Valentinos Pop Pois Party at the Webster
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: The Price on 25 Years Of Friendship
description: For 25 years, weve been friends with a self-employed real estate broker. We socialize, and my doctor husband has never charged her family for office visits. Recently, we asked her to prepare a commercial lease. She did, and we thanked her with a gift card. But we were stunned to learn that she included her customary $100 monthly management fee. We signed it and have been paying, but not happily. Was I unreasonable to expect her services to be gratis? Anonymous

title: Gas Tanker Completes Arctic Sea Journey
description: A bit of news about the melting of the Arctic waterways associated with climate change:

title: A New Airport App in Time for Holiday Travel
description: The Web site Nerdwallet, which earlier this year introduced a tool to help consumers compare airline fees, has added a new feature to its travel site in time for the holidays, to help save time and money at airports.

title: Dogs Behind the Wheel? Bad News for Cats
description: News out of New Zealand this week that dogs there are being taught to drive is discombobulating on so many levels that its difficult to know how to process it. A branch of the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals there, as a stunt to show that dogs awaiting adoption are smart and have all sorts of potential, has apparently taught three shelter dogs to drive and will showcase their skills behind the wheel of a Mini Countryman in a television broadcast on Monday.

title: Pogues 12 Days of Gadgets: Monopoly, the Zapped Edition
description: Ho-ho-ho, people! Time to rack your brains to come up with cool gifts for the tech nuts in your life.

title: Inventing Abstraction at MoMA, Collaboration With WQXR
description: Its not often that you leave a major museum exhibition with strains of Schoenberg or Webern or Debussy running through your head. It is even less often that you can listen to these and other compositions created around the same time both at the show and on a playlist, which is available on Q2, WQXRs online contemporary classical station.

title: At Random House, Employees Will Enjoy 5,000 Shades of Green
description: Random House had its corporate Christmas party on Wednesday night in New York, and word is that Santa likes bondage. A lot.

title: Scene City: Art Basel Heads to the Beach
description: Chanel, ASAP Rocky and Silencio (and Demi Moore) made a splash on Wednesday night.

title: The Debate Over Cuts to Entitlements
description: TimesCast Politics: Senator Bernard Sanders of Vermont pushes for no cuts to entitlements. | Possible 2016 contenders meet with donors. | Clinton discusses Syria with Russian counterpart.

title: Romneys Chief Strategist Dissects Campaign
description: The first postcampaign book has yet to hit shelves, but on Wednesday, Stuart Stevens, the chief strategist of Mitt Romneys 2012 presidential bid, offered his own take on the race on The Charlie Rose Show. In an extended and wide-ranging interview, Mr. Stevens was by turns defiant, humble, philosophical and revisionist.

title: Tips on Enjoying the Holidays More Simply
description: [Update: Answers on this subject can be seen here. ] This week Ask the Expert features Kristin van Ogtrop, who will be answering questions about ways to simplify your life this holiday season. Ms. van Ogtrop, who has spent her career at magazines, has been managing editor of Real Simple since 2003 and oversees Adventures in Chaos, a blog where she writes about life as a working mother. She is author of Just Let Me Lie Down: Necessary Terms for the Half-Insane Working Mom, published by Little Brown in 2010.

title: Fighting the Calm After the Storm
description: How can you have a corner store with no one on your block?

title: Obama Calls for Day of Service to Kick Off Inaugural Festivities
description: President Obama, following a tradition he began four years ago, announced Thursday that he would begin his inaugural festivities with a National Day of Service, and has asked Americans to organize and participate in community service projects on Jan. 19, the day before he is sworn into office for his second term.

title: Damning Review of Gas Study Prompts a Shakeup at the University of Texas
description: The University of Texas said today that it has accepted the findings of a damning independent review of the preparation of a report on potential impacts of shale gas drilling by the schools Energy Institute. The school said it will undertake six recommended actions, the most significant being the withdrawal of papers from the Energy Institutes Web site related to the report until they are submitted for fresh expert review.

title: Lhota Boasts in Washington of M.T.A. Success but Is Quiet on Any Political Dreams
description: WASHINGTON  As enthusiasm builds in certain political quarters for a mayoral bid by Joseph J. Lhota, no one seems more eager to highlight his achievements as head of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority than Mr. Lhota himself.

title: Pentagons Top Lawyer to Resign
description: Jeh C. Johnson, the Obama administrations top lawyer at the Pentagon, will step down at the end of December, the military said on Thursday. Over the course of President Obamas first term, Mr. Johnson was a central player in some of the most important legal policy deliberations of the administration.

title: Frederick Neumann, Actor, Director and Interpreter of Beckett, Dies at 86
description: Frederick Neumann, an actor and director whose affinity for Samuel Becketts works and his friendship with the man himself helped forge the distinguished New York experimental troupe Mabou Mines, died on Nov. 27 at his home in Kingston, N.J. He was 86.

title: Freedom of the Press for Posterity
description: Political panic often leads to bad laws and regulations, especially where basic liberties are involved, such as freedom of the press. That seems to be happening in Britain right now as politicians and editors scramble to appease public fury over the lawless behavior of sensationalist tabloids, such as The Sun and The News of The World (which stopped publishing in 2011).

title: BMW 4 Series Goes Long and Low
description: BMW models have been growing lower, longer and softer, as if they were being heated up, then gently tugged from each end. The new Concept Four released in advance of its appearance during press days at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit in January is longer, lower and less angular than the current 3 Series coupe, whose successor it seems to be.

title: There Will Always Be a Fantasy England
description: Starring Elizabeth McGovern asHetty Thatcham, the widowed matriarch of a well-heeled British clan, Cheerful Weather for the Wedding may look like an offshoot of Downton Abbey.But the sour, dispirited characters, whoconvene at a mansion in Devon in December 1932 for the nuptials of Dolly (Felicity Jones), theelder and prettier of Hettys two daughters, have none of the spunk of the aristocrats on Downton Abbey.

title: Oscar Niemeyer: In Memoriam
A 56-Game N.H.L. Schedule Is a Possibility
description: With the nearly three-month N.H.L. lockout lurching uncertainly toward a conclusion, fans can start to consider how much of the season can be saved. With the schedule through Dec. 14 canceled, and more games likely to be canceled later this week, the best hope may be for a 56-game schedule.

title: Kanzaburo Nakamura, Stalwart of Kabuki, Dies at 57
description: Kanzaburo Nakamura XVIII, a star of Japans Kabuki theater who broke from tradition to bring that stylized art form to younger generations and audiences overseas, died on Wednesday in Tokyo. He was 57.

title: Holiday Balls of Fun
description: Nearly 30 years ago, I spent an exorbitant $6 on a tiny Santa in a basket tied to a wooden red and white hot air balloon. I was newly in love, and it was our first Christmas together. When my partner died of AIDS, I vowed to keep our ornament collection going. And thats the only reason my new partner (17 years new), who is Jewish, agrees to cohabit each December with an elaborately decorated Christmas tree. Or rather trees. My sizable collection now requires a second tree, for dog ornaments only. Every year I vow not to buy any more ornaments, and every year I encounter irresistible offerings all over New York.

title: Spotify Event Tries to Bury the Old Feuds Between Artists and Napster
description: Could a single bro-hug symbolize healing for the music industry after a decade of digital strife?

title: A Kaleidoscopic Cave Pulsing With Energy
description: Animal Collective perches itself between irritating and exhilarating  an unstable position that demands frequent readjustments. At Terminal 5 on Wednesday night, it found one euphoric balance.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Thank-You Notes for Cash Gifts

title: No Tax Increase for Many Wealthy Families
description: President Obama says he wants married couples to pay higher taxes on income above $250,000. But his plan actually excludes most joint filers making less than $300,000  and many who make more.

title: The Alchemy of Debris Forged Into Passion
description: Thomas Lanigan-Schmidt makes luminous art out of trash: candy wrappers, cling wrap, reflective plastics, aluminum foil, plastic bottles, beer cans and too many other kinds of cheap refuse to list. In and of itself, this is unremarkable; artists make work out of all kinds of stuff. What is impressive is how Mr. Lanigan-Schmidts dedication to his materials and hobbylike processes has yielded an oeuvre of transcending beauty, eroticized religiosity and poignant autobiography.

title: Up Front
description: Our choice of the 10 Best Books of 2012 reflects an unusually strong year, one in which, to cite a single example, the graphic novel achieved new heights of mastery in Chris Wares Building Stories. This years list also includes more traditional works, but they too range beyond the familiar. Katherine Boos Behind the Beautiful Forevers explores, with the authors matchless empathy, the netherworld of Mumbai. Saudi Arabia is both visited and reimagined in Dave Eggerss Hologram for the King. In The Yellow Birds, Kevin Powers brings home the Iraq war in uncannily evocative prose. And Jim Holts pursuit of the most fundamental of philosophical questions, in Why Does the World Exist?, leads him across time zones and intellectual disciplines.

title: Evans Could Return Friday; Lopez Still Out
description: Reggie Evans is expected to return to the rotation Friday when the Nets host the Golden State Warriors. Brook Lopez, however, will miss his fourth straight game.

title: The Familiar Shares the Stage With a Debut
description: The unexpected sight of an arts organizations chief executive taking the stage to make an announcement before a performance is usually cause for concern. Did the star soloist break a nail? Was the conductor stuck in rush-hour traffic? Was some other awkward intrigue afoot?

title: And the Award for Most Flops Goes To
description: The Nets are chasing the Knicks and the Miami Heat for supremacy in the Eastern Conference, but they do lead the N.B.A. in one unfortunate category: flops.

title: Oysters and Sparkling Wines
description: I recently realized that the combination of oysters and Champagne is one of my comfort foods. And it has become more readily available since I learned how to open oysters (much more difficult than clams) and acquired a really sturdy, proper knife for the task. Open a bottle of bubbly? Thats a walk in the park in comparison.

title: Drinks, Live Music and That Head-Nodding Thing Dads Do
description: A quiet drink does not mean a silent one. Conversation is usually in order. Music is, too; a thoughtful playlist is almost always a requisite. Live? That works.

title: Deft Hands Behind the Bubbles
description: YOURE going to be looking for sparkling wine, you want specific suggestions and the wine panel is here to help you.

title: The Giving Spree | Yvette Van Boven
description: Who: The Dutch chef Yvette van Boven, author of the cookbooks Home Made and Home Made Winter, who was photographed in her Amsterdam apartment by The Selby for Dutch Oven, which ran in Ts winter fashion issue.

title: YouTube Tries to Become More Like TV
description: At the end of the day, many of us flop on the couch and turn on the TV to channel surf. But if YouTube has its way, more of us will be channel surfing the online video service instead.

title: Black and Jewish Music, Kentucky Cabinets, Magician Posters
description: Framed sheet music has been hung throughout the Harlem restaurant Settepani, and the song titles and graphics at times caricature African-Americans.

title: Sorting Out a Chinese Puzzle in Auditing
description: Imagine for a moment that you were auditing a company whose principal asset was trees that it would eventually cut down to sell the timber. Would you bother to verify whether the company actually owned the trees? Would you make sure that the trees the company showed to your auditors were the same trees it claimed to own?

title: TimesCast Politics: The Debate Over Cuts to Entitlements
description: Jacquelyn Martin/Associated Press

title: Ann Hamiltons event of a thread
description: Scenes from the artist's installation at the Park Avenue Armory.

title: To Love  or Not  Les Miz
description: Stephen Colbert is proceeding to nerd out with his Hobbit Week; here at the Bagger, weve getting our Semaine des Misrables on (Les Miz Week for the uninitiated). Stay tuned for more from star Eddie Redmayne, who told us about the utter terror of performing in the Tom Hooper movie adaptation. In the meantime, get a load of what Bagger pal Sasha Stone, over at Awards Daily, calls two Oscartastic new TV spots for the film.

title: Totems That Tell About the Past and the Future
description: In Huma Bhabha: Unnatural Histories, at MoMA PS1, long-enduring forms from the ancient world lend some gravity to the throwaway materials that are now commonplace in contemporary sculpture. You could also say that the precariousness of recent assemblage and installation art haunts Ms. Bhabhas monstrous, totemic figures, which are typically made of Styrofoam, clay, rubber, wood scraps and wire mesh; either way, the juxtaposition is arresting.

title: Mark Kirk Is Returning to Senate
description: Senator Mark Kirk will return to the Senate on Jan. 3, nearly a year after having a stroke.

title: A Suns Influence on a Galaxy of Stars
description: PHILADELPHIA  Just under the wire, Ive found a top candidate for favorite museum show of the year in a sparkling piece of curatorial choreography called Dancing Around the Bride: Cage, Cunningham, Johns, Rauschenberg and Duchamp, at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. An ensemble performance entirely of stars, with an elusive sun, Marcel Duchamp, at the center, it focuses on a transformative moment in American Modernism when a heroic view of art ended, and another view, cool, wry and brainy, began.

title: City Settles With Disabled People Fraudulently Adopted in 90s and Abused
description: In a 1990s-era case that has been seen as a colossal breakdown in the citys foster care system, New York City will pay $9.7 million to settle a lawsuit filed on behalf of 10 disabled people who were fraudulently adopted as children by a Queens woman more than 15 years ago and were subjected to years of abuse.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Spain, Greece and the Philippines.

title: Living With Schizophrenia
description: To the Editor:

title: Advice and Consent
description: To the Editor:

title: A Model of Brevity
description: To the Editor:

title: Go Granny Go
description: To the Editor:

title: Man Charged in Trayvon Martins Death Sues NBC for Defamation
description: 5:51 p.m. | Updated  George Zimmerman, accused of second-degree murder in the shooting of Trayvon Martin earlier this year, filed suit against NBCUniversal on Thursday, alleging that news reports that edited his voice on a 911 tape constituted defamation and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

title: Veteran Broadway Producers Back Pippin
description: A few veteran Broadway producers have signed on as backers of a new staging of Pippin, increasing the likelihood that the musical  a beloved 1972 show that burnished the reputations of the composer Stephen Schwartz and the director Bob Fosse  will return to New York this spring for the first time since the original production closed in 1977.

title: Dreaming a Dream of More Awards
description: LOS ANGELES  Early in the coming movie adaptation of Les Misrables, Anne Hathaway and a group of grimy factory workers sing about another day dawning. Will it be a better one? Or will their toiling bring nothing for nothing?

title: Following Moms Footsteps, and Her Toe Work
description: DANCE is an art best passed from body to body. An older dancer will teach a role to a younger dancer. Shell communicate all she has learned performing over the years, the physical and the emotional, and in the process forge a bond that links artists from generation to generation.

title: Gauging the Storms Impact on Hiring
description: Just how big an effect will Hurricane Sandy have on employment?

title: S.E.C. Warns Netflix Over a Post on Facebook
description: Reed Hastings, the chief executive of Netflix, congratulated his team for a job well done in early July. On his public Facebook page, he crowed about the one billion hours of video that subscribers watched the previous month. The message was just 43 words.

title: Protesters Arrested Before Vote on Michigan Union Law
description: 8:04 p.m. | Updated LANSING, Mich.  Hundreds of union members protested at the State Capitol building on Thursday over so-called right-to-work legislation that Gov. Rick Snyder, a Republican, said he wanted to sign into law.

title: Ryan Johnson: Self Storage
description: the Suzanne Geiss Company

title: An Apartment for the Baby Phase
description: WHEN they met, set up by a friend, David Hollander was rooming with friends in Astoria, Queens, and Jaime McCarthy was sharing a seventh-floor walk-up on the Upper East Side.

title: Paul DeMuro: Revelations
description: Zrcher Studio

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Art

title: Too Old to Score Goals, He Still Lives to Score
description: Pity the athlete past his prime. Or at least pity George Dryer  he certainly does  who was once a mighty soccer champion, scoring goals for club and country across Europe, before he ran aground in the Virginia suburbs. Forced into retirement after an injury, George (Gerard Butler) lives in a rented guesthouse amid the trappings of his former glory: an old Alfa Romeo convertible; boxes of jerseys, trophies and cleats; and an air of jock self-confidence and sexual entitlement.

title: Dance Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Dance

description: Gladstone Gallery

description: Jason McCoy Gallery

description: Classical

description: Clifton Benevento

title: Jazz Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Jazz

title: National Network for First Responders Is Years Away
description: During Hurricane Sandy, New York police commanders could talk by radio with fire department supervisors across the city, to officials battling power failures in nearby counties and with authorities shutting down airports in New York and New Jersey.

title: This Weeks Movies | Dec. 7, 2012
description: The New York Times critics on Hyde Park on Hudson, Deadfall and Tchoupitoulas.

title: My Mother Was a Spy, and Now Shes Paranoid
description: As Restless begins, a car speeds through the British countryside, carrying a mother and her young son to his grandmothers house. The camera, riding in the car and then soaring above it, captures the leafy splendor of the rural scene but also conveys a sense of menace and isolation, slightly skewing the horizon and showing us the lonely house dwarfed by towering trees.

title: Spare Times for Children for Dec. 7-13
description: HARRY POTTER:

title: The Audience as Art Movement
description: Anyone who liked swings as a child  and that should include quite a few of us  will probably feel a surprisingly visceral attraction to Ann Hamiltons installation the event of a thread at the Park Avenue Armory.

title: Local Restaurateurs Feed Wall Streets Hungry Deal Makers
description: After leaving Wall Street more than four years ago, David Kostman recently returned.

title: Spare Times for Dec. 7-13
description: Around Town

title: Do You Hear What I Hear? Holidays
description: Friday

title: Yesterdays Tomorrows, Full of Rosy Visions
description: We are not terribly interested in the future these days. We are preoccupied with repairs, restorations, reparations, reformations  attempts to redo or reconceive the past. That is where we look for blame and where we look for promise. The future? Well, who is to say that it will not be more of the same until the past is fixed? Progress is a word best used in scare quotes.

title: Upshot of the Foreclosure Backlog
description: FORECLOSURES are taking significantly longer in states where lenders must go through the courts, and the delay may or may not be good for borrowers, depending on their circumstances. But some researchers say that dragging the process out hurts society at large.

title: Staging Christmas
description: Friday

title: The Messiah Cometh
description: Sunday

description: Pop

title: Theater Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Theater

title: Midtown Zoning Plan May Imperil Historic Buildings
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs push to increase development in east Midtown would threaten some of the very buildings that give the neighborhood its character, preservation groups and community boards warn.

title: Movie Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Movies

title: Comedy Listings for Dec. 7-13
description: Comedy

title: Argentina: Fire Forms Toxic Cloud
description: A public scare over a toxic cloud that formed Thursday prompted the evacuation of offices, schools and the central train station in Buenos Aires, and sent about 80 people to seek emergency treatment. The government declared a public health emergency after a shipping container from China carrying a pesticide caught fire at a Buenos Aires port, sending a thick, foul-smelling cloud of smoke over several parts of the city. An emergency official recommended that people living near the site of the fire avoid going out and close doors and windows. A laboratory analysis identified the active ingredient in the pesticide as thiodicarb, classified as moderately hazardous by the World Health Organization in 2009. Sergio Berni, the security secretary, said a sample of the pesticide was of low toxicity and posed little risk.

title: In Miami, Using the South American Playbook
description: Miami

title: Winter Meetings End Without Fireworks
description: Nashville

title: Russia: Anchorman Shot Dead
description: Gunmen killed a news anchor employed by a local affiliate of a Russian state television channel in Nalchik, a town in the North Caucasus region, shooting him in the head late Wednesday. The journalist, Kazbek Gekkiyev, 28, had reported on the Islamic insurgency active in the region and was killed most likely in retaliation for his work, said Vladimir Markin, the spokesman for the federal Investigative Committee, a law enforcement agency, in comments carried by the Interfax news agency. Mr. Markin said the attack appeared to be a warning to other journalists who were involved in news coverage about the governments campaign against insurgents. President Vladimir V. Putin condemned the shooting on Thursday, saying the killers had violated the victims right to live and also the right to disseminate information. In a separate attack on Thursday in Nalchik, a car bomb wounded a deputy regional minister of transportation.

title: Clash of Cultures Within Egypt Made Visible in Single Frame of Video
description: As my colleague David Kirkpatrick observed in an interview on Thursday, the yawning political divide in Egypt stems from a kind of national identity crisis  so debates arent just about a matter of policy, they are about Who we are.'

title: South Sudan: Journalist Killed
description: A South Sudanese online journalist was shot and killed late Wednesday outside his home in the capital, Juba, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists. The journalist, Diing Chan Awuol, who wrote for a number of online news outlets in South Sudan, had published articles critical of the government, its policy toward Sudan and its ties to Sudanese rebel groups. Other journalists said Mr. Chan had been threatened several times in the past and had received anonymous phone calls warning him to stop writing, the journalists organization said in a statement. Since South Sudan gained its independence last year, journalists have complained of harassment and some have been detained by the government.

title: Swings and Things
description: Scenes from Ann Hamiltons event of a thread at the Park Avenue Armory.

title: For International Students, College Checklists for December
description: This week, The Choice published our monthly Counselors Calendar, designed to keep students on track during the college admissions process.

title: When Streets Eat Buildings
description: FINN SQUARE has long been one of New Yorks oddest public spaces, a triangle bounded by Varick Street, Franklin Street and West Broadway. Until recently, the perimeter looked as if someone had attacked it with a chain saw: a raw, oddball lot on the west side, a sliced-in-half loft building on the north side, and a one-story Con Ed substation on the east. It was all the result of the widening of Varick Street in the 1910s, and only now has one of the scars disappeared.

title: Red Splashes on Snow Bring Horrors Home
description: A diverting neo-noir, Deadfall brings to mind those dark, old-fashioned entertainments in rotation on Turner Classic Movies that suck you in with their genre machinery, sullen beauties and despair. Mind you, this isnt Detour, Edgar G. Ulmers 1945 gutter triumph about a loser, a dame and the phone cord that comes between them. Deadfall is a more luxurious item, with real locations and second-tier name actors. First among these is Eric Bana as a villain whose menace and honeyed Southern manners suggest that someone here rewatched Robert Mitchums turn as a charismatic psychopath in Charles Laughtons masterly 1955 fairy tale, The Night of the Hunter.

title: Assessing Apple's Grand Statement
description: Deputy Editor David Gillen leads a roundtable discussion on whether Apple's promise to expand manufacturing in the U.S. will turn out to be good news for American workers.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,145 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Going Beyond Carbon Dioxide
description: Doha, Qatar

title: The Baby Boom Bump
description: CONVENTIONAL wisdom calls the 2012 presidential race the demographic election, attributing President Obamas victory in large part to his commanding advantage among rapidly growing groups like Latinos and millennials.

title: Washington: Pentagons Top Lawyer Is Leaving
description: Jeh C. Johnson, the Obama administrations top lawyer at the Pentagon, will step down at the end of December, the military said on Thursday. Over the course of President Obamas first term, Mr. Johnson was a central player in some of the most important legal policy deliberations of the administration. During the 2008 presidential campaign, he was a key legal adviser and fund-raiser for Mr. Obama. Mr. Johnson, a former prosecutor, has been mentioned as a potential attorney general should Eric H. Holder Jr. step down during Mr. Obamas second term. That speculation has been centered more among his colleagues rather than among civilian law enforcement officials, however.

title: A Long Island Clan With a Big Question
description: The Fitzgerald Family Christmas manages the considerable feat of interweaving the personal dramas of nine members of a boisterous Irish-American clan into a coherent mosaic with a streamlined narrative drive. This meditation on forgiveness in the season of glad tidings may lose some steam as it speeds to very predictable places, but it doesnt turn into a tear-stained greeting card plastered with tinsel and stale peppermints.

title: Futuristic Vision for a City Rooted in the Past
description: VENICE  The elite of Venice gathered this week to celebrate the career of a native son, Pierre Cardin, who turned 90 this summer. Rather than celebrate past glories, the fashion designer  who has lent his name to pantsuits, toilets and cigarettes as well as haute couture  used the occasion to push his next venture: plans for a towering palazzo that will, he hopes, take Venice into the future.

title: Texas: El Paso School Trustees Replaced After Cheating Scandal
description: Michael L. Williams, commissioner of the states education agency, said Thursday that he is appointing a board of managers to oversee the El Paso Independent School District, stripping the current seven-member board of trustees of their power in the aftermath of a cheating scandal. The new five-member board will oversee management of the 64,000-student district, which has been struggling to rebuild after administrators inflated test scores in struggling schools by pushing low-performing students out of the classroom and, in some cases, out of school altogether. The agency had previously sanctioned the district by lowering its accreditation status for reporting fraudulent data and allowing the misconduct to flourish. The replacement of the elected trustees must be approved by the federal Department of Justice. A state education official will oversee the districts operations until the board of managers is installed.

title: She Came to Sin City for a Wholesome Life
description: Beth, leaving behind an unsatisfying career as an on-call stripper in Florida, heads to Las Vegas, where she hopes to become a cocktail waitress. Instead, she nestles under the wing of a professional gambler named Dink, who becomes her boss, her mentor, her friend and almost her lover. She learns to make book and handle money, to balance figures in her head and read the odds on dozens of sporting events at once.

title: The Forgotten Millions
description: Lets get one thing straight: America is not facing a fiscal crisis. It is, however, still very much experiencing a job crisis.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Zyngas Betting Plan, and Court Ruling on Yelp Complaint
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Where Sothebys Scorns to Tread
description: MICHAEL CAPO was out on the sidewalk in Queens posing with passers-by who wanted to have their pictures taken  not necessarily with him, but with the 1962 Rolls-Royce Silver Cloud and beyond-larger-than-life-size statue of Rudolph Valentino that were among the latest lot of estate collectibles, or estate leftovers, about to face the block inside his eponymous auction house at 36-01 Queens Boulevard.

title: Washington: Senator Kirk Returning After Stroke
description: Senator Mark Kirk will return to the Senate on Jan. 3, nearly a year after having a stroke, his office said Thursday. Mr. Kirk, 53, an Illinois Republican, has been in rehabilitation since the January 2012 stroke that impaired his speech and the left side of his body. Although he has stayed out of the public eye for most of the year, his office periodically released videos showing his progress. Mr. Kirk served a decade in the House before he was elected in 2010 to fill President Obamas former Senate seat.

title: Praising Andy Warhol
description: In 1964 an art gallery exhibited a stack of Brillo boxes Andy Warhol had made. They were not exact replicas of the boxes the manufacturer used (they were, for example, made of plywood, rather than cardboard), but most people looking at them in the gallery couldnt tell any difference. Ive seen these boxes occasionally in museums  and often in photos  and have to admit that they do very little for me.

title: New Commander for Tense Region
description: President Obama intends to nominate Gen. Lloyd J. Austin III to be the top officer of the United States Central Command, responsible for American military operations in the Middle East and Southwest Asia, the Pentagon announced Thursday. The commands area of responsibility includes Afghanistan, Egypt, Syria, Iran and the Persian Gulf. General Austin, currently the Armys vice chief of staff, previously served as the top commander in Iraq. In a statement, Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta described him as one of the militarys most seasoned combat leaders. If confirmed by the Senate, General Austin would replace Gen. James N. Mattis. Among other changes in the region, Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr. has been nominated to succeed Gen. John R. Allen as the commander in Afghanistan.

title: How to Appreciate Wagner While Keeping Hitler at Bay
description: In the documentary Wagner & Me, the actor Stephen Fry, an ardent admirer of the music of Richard Wagner, wrestles with a longstanding problem for Wagner fans: how to reconcile that composers musical genius with his racism. Tracing the creation of masterpieces like Parsifal and the Ring cycle, Mr. Fry, who is Jewish, explores Wagners virulent anti-Semitism and Hitlers co-optation of his music during the Third Reich. In the process he alternates between aesthetic rapture and moral repulsion.

title: One Mans Battle Over Health Insurance
description: To the Editor:

title: Why College Costs So Much
description: To the Editor:

title: U.N. Disabilities Treaty
description: To the Editor:

title: Extralegal Drone Policy
description: To the Editor:

title: From Farm to City
description: To the Editor:

title: A Death in the Subway
description: To the Editor:

title: The Republican Glasnost
description: Senator Marco Rubio won the Jack Kemp Foundations Leadership Award earlier this week. In his speech accepting the award, he sketched out his Republican vision. Some of the policies he mentioned were pretty conventional for someone of his party: limiting regulations, approving the Keystone XL Pipeline. Some were less conventional, at least as the Republican Party has recently defined itself: creating more community health centers, investing in more teacher training, embracing Pell grants.

title: A Guided Tour for a Wannabe Collector at Art Basel Miami
description: MIAMI BEACH Walk towards the painting, the art advisor Liz Klein instructed, referring to a large Gerhard Richter work, one of his Strip Paintings.

title: At Dawn We Sleep
description: Washington

title: A New Orleans Odyssey
description: Tchoupitoulas, a heady hybrid of documentary and dream, is a movie by and about brothers. The directors, Bill and Turner Ross, follow William, Bryan and Kentrell Zanders (along with their dog, Buttercup) along the bustling New Orleans street that gives the movie its name. The boys  William, the youngest, is perched on the edge of adolescence; Bryan and Kentrell are in their teens  set off for a night of wandering that has overtones of an archetypal quest. The last ferry home across the Mississippi leaves at midnight, and if they miss it they risk being trapped in a world of dangerous and alluring enchantments.

title: Anthony Sits One Out
description: MIAMI  Carmelo Anthony kept moving to a different spot on the floor, awaiting a pass from Dave Hopla, the Knicks shooting coach. For about 20 minutes Thursday, Anthony put up jumper after jumper to test his left middle finger and his pain tolerance during pregame warm-ups.

title: Father-Son Ties, Already Strained, Face a Test
description: Except for the unwelcome appearance of a foraging bear late in the movie, Brian Savelsons smart, introspective In Our Nature, which takes place at a well-appointed summer house in the woods of upstate New York, is all talk and little drama. Even after that beast wanders into the house, it is not something to be fought but to be eyed warily until it ambles out into the night.

title: Have Treaties Gone Out of Style?
Star Publicist in Britain Is Questioned in Sex Case
description: LONDON  Max Clifford, a multimillionaire publicist well known here for his work advising pop stars, politicians, Hollywood a-listers and others seeking to attract or avoid headlines in Britains sensationalist tabloids, was arrested at daybreak Thursday at his home south of London by police officers investigating sexual offenses.

title: Destination: Adulthood, by Way of the Skate Park
description: The kids in Only the Young are all right and so is this likable movie, a sketchbook of a documentary filled with adolescent bodies groping, lurching and skateboarding toward burgeoning adulthood. The movie is the feature directing debut of Jason Tippet and Elizabeth Mims, who were in their 20s when they started shooting. The two had recently graduated from the California Institute of the Arts, in Southern California, when a pair of teenagers, Garrison Saenz and Kevin Conway, skateboarded up to them and gave the budding filmmakers a subject.

title: No Talking: A Tough Rule to Enforce
description: The situation seems like a bizarre cross between a Graham Greene espionage novel and the comic sports stylings of Dan Jenkins.

title: Publishing Chief at Warner Music Gets Expanded Role
description: The Warner Music Group, the smallest of the three major record companies, has had several management defections since it was sold a year ago, and now its upper ranks have been reshuffled once again with the departure of one of its top record label chiefs and an expanded brief for the head of its publishing division.

title: F.C.C. Calls on F.A.A. to Allow Electronics on Planes
description: Now the United States government is telling the United States government to allow devices on airplanes during takeoff and landing.

title: Soccer Star Sinks Into a Matinee-Idol Mess
description: The road to ruin is blindingly beautiful in Heleno, a tempestuous portrait of the 1940s Brazilian soccer star whose passion for the game was matched only by his addiction to women and his contempt for his teammates.

title: Two Important Steps for Women
description: The version of the National Defense Authorization Act approved this week by the Senate contains two important provisions promoting equitable treatment of women. Both merit retention in the final bill now being negotiated by a House-Senate conference committee.

title: Syrians Flee as Fighting Breaks Out Between Rebels and Kurds
description: Sectarian clashes prompt fears that Syrias civil war could have a much wider impact in the Middle East.

title: Keep the State Tax Deduction
description: As they continue to wrangle over the year-end fiscal deadline, both Democrats and Republicans are considering caps on federal income-tax deductions.

title: In Talks on a Budget Deal, Boehner and Obama Stand Alone
description: WASHINGTON  At House Speaker John A. Boehners request, Senate leaders and Representative Nancy Pelosi have been excluded from talks to avert a fiscal crisis, leaving it to Mr. Boehner and President Obama alone to find a deal, Congressional aides say.

title: U.S. Shifting Its Warning on Syrias Chemical Arms
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama first warned Syrias leader, President Bashar al-Assad, that even making moves toward using chemical weapons would cross a red line that might force the United States to drop its reluctance to intervene in the countrys civil war, Mr. Obama took an expansive view of where he drew that boundary.

title: Dad and Daughter Seek Common Ground
description: Poised unwaveringly between gentle comedy and delicate drama, Maya Kenigs Off White Lies keeps a lot to itself. But this narrative withholding, while infuriating at times, presents no real barrier to our engagement with the films unconventional look at the growing connection between a shy teenage girl and her shiftless father.

title: Planning His Legacy, Cisco Chief Maps an Expansion
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  John T. Chambers has readied his last great act as the leader of Cisco Systems, fearing major changes in the technology business that could doom his company.

title: Soaring Rents Drive a Boom in Apartments
description: Houston is better known for urban sprawl than dense apartment living. But as part of a national rush to capitalize on rising rents, developers there are building thousands of apartments like those south of downtown at Camden City Centre, where 268 units will open early next year in a complex that also has two swimming pools, billiards tables, a coffee bar and a fitness center.

title: Two Senate Seats in South Carolina, but Few Democratic Prospects
description: The unexpected retirement of Senator Jim DeMint, a conservative Republican from South Carolina who will vacate his seat to become head of the the Heritage Foundation, will create an unusual circumstance in which both of the states Senate seats are on the ballot in 2014.

title: Hairless, Bunny-Eared and Sharp-Tongued Philosopher
description: The frisky kitty at the heart of The Rabbis Cat  an endearingly loopy animated feature from Joann Sfar and Antoine Delesvaux  is hairless, bunny-eared and intent on preparing for his bar mitzvah. We know this because the cat, after gobbling his masters parrot, acquires a voice (provided by Franois Morel). And hardly ever stops using it.

title: The Great Gun Gag
description: On national television, you can talk about the sordid details of your sex life, the depth of your religious piety or your belief that an organization that no longer exists, Acorn, stole the 2012 presidential election  a fantasy held by half of Republicans. You can call climate change a hoax, you can say the moon landing never happened, you can even praise Alex Rodriguez, though you shouldnt.

title: Jonathan Harvey, Modernist Composer, Dies at 73
description: Jonathan Harvey, a British composer who was admired on both sides of the Atlantic for his use of electronic sound in concert works and operas to convey a sense of the beyond, died on Tuesday in Lewes, England. He was 73.

title: Administration Weighs Legal Action Against States That Legalized Marijuana Use
description: WASHINGTON  Senior White House and Justice Department officials are considering plans for legal action against Colorado and Washington that could undermine voter-approved initiatives to legalize the recreational use of marijuana in those states, according to several people familiar with the deliberations.

title: Egypts Agony
description: The revolution in Egypt is in danger of being lost in a spasm of violence, power grabs and bad judgments. The top aides to President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt were in Washington this week to promote their country as a new democratic model for the Arab world. But it was Mr. Morsis dictatorial edict placing himself above the law last month that ignited this crisis.

title: Wisecracking Jungle Animals on an Ecological Crusade
description: The worst thing about the animated film Delhi Safari isnt that its awful. Its that it shamelessly rips off much better animated movies. What kind of lesson is that for our young people?

title: Two Laws Are Welcomed After Midnight in Seattle
description: SEATTLE  At 12:01 Thursday morning, the King County administration building here opened its doors to hundreds of couples waiting to apply for marriage licenses, the first day that same-sex couples were able to apply after Washington voters last month approved a ballot measure making it all perfectly legal.

title: Town Unravels After a Gruesome Discovery
description: A haunting piece of fact-based Southern Gothic free of histrionics, Sahkanaga is a thoughtful, atmospherically heavy study of reactions to an inexplicably inhumane act.

title: Quarterback Quandary Slips Down Depth Chart
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Rex Ryan was asked 19 questions at his news conference Wednesday, and none contained the words Jacksonville or Jaguars.

title: Finding Sobriety After Grief and Crime
description: Roughly 90 days into her eight-month prison term, said Edwuana Raven Eley, 46, she looked in the mirror and glimpsed someone unexpected, but long awaited. It was not the woman who had been arrested by the police, but the woman she had been before her life was consumed by alcoholism and petty crimes.

title: Apple and Samsung Tangle on Damages and Juror
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Samsung and Apple lawyers butted heads over the more than $1 billion in damages that a federal jury awarded Apple in August, but the judge in the case issued no new rulings in the case.

title: Wounded Vets Battling Institutional Neglect
description: If war is hell, postwar is purgatory. In the paint-by-numbers institutional drama Happy New Year, a burned and bruised arrival at a veterans hospital awaits a recovery that never comes, while adjusting to a closed-off life. Adapting his own stage play, K. Lorrel Manning hits all the group-living clichs  motley crew of fellow patients, sweet nurse, despotic supervisor, colorful outbursts  in a dully directed movie that sends a message but lacks oomph.

title: Horrific Fire Revealed a Gap in Safety for Global Brands
description: ASHULIA, Bangladesh  The fire alarm shattered the monotony of the Tazreen Fashions factory. Hundreds of seamstresses looked up from their machines, startled. On the third floor, Shima Akhter Pakhi had been stitching hoods onto fleece jackets. Now she ran to a staircase.

title: On Daily Show, No Hug for Christie
description: With his star turn as an emotional, hug-happy leader in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, and his open embrace of President Obama in the days before the election, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey had been enjoying something of a romance with the American left.

title: Giving World War II Vets Their Day in the Sun
description: Its too late in the cycle of greatest-generation homages for Honor Flight to be the film it wants to be: i.e., the documentary that wakes us up to the forgotten heroism of World War II veterans before the last one dies. If these veterans were ever underappreciated, they certainly havent been for years, thanks to the high-profile efforts of Tom Brokaw, Steven Spielberg and Tom Hanks, among many others.

title: Award Said He Was Best; N.F.L. Was Silent
description: The list of the winners of the Butkus Award, given annually since 1985 to college footballs top linebacker, includes a Pro Football Hall of Famer (Derrick Thomas), current All-Pros (Patrick Willis and Von Miller), a two-time recipient whose N.F.L. career flamed out quickly (Brian Bosworth) and, this year, a finalist for the Heisman Trophy (Manti Teo).

title: Disputed Murder Confession Casts a Spotlight on a Missouri Sect
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  They found her, one leg curled under the other, in the back seat of a van at Longview Lake, a white plastic bag over her head, a purple pillow beside her, an empty pill bottle nearby.

title: Unused Pills Raise Issue of Disposal and Risks
description: Brand name drug makers and their generic counterparts rarely find themselves on the same side of an issue, but now they are making an exception. They have teamed up to fight a local law in California, the first in the nation, that makes them responsible for running  and paying for  a program that would allow consumers to turn in unused medicines for proper disposal.

title: An Aroma Loved by Cats and Customers
description: Wandering through the industrial zone wedged between Greenpoint and Williamsburg, you can smell the Acme Smoked Fish factorys woodsy, savory aroma from a block away.

title: Considered Too Broken to Race, and to Live
description: Like an illustrated lecture run amok, Katia Louises Saving Americas Horses: A Nation Betrayed pours forth a torrential hodgepodge of statistics, superimposed graphics, songs and disturbing video to denounce the nations equine slaughter industry. Filled with crushing facts about animal cruelty yet also overstuffed and overwrought, its emotionally and visually tough to watch.

title: Lottery Numbers
Winning, as Planned
description: When the Golden State Warriors decided to have a ceremony to retire Chris Mullins No. 17 jersey before a March game against the Timberwolves last season, they surely had no idea what was in store from the crowd at Oracle Arena in Oakland. As the greatest player for the franchise since Rick Barry stood at midcourt with the teams owner and Barry himself, the raucous fans rained down a chorus of boos.

title: More Than a Soft Drink, Coke Is an Array of Goods
description: DECEMBER is Coke time, by dint of decades of advertising for Coca-Cola featuring the Sundblom Santa  illustrations by the artist Haddon Sundblom that have helped shape the popular perception of Santa Claus.

title: A King, Like the Mayor, Cant Hold Back the Seas
description: Wait a minute. King who?

title: Lawsuit Challenges Ranbaxys Rights to Generic Drug
description: The Swiss drug maker Novartis had been bracing all year for the day in late September when Diovan, its top-selling blood pressure drug, would lose patent protection and a cheaper generic version would become available.

title: Director Gleefully Tests the Limits of Free Expression
description: A movie about trying to make a movie, The Sheik and I finds the self-referential director Caveh Zahedi waving the freedom-of-speech flag in a major Arab emirate. But poking the bear of repression has consequences beyond Mr. Zahedis immediate artistic goals, as this layered, intermittently fascinating documentary makes abundantly clear.

title: A Factory Where Lox Is the Lure
description: ON a sunny midmorning in November, with the indoor thermometer behind them reading 50 degrees Fahrenheit, a team of three Acme Smoked Fish employees in long white coats and hairnets cut and weighed fish for a line of customers.

title: Back to Old Spending Ways, Yanks Offer Youkilis a Deal
description: NASHVILLE  The final act of Brian Cashmans dormant week at the winter meetings was to assure the baseball world, through his words and a $12 million contract offer to Kevin Youkilis, that the Yankees were still capable of George Steinbrenner-style spending.

title: Whats Generally Spotted
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Yesterday I talked about the enjoyment I get from being fooled by a particularly good bit of misdirection in my late week crossword puzzles. Today, Peter Wentz opens his puzzle with another entry that momentarily tripped me up. Fool me once, guys, shame on you. Fool me twice and perhaps I really shouldnt do these puzzles before my morning coffee has kicked in.

title: The Sweet Science vs. the Stradivarius
description: Plenty of punches are thrown in the forceful new revival of Clifford Odetss Golden Boy that opened on Thursday night at the Belasco Theater. Eyes are blackened, uppercuts fly back and forth, and by the end of the play, the young boxer hero, Joe Bonaparte (Seth Numrich), is staggering across the stage, delirious and practically bathed in blood.

title: Corrections: December 7, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Verdict Reached in Fatal Bus Crash Case
description: A Bronx jury announced on Thursday afternoon that it had reached a verdict in the manslaughter trial of a bus driver accused of being so deprived of sleep that he caused an early morning crash last year that killed 15 passengers and injured many more. But, in an unusual move, the judge in the case said that the verdict would not be revealed until Friday morning.

title: Season Has Changed, but the Drought Endures
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Even as the summer swelter has given way to frost, nearly two-thirds of the country remains in a drought, with forest fires still burning, winter crops choking in parched soil and barges nearly scraping the mucky bottoms of sunken rivers.

title: Daredevil Skateboarder and Marketers Dream
description: Its important to know that some of the financing for Waiting for Lightning, a documentary about the daredevil skateboarder Danny Way, comes from DC Shoes, one of his longtime sponsors, and a company that has profited plenty from his gonzo behavior. If its a god on a skateboard you want, a god on a skateboard youll get in this hagiography, which intersperses biographical segments about Mr. Way (including some disorienting re-enactments) with clips from his 2005 jump over the Great Wall of China, one of the many oh-no-he-didnt stunts that have cemented his legacy as a technical innovator and a marketers dream.

title: Empty Offices Seem Poised to Remain So for Months
description: There is now more deserted office space in Lower Manhattan because of Hurricane Sandy than there are offices in many cities. Mobile boilers line the streets. Portable generators are stacked to the curbs. Ventilation tubes coil around scaffolds, snake above sidewalks, quiver and pulse. It is as if bodies had been turned inside out, exposing the hearts, lungs and organs that are normally internal. Of course, these devices keep the buildings running in some limited ways. Still, 15 million to 18 million square feet of space is unusable, about as much as exists in any condition whatsoever in cities like Miami, Phoenix and San Diego.

title: Plenty of Tasks Remain on the Mets To-Do List
description: NASHVILLE  The Mets made their way back to New York on Thursday with a host of unanswered questions after a mostly quiet stay here for baseballs winter meetings.

title: Despite 10 Straight Wins in Series, Navy Reveres Army as an Equal
description: PHILADELPHIA  Brye French, a senior inside linebacker for Navy, spent a few of his teenage years in Deatsville, Ala., so he has heard plenty about football rivalries in which emotions can boil over.

title: Bills Placing Limits on Unions Advance in Michigan Legislature
description: LANSING, Mich.  As labor supporters crowded into the Capitol chanting their dismay, this states Republican leaders announced on Thursday their intent to swiftly pass limits on unions in Michigan, a state with deep ties to organized labor.

title: Transit Officials Ask Congress for Billions in Storm Aid
description: WASHINGTON  It will cost more than $7 billion to repair the damage that Hurricane Sandy did to the New York areas antiquated transit systems and billions more to upgrade the systems to withstand major storms in the future, officials from the region told a United States Senate panel on Thursday.

title: North Korea Gets Ready for Launching
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The name of the satellite that North Korea will attempt to put into orbit as early as next week helps explain why the countrys impoverished regime wanted its own satellite project. Kwangmyongsong, or Shining Star, was also a title for Kim Jong-il  the late father of the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, and the man whose legacy of nuclear and missile programs his son must consolidate to justify his own hereditary rule.

title: G.O.P. Senate Deal: Diversity Takes Back Seat to Power in Albany
description: New York is one of the most diverse states in the nation, with 3.5 million Hispanics, 2.8 million blacks and 1.5 million Asians. More than 40 percent of its residents are minorities.

description: A doctor accused of running a prescription pain medication mill out of a basement office in Queens was charged with manslaughter on Thursday in the deaths of two former patients.

description: They killed time. Time was so precious, so important. But they said it was a false alarm.

title: New York State Is Sued Over Use of Isolation in Its Prisons
description: Excessive tobacco. Unauthorized jewelry. An untidy cell. Those were among the nonviolent infractions by prisoners in New York State that led to extended stays in solitary confinement, a widespread punishment for prison offenses, according to a lawsuit the New York Civil Liberties Union filed on Thursday.

description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  They skulked in and out like criminals, shoulders hunched, heads down, declining to comment.

description: Executives who sell Absolut vodka are doing something they rarely do: expanding the roster of advertising, marketing and communications agencies they work with.

title: Lars V. Hormander Dies at 81; Unlocked Partial Differential Equations
description: Lars V. Hormander, a Swede who won the most prestigious award in mathematics for his groundbreaking work on partial differential equations, which has found broad applications across many branches of physics, died on Nov. 25 in Lund, Sweden. He was 81.

title: Long-Range Attack Fuels Knicks
description: MIAMI  The long-distance shots came from everywhere. From the corner. From the top of the arc. And from extra passes in transition with plenty of time on the shot clock. No matter the situation, or the score, the Knicks kept shooting 3-pointers at a dizzying pace.

description: The Department of Veterans Affairs will propose new regulations on Friday that will make it easier for thousands of veterans to receive health care and compensation for certain illnesses that have been linked to traumatic brain injury.

description: SAN ANTONIO  Nearly two decades after a pact initiated here created the worlds largest free trade area, economists are calling the North American Free Trade Agreement a resounding success, crediting it for fueling unprecedented trade and creating millions of jobs in the United States.
