title: Bernankes Non-Stupidity Pact
description: So, how big a deal was yesterdays Fed announcement? Philosophically, it was pretty major; in terms of substantive policy implications, not so much.

title: Acropolis Now
description: Say what you will about the state of the Greek economy, but Athens remains a triumph. As politicians left and right try to hammer out a plan to keep the country afloat, the Parthenon still crowns the Acropolis like, in the words of an ancient Turkish traveler, some impregnable fortress not made by human agency. And if there is more commotion in Syntagma Square than usual, overall Athens is noisily going about being Athens  cafes are full, night life is roaring and at a recent concert by the singer Anna Vissi fans were flinging 10-euro trays of carnations at the star by the hundreds. Best of all, those undeterred by fiscal follies can probably get more value for their euro here than in any other big European city right now. Consider that a room at the posh New Hotel, by Syntagma Square, is going for slightly more than 100 euros a night, and includes the kind of gourmet breakfast that draws local dealmakers and diplomats alike. That kind of value, along with refreshingly drama-free winter weather, turns the idea of visiting into an imperative.

title: Week 15 in Fantasy Football: Bengals at Eagles
description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: Santa Needs Comics!
description: We here at Motherlode (like the Today Mom Jacoba Urist) are fervent Santa-supporters. Santa lives at the North Pole, and once a year he flies around the globe in a sleigh pulled by reindeer delivering toys to all the good boys and girls  and Santa knows that all boys and girls are good at heart.

title: Lost Decade Watch
description: Along with its new policy pronouncement, the Fed released its economic projections (pdf). What struck me is that the Fed expects the unemployment rate to be well above its long-run level even in the fourth quarter of 2015, which is as far as its projections go.

title: Assessing the Financial Burden of Being an M.T.A Rider
description: With mass-transit fares about to go up  yet again, most New Yorkers would add wearily  this is a good time to pry a statistic out of the recesses of wonkdom where it usually huddles. It is called the farebox operating ratio, an unlovely phrase for calculating what riders pay out of their own pockets to keep a transit system going.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Debating Torture in Zero Dark Thirty, and a Food Blogger Breaks Out
description: Zero Dark Thirty, about the hunt for Osama bin Laden, wont open in movie theaters until Wednesday, but it is already dividing screening audiences for its depiction of torture by the United States, and its suggestion that brutal treatment may have produced useful early clues to catching Bin Laden, Scott Shane reports. A new Senate report on C.I.A. interrogations, which has been criticized by the Republican minority, has found that brutal treatment was not a central component in finding Bin Laden; the films screenwriter, Mark Boal, explained that he was to compress a program that lasted for years into a few short scenes. Those scenes, he said, attempted to reflect a very complex debate about torture that is still going on and showed that brutal treatment produced both true and false information.

title: General Motors Refreshes Its Top-Selling Trucks
description: PONTIAC, Mich.  General Motors introduced on Thursday revised 2014 versions of its bread-and-butter half-ton pickup trucks, the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and GMC Sierra 1500.

title: 2013 Golden Globe Nominees
description: A slide show of images from the films nominated.

title: Court Finds Rights Violation in C.I.A. Rendition Case
description: BERLIN  A German man who was mistaken for a terrorist and abducted nine years ago won a measure of redress on Thursday when the European Court of Human Rights ruled that his rights had been violated and confirmed his account that he had been seized by Macedonia, handed over to the C.I.A., brutalized and detained for months in Afghanistan.

title: Tiny Piano, Grand Romance
description: Michael Feinstein tests out a piano from Casablanca, to be auctioned at Sothebys.

title: Poetry Pairing | Honorary Jew
description: In celebration of Hanukkah, this weeks Poetry Pairing matches Honorary Jew by John Repp with How to Be a Jew at Christmas, a blog post about raising Jewish children in the United States, where many people tend to assume everyone celebrates Christmas.

title: What Were Reading
description: Time Out Chicago: In a main course, in a dessert, in a cocktail: how a few chefs are making use of persimmons in Chicago.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Deutsche Bank Says Earnings Will Be Weak
description: FRANKFURT  Deutsche Bank cant seem to get a break.

title: Is Barcelona About to Get a New Museum?
description: MADRIDTwenty years ago, Baroness Carmen Thyssen-Bornemisza helped transform Madrids arts scene by persuading her husband to move his vast painting collection from Switzerland to the Spanish capital.

title: Globes Instant Analysis: Django and Weinstein Get an Oscar Boost
description: Harvey Weinstein and Quentin Tarantino are doing whatever passes for a victory dance in their quarters  a less intense shouting match?  since they scored big with Golden Globe nominations this morning. The Hollywood Foreign Press Association saw fit to grant Mr. Tarantinos Django Unchained five nominations, just shy of the pack leader, Lincoln, which had seven, and tying with Argo. Django, Mr. Tarantinos bloody take on a western as a slavery revenge fantasy, picked up finalist spots for best picture, drama; best supporting actor (for Leonardo DiCaprio and Christoph Waltz); best screenplay; and, crucially, best director.

title: China Pushes Deposit Insurance in Bank Overhaul
description: HONG KONG  Chinas new leadership is preparing to introduce bank deposit insurance as the first step in financial reforms to be started soon at a top-level meeting in Beijing, a government official and banking policy advisers said.

title: Chris Colfer: By the Book
description: The Glee star and author of Struck by Lightning is a fan of Carrie Fishers Wishful Drinking: I love painfully honest authors who arent afraid to say, I was a mess!

title: 36 Hours in Sarasota, Fla.
description: WHERE else can one spend the morning reveling in the beauty of works by Peter Paul Rubens, Frans Hals and Botticelli and the afternoon lolling on a powdery white sand beach? That is the lure of Sarasota, the city perched on the Gulf of Mexico where John and Mable Ringling, the circus impresario and his wife, set the stage for a vibrant cultural life after buying land there in 1911. Not only did John Ringling create the old-master-filled John and Mable Ringling Museum of Art, but he brought the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus to winter in Sarasota. His elephants even hauled timber for the John Ringling Causeway, which links the mainland to Lido Key. Nature, which initially attracted the Ringlings and other wealthy Midwesterners, provides its own set of pleasures beyond the beaches: whether its fishing, watching manatees and sea turtles or strolling past orchids and mangroves in an expansive botanical garden. For more civilized diversions, there is a plethora of restaurants and shops, and even an opera and orchestra.

title: Ringling, Rubens and More in Sarasota, Fla.
description: Sure, theres the beach. But what about the chance to see museums honoring old masters and the circus on the same property?

title: Yahoo Shakes Up Its Board and Adds PayPal Co-Founder
description: Yahoo announced a number of changes to its board on Thursday, including the addition of Max Levchin, a co-founder of PayPal.

title: Gujarat Goes to the Polls
description: RAJKOT  As millions in Indias westernmost state of Gujarat headed to the first of two part polls on Thursday, the rest of the nation was watching carefully forclues to how the 2014 national election might shape up.

title: Detectives Found Nothing in Search of Shooting Victims California Home, Mother Says
description: No drugs. No weapons. No evidence of any kind was removed by New York City detectives from the California home of the man who was gunned down this week in Midtown Manhattan, the victims mother said Thursday.

title: Losing Control in Syria
description: TimesCast: President Bashar al-Assad struggles to slow rebels momentum. | How North Koreas rocket launch bolsters Kim Jong-uns image. | The anatomy of an investigation into a Manhattan murder.

title: Big East May Go Small
description: Had you fallen off the globe for a while and returned this morning to check what sports news you missed, you might think you had not left at all. Because after months and months, sports earth seems to be spinning in a very tiny circle. In fact, you could go take another lap or two of Mars and it is likely that we will still be talking about the same things when you get back, that being the Saints bounty scandal and college conference realignment  specifically, the way the Big East is making the biggest hash of it.

title: Bonnie the Mannequins Wild New York Adventure
description: While looking into the history of Barneys for my article in Sundays magazine, I came across the amazing windows that the artist Lynn Hershman Leeson did for Bonwit Teller in the fall of 1976. Bonwits was located on Fifth Avenue at 56th Street, where Trump Tower is today. After two years of negotiation with store management, Hershman Leeson brought her art and social commentary to 25 windows. I wanted to put art in the context of everyday life, Hershman Leeson, whose work includes photography, video, film and installations, said this week. She had already done a project in a prison. I thought, Well, if Im going to do something in New York City, I should do stores.

title: Letter From Berlin | Paper & Tea
description: Forget boxes of chamomile, or even English teapots. A new specialty tea company in Berlins affluent district Charlottenburg offers a different route to high-end ginger, lavender and Moroccan mint teas. Paper & Tea, which opened its doors on Dec. 1, is a far cry from your typical over-the-counter  almost pharmaceutical  approach to tea shops.

title: N.F.I.B. Suffers the Post-Election Blues
description: The news from the National Federation of Independent Business on Tuesday was grim, very grim indeed. Confidence among small-business owners  or, more precisely, among a certain subset of small-business owners  dropped precipitously in November, as gauged by the organizations Small Business Optimism Index. And the reason for the pessimism, said the N.F.I.B.s chief economist, Bill Dunkelberg, was clear: President Obama won re-election.

title: Battle Brews Over a Small, Vital Fish
description: The fate of a nondescript fish called the menhaden will be the focus of debate on Friday when the Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission meets in Baltimore to consider whether a catch limit should be imposed to end what many groups see as the outright exploitation of the species. So far, environmental groups, recreational and commercial fishermen, birders and others have generated over 100,000 comments in favor of protecting the fish.

title: New Life for the Class Act?
description: Now that President Obama has won a second term, the Supreme Court has ruled the Affordable Care Act constitutional and the election has made Congressional attempts to repeal it unlikely, a few advocates for the elderly are quietly talking about resurrecting the Class Act, or some variant of it.

title: Red Bulls Part Ways With Marquez
description: Bright and early Thursday morning (at 8:02 a.m. by the e-mail clock) the Red Bulls announced that they had rid themselves of one of their three designated players  Rafael Marquez.

title: Man Who Defaced Rothko Work Given Two-Year Sentence
description: The man who defaced part of a Rothko mural at the Tate Modern in London was sentenced to two years in jail on Thursday.

title: As Time Goes By, Whats This Piano Worth?
description: Heres looking at you, piano.

title: European Leaders Hail Accord on Banking Supervision
description: BRUSSELS  European leaders gathering here on Thursday for their year-end summit meeting hailed an agreement to place euro zone banks under a single supervisor, calling it a concrete measure to maintain the viability of the currency as well as a step in laying the groundwork for a broader economic union.

title: Few Consumers Review Their Credit Reports
description: Only about one in five consumers review their credit reports each year, according to a new report from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

title: Image of the Day: Dec. 13
Bradley Cooper, Relaxing in Bed, Enjoys Golden Globes Adulation
description: Im in Los Angeles, in my bed, right now, Bradley Cooper said early this morning, shortly after he was nominated for a bunch of Golden Globe awards, as a star and a producer of Silver Linings Playbook. Across the country, we were similarly comfy. Lifes strange, isnt it? said Mr. Cooper, audibly jolly. We could actually take photographs and send them to one another. We could actually FaceTime  theres no end to the level of communication that we could have right now.

title: Man Accused of Mugging 85-Year-Old Woman in Elevator
description: A 33-year-old homeless man has been arrested and accused of mugging an 85-year-old retired actress in the elevator of her West Village building and robbing three other women, the police said Wednesday.

title: Stone Links: Scientism and the Future of Philosophy
description: Philosophy and science havent been getting along. Recent volleys by eminent physicists like Lawrence Krauss, Stephen Hawking and Freeman Dyson, and equally scathing rejoinders, have provoked anxiety and acrimony both within and between the two camps.

title: Midtown Murder a Professional Hit?
description: The Timess William K. Rashbaum on the police investigation into the brazen killing of Brandon Lincoln Woodard.

title: Chinese Court Said to Punish Tibetan Students with Prison Terms
description: BEIJING  A Chinese court has sentenced eight Tibetan students to prison for their role in street protests last month that unnerved security forces already coping with a wave of self-immolations, many of them by young people who have become increasingly radicalized in their opposition to Chinese policies in the region, a Washington-based advocacy group reported Wednesday.

title: Tackling the Problem of Medical Student Debt
description: Thursdays announcement from the University of California, Los Angeles, of a $100 million medical student scholarship fund should inspire all of us to question the fact that medical education in the United States is paid for largely by student debt.

description: The former world champion made his way to the stage, wielding a light saber and flanked by Princess Leia and a posse of Stormtroopers, while the sellout crowd, merry on Christmas cheer and liters of beer, roared in approval.

description: Much as the old social order is fading into history on Mad Men, the show itself is on the wane among awards givers.

title: Life Expectancy Rises Around the World, Study Finds
description: A sharp decline in deaths from malnutrition and infectious diseases like measles and tuberculosis has caused a shift in global mortality patterns over the past 20 years, according to a report published on Thursday, with far more of the worlds population now living into old age and dying from diseases mostly associated with rich countries, like cancer and heart disease.

title: On Our Radar: Eco-Pragmatists on the Rise
description: A growing group of modernist greens aims to shift the environmental movements focus away from nature and its fragility. (Whats your view, readers?) [Slate]

title: Possible Ripples From the Argentine Bond Litigation
description: At its heart, a bond is a contract that provides for the loan of money that will be repaid in the future, while interest will be paid in the interim. When the issuer is a top-tier sovereign, borrowing in its own currency, the bond might provide little more than that.

title: Cinder Block City
description: The other night I came home from work and looked out my kitchen windows at a new kind of darkness that was far darker than the night sky. Up to that moment, I could see from my fourth floor window all of central Park Slope, the apex of which was the steeple of the Old First Reformed Church on Carroll Street, where I went to nursery school. For the six years Id lived in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gowanus, I had done the dishes, chopped vegetables and served guests wine across my kitchen island while looking up through that window at the churchs steeple, visible between the new high-rises on Fourth Avenue.

title: Impact of Pyongyangs Rocket Launch
description: Victor Cha, a professor at Georgetown University, discusses how North Korea's recent satellite launch affects geopolitics in the region.

title: Coming to a Curb Near You: Yellow Cabs Summoned With Smartphones
description: The citys Taxi and Limousine Commission approved a pilot program on Thursday authorizing the use of smartphone apps to hail yellow taxis.

title: Rendition Condemned
description: London

title: Unprecedented Loan Show From the Prado to Open in Houston
description: Four centuries of Spanish history seen through the eyes of painters including Rubens, Titian, El Greco, Goya and Velzquez will go on view at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, on Sunday, in a blockbuster exhibition called Portrait of Spain: Masterpieces From the Prado. It is the first time the Madrid museum has lent such a large and important group of works from its permanent collection to a museum in the United States.

title: Davis Polk Starts Litigation Practice in Hong Kong
description: Davis Polk & Wardwell announced on Thursday the formation of a litigation practice in Hong Kong, a move highlighting the continued push by New Yorks blue-chip corporate law firms into foreign financial centers.

title: '101 Classic Cookbooks'
description: The book is an attempt to collect the most important American cookbooks of the 20th century.

title: Assads Grip on Power Is Questioned
description: The Timess Anne Barnard on Thursdays violence in Syria and the significance of the statement by a top Russian envoy on President Bashar al-Assads weakening grip.

title: Carole King to Receive the Gershwin Prize
description: Carole King will be the recipient of the 2013 Gershwin Prize for Popular Song, the Library of Congress announced on Thursday.

title: In Small Things Forgotten
description: The past survives all around us. The trick is recognizing it. Empty fields are usually empty fields, but sometimes they turn out to be former battlefields, slave villages or farms with dead buried along the palisade. As an archaeologist in Virginia, recognizing the past among the present is my job. And often, the past I uncover is related to the Civil War.

title: New Jerseys Pension Plan Is Said to Be in Trouble Despite Overhaul by Christie
description: New Jerseys financial problems are so severe that even Gov. Chris Christies signature pension overhaul, in which he cut back benefits as union members marched and booed, might not be enough to pull the state out of its hole, a panel of fiscal experts said on Thursday.

title: The Giving Spree | Gucci Westman
description: Who: The makeup artist Gucci Westman who let T into her home for a Profile in Style in the spring womens fashion issue.

title: Travelers Say They Back Flights Without Children
description: Child-free flights have been the subject of lawsuits and Facebook groups, but have remained in the territory of wishful thinking. That hasnt kept passengers from clamoring for them, nor consumer Web sites from veering into the polling industry to ask travelers about them.

title: One Man, 10 Favorites, Guvnor
description: WHEN is a clich not a clich? The question is relevant to all art, which is of necessity devoted to reinventing and re-energizing the familiar. But it seemed more pertinent than ever to New York theater during 2012. This was a year in which Broadway did its usual business of patching up and recycling old musical scores (Nice Work if You Can Get It) and movie scripts (Newsies) while serving up an unprecedented surfeit of revivals of plays we felt as if we had seen only yesterday (A Streetcar Named Desire, Cyrano de Bergerac, Death of a Salesman, Whos Afraid of Virginia Woolf?, The Heiress, Glengarry Glen Ross).

title: A Sisters Comfort, if Not a Cure
description: THE first time my younger brother, Takkin, said his teeth were falling on the floor, my family was concerned, but we believed it was a passing manifestation of anxiety from the dental surgery he had recently been through.

title: Ben Brantleys Top 10 of 2012
description: Photos of Once, Uncle Vanya and other shows.

title: No Get-Out-of-Jail-Free Card on Sea Level
description: The future of Antarctica on a warming planet has long been one of the great uncertainties in climate science.

title: UBS Unit Is Said to Be Close to Guilty Plea in Rate-Rigging Scandal
description: 10:00 p.m. | Updated

title: On Scholarship and College Applications
description: In this dispatch from November, Leobardo Espinoza Jr., a student at Topeka High School in Kansas, is hoping his efforts to complete college and scholarship applications will prove beneficial in 2013.

title: In Performance: Michael Learned of The Outgoing Tide
description: The actress Michael Learned performs a scene from The Outgoing Tide. Bruce Grahams play, at 59E59 Theaters through Sunday, is a drama about a blue-collar family facing issues of death and morality. In this excerpt, Peg (Ms. Learned) speaks to her son about his father, who is suffering from dementia.

title: Waiting for Lightning to Strike, Preferably Before College Applications Are Due
description: Choosing schools has become the hardest task Ive ever had to face. I dont know how Id research schools without the Internet, but I find that even with its existence, I can only go so far.

title: In the Fiscal Debate, an Unvarnished Voice for Shielding Benefits
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama cut a deal with Congressional Republicans in December 2010 to extend tax cuts for the wealthy, Senator Bernard Sanders, the brusque Vermont independent who calls himself a socialist, decided it was time for a protest.

title: Afghan Youth Orchestra to Visit America
description: Hopes to bring an Afghan youth orchestra to the United States appear to have solidified. On Thursday the organizers of the tour released details of the performances, to take place at the Kennedy Center in Washington on Feb. 7 and at Carnegie Hall in New York on Feb. 12.

title: Wozniackis Imitation of Serena Williams Hits Airwaves, and Nerves
description: The off-season hit-and-giggle circuit, while a huge source of supplemental income for tennis players, is rarely a source of any news, much less controversy.

title: Bilbo Begins His Ring Cycle
description: In The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, Peter Jacksons adaptation of J. R. R. Tolkiens first Middle-earth fantasy novel, Bilbo Baggins (Martin Freeman) sets out with the wizard Gandalf (Ian McKellen) and a posse of dwarfs to battle a fearsome dragon. [Spoiler alert] they do not kill the dragon, although [spoiler alert] they eventually will, within the next 18 months or so, because [spoiler alert] this Hobbit, which is [migraine alert] 170 minutes, is the first installment in [film critic suicide-watch alert] a trilogy.

title: Wall Street Stars Raise Their Lighters at Sandy Benefit Concert
description: Bruce Springsteen may decry the hardships of the working class at the expense of robber barons and flesh-eating greedy thieves, but, hey, even hedge fund managers like to rock out every now and then.

title: How Googles Maps App for iPhone Hurts Nokia
description: Apple isnt the only company that should feel nervous about Googles release of a new maps app for the iPhone. Nokia may have lost whatever chance it had to get iPhone owners hooked on its mapping service.

title: The Most Important Recipes from the Most Important Cookbooks of a Century
description: This is the season for Best of lists. A hefty and recently published book, 101 Classic Cookbooks, not only lists what some consider the most important cookbooks in a century, but also features the best recipes from each one.

title: Musical Inspired by Othello Coming to Public Theater
description: The Othello-inspired Venice, which Time magazine heralded as the best musical of 2010 during its run in Kansas City, Mo., will finally reach New York in May for a production at the Public Theater, executives there announced Thursday. Set in the near future, in a war-torn city weary of totalitarian brutality, Venice mixes romance, sibling betrayal and political allegory with a score that blends hip-hop and rock music.

title: Two Sides Still Apart on a Fiscal Deal
description: TimesCast Politics: Boehner maintains Obama isnt serious. | The implications for the presidents second term. | Christine Quinn and the mayoral race.

title: Art Fairs, Full of Bling if Not Fire
description: THIS year the expansion of the art world beyond its traditional boundaries reached new extremes. On many fronts it seemed that the global was winning out over the local, what with the continued proliferation of art fairs, the spread of auctions and the franchising of art galleries, on the Gagosian model, around the globe. And this year it often seemed as if the effects of all this  a combined draining of energy and further stratification of the art world into haves and have-nots  were registering most powerfully in New York, which still has the biggest gallery scene in the world.

title: Another Lakers Headache: Missed Foul Shots by Howard
description: Bubba Wellss N.B.A. career consisted of 39 mostly unremarkable games for a truly unremarkable Dallas Mavericks team in 1997-98. One game, however, stands out as his singular contribution to N.B.A. history: he fouled out in three minutes, a league record, with all six fouls coming against Dennis Rodman at the orders of his coach, Don Nelson.

title: Watson Will Be Next U.S. Ryder Cup Captain
description: The P.G.A. of America on Thursday named Tom Watson the captain of the United States Ryder Cup team for the 2014 event at Gleneagles in Scotland.

title: N.C.A.A. Tournament: Best of the Best
description: The N.C.A.A. tournament is an emotional event. As much as it is about basketball, it is also about the stories surrounding the teams and players, and the building excitement leading to the championship game.

title: Finding Stimulation Along the Edges
description: FOR New Yorks big art institutions 2012 was a dull year at the top. Pragmatism prevailed. In one case this meant keeping strategic silence. The Metropolitan Museum stayed mum about specific plans for the Whitneys Breuer Building, which it will occupy in 2015, the day after tomorrow in scheduling terms, while it hired yet another curator of modern and contemporary art.

title: Roberta Smiths Year in Art
description: This year the expansion of the art world beyond its traditional boundaries reached new extremes.

description: For New Yorks big art institutions 2012 was a dull year at the top.

title: Costly Toll for Republicans Who Voted for Gay Marriage
description: As four Republican state senators, one by one, agreed to break with their party and cast a politically risky vote to legalize same-sex marriage last year, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and gay-rights advocates vowed to do everything in their power to protect them against political retribution.

title: Four Old Spice Ads Make YouTubes List of Most Popular Ads of 2012
description: Billions of times during 2012, Americans did something voluntarily that they dislike doing when they dont have the choice: watch a commercial.

title: Balotelli Descent Hits New Low in Loss to United
description: Mario Balotellis career has descended into parody. There had been moments before where it had threatened to cross the threshold, but as he was withdrawn after 51 indifferent minutes of Sundays Manchester derby, it made the full transition.

title: Best Medicine for a Weak Ed Koch May Be a Birthday Party With Friends
description: When former Senator Alan K. Simpson of Wyoming traveled across the Queensboro Bridge last week, he noticed that it bore the name of an old friend from his days in Congress: former Mayor Edward I. Koch.

title: Like a Fairy Tale: Hans Christian Andersen Story Is Found in a Box
description: A fairy tale about a lonely candle that wants to be lighted had been languishing in a box in Denmarks National Archives for many years. In October it was discovered by a retired historian, who now believes it is one of the first fairy tales ever written by Hans Christian Andersen.

title: Up Front
description: In 2011, The New York Times made a significant upgrade to its best-seller lists with the introduction of e-book sales. This week, we are making our first change to the childrens best-seller lists since the addition of the series list in 2004.

title: A Distinguished Chair
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Deposit Insurance Bill Is Blocked in the Senate
description: The Senate on Thursday failed to clear a bill that would have extended for two more years a program that provided federal insurance for deposits kept in no-interest accounts at federally insured banks.

title: For a New Generation, a New Literary Battle Over Jeffrey MacDonalds Guilt
description: 2:47 p.m. | Updated True crime fans, here comes another round in the literary battle over the guilt or innocence of Jeffrey MacDonald.

title: Singapura
description: Inside the Curry Hill restaurant that offers spiced dishes to revive and warm.

title: Spielberg Outdoes Himself With This Years Globes
description: Steven Spielberg said he didnt know that, with seven nominations, Lincoln became his most-honored film at the Golden Globes, beating Schindlers List (six) and Saving Private Ryan (five).

title: Neighbors From the Far East, Getting Along Just Fine
description: IT takes a moment to recognize Seven Nation Army on the speakers, a quasi-Celtic fiddle version strung out on harmonics, Muzak gone wild. You are sipping water from a Mason jar under bare dangling bulbs, as if at some rustic hipster bar. But Chinatown-shopkeeper abacuses line the walls, brass lions-head door knockers snarl from the backs of chairs, and a kaleidoscope of petaled lampshades has turned half the ceiling into a lotus pond.

title: Gospel According to Saint Matthew in Queens
description: Between forkfuls of pasta amatriciano on a recent trip to Rome, the Miser took in the artistic riches. One work stood out among all the Michaelangelos and Berninis, adorning an unassuming side chapel of the Church of San Luigi dei Francesi: Caravaggios Calling of Saint Matthew.

title: Warriors Lee Is Key
description: Theres a smooth, lefty forward who recently starting playing center and has since been a boon to his teams offense and defense. No, not Chris Bosh; Im talking about David Lee.

title: Look of The Moment | Katie Holmes
description: The Look: Stepping Up. With pulled-back hair, a cocoon coat and cropped trousers take a vintage turn. The proper-lady pumps complete the elegant statement.

title: Akron After Porter
description: Jared Embick was a sophomore on Indiana Wesleyan Universitys soccer team in the late 1990s when he realized that his dream of becoming a professional player was beyond him. His parents never played the sport and they had little idea where to send their son for coaching that could have helped him land at a more prominent school.

title: Average New Yorker Produces Over 2 Pounds of Garbage Per Day
description: Garbage in, garbage out, the saying goes. But how much, and at what cost?

title: In Europe, Publishers Dealt a Setback Over e-Book Pricing
description: BERLIN  The European Commission settled its antitrust case against Apple and four book publishing groups over e-book price fixing on Thursday, in what was described as a victory for the leading online seller, Amazon, and a setback for publishers fighting for the ability to set prices for electronic literature in the digital marketplace.

title: Simplifying the Fiscal Cliff Debate
description: There are a lot of potential moving parts in the fiscal cliff negotiations, and thus a lot of potential ways that matters could be negotiated and settled, postponed or left half-resolved. But sometimes simplification helps, and the best place to start when thinking about how things are likely to play out is with the following brute fact: No matter what Congressional Republicans offer the president and what theyre willing to concede, taxes on the wealthiest Americans are going to rise by at least $800 billion over the next decade. This is not a possibility, not a likely scenario, not a maybe or a might be; its just reality, conceded even by the notorious RINO Jim DeMint. Which means that its useful for analytic purposes to treat that $800 billion as a baseline, rather than as a live point of give and take in the negotiations, and recognize that any bigger deal John Boehner and Barack Obama are able to cut should be judged as much on how it balances spending cuts and tax increases beyond that baseline as on what it looks like overall.

title: For Clearwire, There Is No Better Alternative
description: Sprint is taking on some starry-eyed activists.

title: North Korean Media Say Leader Supervised Rocket Launching
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, personally supervised the successful launching of a three-stage rocket this week, and ordered his government to launch more rockets despite criticism from the United Nations Security Council, the Norths official news media reported Thursday.

title: Knicks Smith Is on the Up
description: Carmelo Anthony and Jason Kidd may have emerged as the heroes in the Knicks 100-97 victory over the Nets on Tuesday, but it was J. R. Smith who was the most resilient.

title: States Top Court Increases 3 Police Pensions in Claims of 9/11-Related Illness
description: The states highest court on Thursday awarded enhanced pension benefits to two retired New York City police officers who said they were sickened by their work at the World Trade Center site, overturning a pension boards ruling that their cancers were not related to ground zero. The widow of another officer also won enhanced benefits.

title: Fiscal Negotiations and the Obama Agenda
description: David Leonhardt, Washington bureau chief, and the reporter Annie Lowrey discuss the implications of the fiscal talks on President Obamas second term.

title: Angels Add Hamilton to Powerhouse Lineup
description: With the signing of Rangers slugger Josh Hamilton to a five-year, $125 million deal, the Angels have once again made the biggest splash in the free agency pool. It comes a year after they snared Albert Pujols and with the spectacular rookie season of Mike Trout, the Angels now field a fearsome lineup.

title: Fiction or Nonfiction? Considering the Common Cores Emphasis on Informational Text
Crecimiento de Ciudades de la Amazona Inquieta a Cientficos
description: PARAUAPEBAS, Brasil  La Amazona durante mucho tiempo ha sido considerado como un mosaico vasto de selva tropical con unos cuantos asentamientos ribereos remotos. Pero el aumento sbito en la poblacin de las ciudades en la jungla actualmente subvierte esa visin rural y provoca alarma entre los cientficos, a medida que una gama de nuevos proyectos industriales transforma la Amazona en la regin de ms rpido crecimiento de Brasil.

title: Late Credit Card Payments Low and Expected to Stay There
description: Credit card delinquencies are likely to remain low, even as riskier consumers open more card accounts, according to an annual forecast from TransUnion, a consumer credit reporting company.

title: Lacking Fight and Song, Coach Gives Team Both
description: ST. PAUL  With his family as well as his football team, Glenn Caruso, the coach at the University of St. Thomas, established three rules.

title: Kutlug Ataman: Mesopotamian Dramaturgies
description: Sperone Westwater

title: John A. Parks: Paint and Memory
description: 532 Gallery Thomas Jaeckel

title: Keltie Ferris
description: Mitchell-Innes & Nash

title: Revisionist Art: Thirty Works by Bob Dylan
description: Gagosian Gallery

title: Argo Nods Make Case for Risky Films, Affleck Says
description: Ben Affleck was taking his kids to school in Los Angeles when he got word that Argo had been nominated for five Golden Globes. I get these frantic calls, about setting up interviews instantly, Mr. Affleck said. But he held off. Im like, my kids arent going to get themselves to school, he said, then waited a beat and added: I thought about telling them to learn to walk to school. (His daughters, he noted, had no idea about the Globes.)

title: Republicans Stand in the Way of Disaster Relief (Again)
description: Republicans in Congress like to find ways to hold the economy, and ordinary Americans, hostage to their ideological agenda. Just as they are once again threatening another phony debt ceiling crisis that will jeopardize the nations credit rating, they are, once again, threatening to withhold vital funds for Hurricane Sandy relief unless the Democrats agree to unrelated spending cuts.

title: Greater Debt Loads at Schools
description: The debt burden taken on by colleges and universities as a whole has more than doubled since 2000. The schools financial resources have not kept pace.

title: Hints of Cheesemaking in Prehistoric Europe
description: As long as 7,000 years ago, cheese was being made in northern Europe  albeit in a simple and functional form, a new study reports.

title: He Said, She Said in Web Site Redesign
description: In my last post, Beth Shaw, a She Owns It business group member, talked about the redesign of her companys Web site. Readers provided thoughtful suggestions and comments, giving her plenty to consider as she moves forward. Since then, she has signed the contract with her Web developer, New Possibilities Group, which was preparing a mock-up of YogaFits new home page when I checked in with her.

title: After Cutting I.P.O. Price, SolarCity Leaps in First Day of Trading
description: 5:00 p.m. | Updated

title: Cresce a populao da Amaznia brasileira
description: Parauapebas, Par  A Amaznia  vista h tempos como um vasto manto de floresta entremeado por remotos postos ribeirinhos. Porm, o explosivo crescimento das cidades na selva est virando essa viso de pernas para o ar e alarmando cientistas, enquanto uma srie de novos projetos industriais transforma a Amaznia na regio brasileira que mais rapidamente cresce.

title: Greek Oligarch Is Arrested in Fraud Inquiry
description: In a rare show of muscle, Greek authorities on Thursday arrested Lavrentis Lavrentiadis, a high-profile oligarch, at his home in an affluent Athens suburb in a criminal case that has underscored growing concerns in Greece over graft and crony capitalism.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: TV Hacking and Fitness Apps
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Party of No Ideas
description: Greg Sargent writes:

title: Rice Ends Bid for Secretary of State, and Fight With G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama knew before he picked up the phone on Thursday afternoon what Susan E. Rice, his ambassador to the United Nations, was calling about: she wanted to take herself out of the running for secretary of state and spare him a fight.

title: Storm Recovery Wont Be Business as Usual, Official Says
description: Visiting New York City, Shaun Donovan,the nations housing secretary and President Obamas appointee to oversee the post-Hurricane Sandy federal recovery effort, said on Thursday that he expected most of the damaged areas along the East Coast to be rebuilt but not necessarily as they were before.

title: Film Forum
description: Seen in fast forward, the career of David Thomson  the avid, idiosyncratic movie critic  looks more like a klatch session than a formal lesson in the history of film. Where many writers work suggests a dutiful progression, Thomson chases his subjects with free-associative license: Nicole Kidman to Alfred Hitchcock (with a hefty reference work in between), the big picture to the picayune. And where a lot of critics aim for impartial assessment, he has unapologetically privileged his private passions. Today, Thomson is best known for his New Biographical Dictionary of Film, but his strength is less taxonomy than transition, the almost cinematic way his mind cuts among its intellectual frames.

title: Pogues 12 Days of Gadgets: Sound Oasis Sound Therapy Pillow
description: You better not pout, you better not cry  today is Day 6 in Pogues 12 Days of Gadgets! A tech-gift goodie daily, under $100.

title: Small Utilities Credits Are Just the First Step, a Commission Says
description: Would a credit of $3 or $6 appease utility customers who are still steaming about how long they went without power or heat after Hurricane Sandy?

title: Kanyes Kilt
description: Kanye wore what? Based on the emphatic reactions on Twitter, Kanye West stole the show at last nights 12-12-12: The Concert for Sandy Relief  or rather, his leather skirt did. Was it Kim Kardashians, more than one smart aleck joked. No, it appears to be from Givenchys fall 2012 mens wear collection. And now it has its own Twitter account @KanyesSkirt.

title: Newly Minted New-Music Experts Leap Over a Cascading Niagara
description: John Adamss Grand Pianola Music has baffled and infuriated critics since its first performance in 1982. Scored for two pianos, three wordless singers, wind instruments and percussion, its an everything-but-the-kitchen-sink concerto that gleefully tosses out notions of stylistic purity for the sake of big effects and a lingering ironic aftertaste.

title: Theater Talkback: The Short Life of Evita
description: Are many tears being shed among Broadway lovers for the comparatively brief run of Evita, which announced a January closing on Tuesday? Probably not. The only people crying at the closing of this generally ill-received production are likely to be Ricky Martin fans who never made it to New York to catch the swivel-hipped Latin pop star on Broadway.

title: Copa Chaos in Brazil
description: Sometimes you know something is going to happen.

title: DealBook Conference Was Impressive, Lucrative and Chummy
description: There was a lot happening at the inaugural DealBook conference on Wednesday  and much of it was undeniably impressive.

title: Jennifer Lawrence and the Role That Keeps Revealing Itself
description: Bradley Cooper was home, luxuriating in bed, when he got the news of his Globes nomination, and Jennifer Lawrence, his co-star in Silver Linings Playbook, was in Hawaii. Tough life.

title: A Room to Herself for a Vermeer Girl
description: Paintings that have achieved superstar status need superstar treatment. Thats what Colin Bailey, chief curator at the Frick Collection, realized on a recent trip to Tokyo when, at an exhibition, he saw the crowds jostling to get a glimpse of Vermeers beloved Girl With a Pearl Earring.

title: Nissan Battery Plant Begins Operations in Tennessee
description: Nissan announced on Wednesday that its new lithium-ion battery plant in Smyrna, Tenn., is operating and will be ready with the batteries for the all-electric 2013 Nissan Leaf when production begins at the vehicle assembly plant next door early next year.

title: Out of Its Shell and Onto Your Plate
description: CALL the creatures scungilli, and you have an ingredient that Italian-Americans have long used in a seafood salad for the Feast of the Seven Fishes on Christmas Eve. But call them by their English name  whelks  and you have an item that is suddenly making news on cutting-edge menus.

title: The ABCs of HFR 3-D
description: Will you be seeking out The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey in HFR 3-D? Do you know what HFR 3-D is? Heres a primer to help understand this new theatrical format.

title: With Gap Wide and Time Short, Obama and Boehner Meet
description: WASHINGTON  With time running short to work out a deal to avert a year-end fiscal crisis, President Obama called Speaker John A. Boehner to the White House on Thursday evening to try to move talks forward even as pessimism mounted that a broad deal could be struck that bridges the substantial gap between the parties on taxes and entitlements like Medicare.

title: Woodson Reveals That He Challenged His Stars
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Shortly after Mike Woodson was named the Knicks interim coach in March, he brought his three best players, Carmelo Anthony, Amare Stoudemire and Tyson Chandler, into a room. He shut the door and told them to have a seat.

title: Chvez Faces Complications From Surgery
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Hugo Chvez of Venezuela experienced complications related to his cancer surgery, resulting in bleeding that required corrective measures, but he was showing signs of recovery, an official said Thursday.

title: TimesCast Politics:  Both Sides Still Apart on a Fiscal Deal
description: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images

title: Historical Hair Locks Selling at Auctions
description: Clippings from long-dead celebrities hair have emerged widely at auctions in recent years.

title: In Step Toward Palestinian Unity, Hamas Holds Rally in West Bank
description: NABLUS, West Bank  Hundreds of men and boys sporting the signature green of the militant Hamas faction marched through the narrow alleys of the old city here on Thursday afternoon, calling for Palestinian unity but also renewed attacks on Israeli cities, in the first public demonstration by the Islamist party allowed in the West Bank in years.

title: The Senate Does Something Right
description: Disabled veterans won a big, unexpected victory today: the Senate passed Senator Patty Murrays bill to expand fertility services, including in-vitro fertilization, at the Veterans Affairs Department. Ms. Murray, the Washington Democrat and chairwoman of the Veterans Affairs Committee, sponsored the bill, S.3313, to help service members whose war wounds have left them unable to have children. She said infertility was a particular problem for service members coming home from Iraq and Afghanistan, where improvised bombs frequently cause severe pelvic injuries.

title: Israeli Foreign Minister Faces Indictment on Lesser Charges
description: JERUSALEM  Avigdor Lieberman, Israels blunt-talking and polarizing foreign minister, will be charged with breach of trust but not with fraud and money laundering, prosecutors announced Thursday, ending an investigation lasting years and throwing a curve into Israels coming elections.

title: Iowans in House Pay Tribute to Colleague Who Lost Race
description: Representative Tom Latham may have taken down a fellow veteran from Iowa, Representative Leonard Boswell, in a member-on-member race last month. But he said goodbye politely.

title: A Guy Trades His Soul for Icelandic Acrobatics
description: Say youre a once-famous actor, moldering away in a nursing home. A condescending male nurse makes you do wheelchair aerobics to Wham!s Last Christmas. As it happens, youve just been caught attempting an inappropriate assignation with his sister, another nurse.

title: On Vevo, Gangnam Style Is the Viral Video That Never Was
description: What was the years most popular music video online?

title: Concert Organizers Still Tallying Sandy-Relief Donations
description: A day after a star-studded benefit concert at Madison Square Garden for victims of Hurricane Sandy, organizers said on Thursday they had not yet tallied how much had been raised through online donations, a telethon, ticket sales, merchandise and other revenue streams.

title: Even the Best City Hall Partnership Ever Can Have Differences
description: There has never been a mayor and a City Council speaker who have had a better relationship than Michael R. Bloomberg and Christine C. Quinn  ever.

title: Down the Shore, the Lost and the Found
description: A tour of favorite spots along the Jersey Shore a month after Hurricane Sandy wreaked havoc finds a region slowly starting to recover.

title: Tinsel for the Artist, Not the Christmas Tree
description: Might tinsel painting, a decorative and resourceful form of picture making that was all the rage during the second half of the 19th century, be due for a comeback? Possibly, to judge from Foiled: Tinsel Painting in America, a cluttered but charming show at the American Folk Art Museum in Lincoln Square.

title: Doctors Urge U.S. to Block Gas Export Terminals
description: More than 100 physicians urged the Obama administration on Thursday not to approve the construction of liquefied natural gas export terminals until more is known about the health effects of hydraulic fracturing, the drilling process that has opened the way for a big increase in domestic gas production.

description: Comedy

description: Movies

title: Asbury Park Memories
description: Romance in the salt air and moonlight remains even after Hurricane Sandy.

title: How to Read Like a Reading Machine
description: Editors note: Tyler Cowen, a professor of economics at George Mason University and co-proprietor of the popular economics blogMarginal Revolution,writes the One Sentence Book Review for The One Page Magazine, as well as a regular column for the Sunday business section. He reads more and more widely than any person we know, except professional book reviewers (but probably most of them too).

description: Animals at Jenkinsons Aquarium safe and sound through Hurricane Sandy.

description: Dance

title: Borders and Epochs, Dissolving at His Keyboard
description: EARLY in his career, beginning in the 1950s, the pianist and bandleader Eddie Palmieri used to play mambo shows at the Palladium Ballroom, on Broadway at 53rd Street. The Ed Sullivan Theater was just across the street but seemed to belong to a different, distant world: while Sullivans popular Sunday night TV show was happy to book the likes of Seor Wences, the Spanish ventriloquist, the frenetically danceable Latin music that Mr. Palmieri played was thought to lack mainstream appeal.

title: Ahead of Their Times, but Resolved to Love
description: When Alan Cumming turns on his beaming grin in Any Day Now, Travis Fines militant tear-jerker, he conveys such intense, unguarded emotion you almost want to avert your eyes. That smile, and the blazing performance it distills, conveys so ferocious a mixture of desire, hurt, defiance, courage, neediness and reckless abandon that it makes everyone else seem cowardly. You consider the real meaning of the Jerry Herman anthem, I Am What I Am, from La Cage aux Folles, as it is lived out in extremis by one flamboyantly gay man.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Dec. 14-20
description: Art

title: Angels Hoping Hamilton Builds on His Legacy
description: The Los Angeles Angels best player said it all in three letters: Wow. That was the reaction, via Twitter, of the Angels do-everything outfielder, Mike Trout, to the news Thursday that his team had signed Josh Hamilton from the rival Texas Rangers.

title: Down the Shore, the Lost and the Found
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J.  Im riding down Kingsley, looking for a place to park. With the crowds at Convention Hall, the Stone Pony and the Wonder Bar, there are no spots left on this oceanfront stretch. Im here to see the roller-derby championship, three weeks after Hurricane Sandy ripped through and devoured the boardwalk. Its night, and a waxing moon barely lights the culprit  the churning Atlantic, which both gives this place its life and threatens its existence.

title: The Drinks Are Expensive but the View Is Priceless
description: The bar at M Pche in the Chambers Hotel was closed for a private party, so it would be a night without seven-spice sours and steamed pork buns. The King Cole Bar at the St. Regis was so packed with souls  almost all of them merry, fittingly enough  that there wasnt even room to stand.

title: Russian State Role Seen in Death of Poisoned Spy
description: LONDON  New testimony that emerged Thursday deepened the intrigue surrounding the death of the former K.G.B. officer Alexander V. Litvinenko, offering prima facie evidence of Russian state involvement and indicating that he had been a paid agent of the British Secret Intelligence Service, MI6, lawyers at a preliminary inquest hearing said.

title: Where Opposites Attract
description: NEW HAVEN  In a museum era dominated by the vying forces of bad economics and compulsive building, its a miracle when something comes out right, which makes the opening of the splendidly renovated and expanded Yale University Art Gallery here a happy event. The angels of art, design and budgetary planning were on duty. Everything worked. The countrys oldest university art museum has arrived at a kind of institutional ideal of opposites in balance.

title: Bodies in Motion
description: Netta Yerushalmy, a lifelong dancer who first performed at just 3 years old, will present a new work, Devouring Devouring, tonight at the storied Off Off Broadway theater La Mama. The title may conjure images of gluttony, and Yerushalmy doesnt shy away from the food metaphor, describing the piece she has choreographed as a feast of offerings for the audiences eyes and minds.

title: Top Sichuan Official Removed in Corruption Inquiry
description: BEIJING  A high-ranking Communist Party leader who was the second most powerful official in Chinas southwest Sichuan Province was removed from his posts on Thursday amid corruption allegations that may hint of a wider crackdown on graft.

title: Spare Times for Dec. 14-20
description: Around Town

title: Leak of Climate Panel Drafts Speaks to Need for New Process
description: Dec. 14, 11:00 a.m. | Updates below |A WikiLeaks-style Web dump of drafts of the 2013 report from the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Changeprovides fresh evidence that the organizations policies and procedures are a terrible fit for an era in which transparency will increasingly be enforced on organizations working on consequential energy and environmental issues.

title: Opening the Doors to the Life of Pi
description: For those of us who have been intoxicated by the powers and possibilities of mathematics, the mystery isnt why that fascination developed but why it isnt universal. How can students not be entranced? So profound are the effects of math for those who have felt them, that you never really become a former mathematician (or ex-mathematics student) but one who has lapsed, as if it were an apostasy.

title: In Gangster State of Mind: Aging? Fuhgeddaboutit
description: The three geezers who run riot in Stand Up Guys arent just grumpy old men acting up. Theyre veteran gangsters whose final rampage before they surrender to the dying of the light is a triumphant affirmation of vitality that the movie milks for two parts comedy to one part pathos.

title: Few Echoes in a Voice With Mettle
description: At the end of her show at the Bowery Ballroom on Tuesday night, Solange was in the crowd, dancing, one reveler of many, set apart only by the fact that she had just been onstage, that it was her song moving the room, that her sister is Beyonc  but really, by none of that.

title: Spare Times for Children for Dec. 14-20
description: ALL ABOARD: HISTORIC TRAINS AND TOYS WEEKEND

title: Audience Participates; Kneepads Recommended
description: Imagine for the purposes of this review that you have a ticket for Yvonne Meiers dance-theater work The Shining. Not many do; only 12 people may attend each performance. First, in the foyer of New York Live Arts, you must sign a liability waiver. Then a naked woman greets you, sings to you and ushers you into a van that transports you to a location outside Manhattan. (Though its Web site announces that performances of The Shining are happening there, Ill preserve its mystery, as requested.)

title: Prompting Discussion on Torture
description: The new film Zero Dark Thirty and a recent Senate report reignite the debate over the United States governments policy on torture.

title: Fans Jeer DAntoni, but Sting Is in Defeat
description: Mike DAntoni got the warm embrace he hoped for upon returning to New York.

title: Damien Hirst Leaves Gagosian
description: Less than a year after the Gagosian Gallery gave Damien Hirst all 11 of its spaces around the world to show his spot paintings, word comes that the bad-boy British artist will no longer be represented by Gagosian, where he has shown on and off for 17 years.

title: No Reading Between the Lines
description: What does it say about a biography when the authors description of her working methods is more revealing than her text is. Thats the situation with Saul Steinberg, a studious, bone-dry book that is packed with information yet utterly inert. Its author, Deirdre Bair, has done far better work before, including her book on Simone de Beauvoir and her National Book Award-winning biography of Samuel Beckett. But when it comes to Steinberg she is hopelessly constrained by the circumstances in which she did her research and writing.

title: Where an Attach Comes With the Room
description: AS a certified butler from the Taj Hotels training program in New Delhi, Anupam Guha says he has waited on all manner of esteemed personages, including the former British prime minister Tony Blair (a dignified man,  he said, with a very soft human heart) and Aga Khan IV (a fan of sweets, to whom Mr. Guha served sugarcoated strawberries).

title: Dont Think About Santa as a Meal
description: With the avalanche of made-for-television holiday movies this year, practically any constituency you can think of has been served.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza Strip, Syria, India and Spain.

title: The Beatles Seat-of-the-Pants Movie
description: For many people the Beatles have ascended to a could-do-no-wrong status: Everything they ever did was great, brilliant, as good as it has ever been. Thats not true, of course. Even the best albums had some filler, and none of the movies are likely to be mistaken for Citizen Kane.

title: After North Koreas Missile Launch
description: No one can ignore us from now.

title: Android Malware Creeps Into Cellphone Bills
description: Smartphones are meant to be headache-free compared with old-school computers. But malicious software written for Android devices can be even sneakier than the malware that invaded PCs.

title: Revenue Rises, Deficit Falls: Fiscal Cliff Gets Credit
description: Let us pause to give credit where credit is due.

title: Comptroller Is Expected to Try to Upset Deal for New Taxis
description: City Comptroller John C. Liu is expected to announce on Friday that he will not sign off on the Bloomberg administrations contract with Nissan to provide New York Citys next generation of taxis, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: A Daughter Stumbling in Her Fathers Footsteps
description: It takes a stupid crime and an avoidable tragedy to realize that the title of the American independent movie The Girl refers to two people. The first is Ashley (Abbie Cornish), a solitary, thorny rose of Texas who lives in a trailer park and punches a clock at a dead-end job. Her manager favors the Latina workers, or so she believes; worse, her young son, Georgie (Austin Wayne West), has been taken away from her. She visits him soon after the story opens, dropping by the foster home where he lives and that, with its tidy lawn and swing set, looks pretty as a picture. Its a snapshot of the American dream that seems out of her reach and that will bring her and the second girl trouble.

title: Dancing by Night
description: Lessons in Haitian dance in East Flatbush, Brooklyn, offer fast-paced beats that recall their ultimate West African origins even as they announce their own distinctive intensity.

title: If College Admissions Were Like Tetris, Everything Would Fall in Line
description: Sush Krishnamoorthy, from New Delhi, is part of a Choice class that includes student-bloggers from Nairobi, Kenya; Topeka, Kan.; Seattle; Rogers, Ark.; Las Vegas; New York City; and Hunting Valley, Ohio. Her fourth post is below.  Tanya Abrams

title: Neighborhood Joint: Haitian Dance at La Difference Auto School
description: Where by day students learn the rules of the road, by night they can learn the art of djembes, conga drums and the distinct intensity of a countrys footwork.

title: Art and Real Estate Tango in Miami
description: MIAMI

title: Despite Risks, China Stays at North Koreas Side to Keep the U.S. at Bay
description: BEIJING  Even though North Korea ignored Chinas appeal not to test its new longer-range missile, the new leadership here appears intent on remaining a steadfast supporter of its wayward neighbor because it considers the North a necessary buffer against the United States and its allies.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for the most interesting things to do around the state this week.

title: For Images of Impending Death, Context Is Crucial
description: Our post Wednesday seeking your thoughts on the differences between two widely seen  and differently perceived  photographs of men moments away from death drew an outpouring of responses, both in the comments and on Twitter.

title: Mickey Boardmans Obsessions
description: A look inside the editorial director of Paper Magazines apartment.

title: From a Murder to Madness
description: My summer has stayed with me all my life, muses the narrator of the melodrama Saving Grace B. Jones. If you saw that summer in a movie, youd never believe it really happened. True enough.

title: Workers Paradise Lost
description: Philadelphia

title: Haitian Rhythms You Can Hear From the Street
description: BY day, La Difference Auto School offers lessons in turn signals and rights of way in English, French, Creole and Spanish from a ramshackle but brightly painted storefront in East Flatbush, Brooklyn. It hardly stands out among the car mechanics, polyglot bookstores, Trinidadian roti shops and Jamaican seafood markets in this busy Caribbean neighborhood. But on Sunday nights, Haitian rhythms spill onto Rogers Avenue from the schools back room, where drummers from La Troupe Makandal and dancers from La Troupe Zetwal organize lessons in traditional Haitian drumming and dance.

title: The Natural History Museum of Mickey
description: AS the editorial director of Paper Magazine, it is Mickey Boardmans job to discover and point out the sorts of things people ordinarily overlook and discard.

title: Iran: U.S. Expands Anti-Nuclear Sanctions
description: The United States expanded anti-nuclear sanctions against Iran on Thursday, blacklisting seven Iranian companies and five individuals including Fereydoon Abbasi, Irans top nuclear official and the target of a failed assassination attempt in Tehran two years ago, which Iran said was the work of Israeli operatives. The Treasury Department said the sanctions were intended to deter the procurement operations of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran, which is led by Dr. Abbasi; the Iran Centrifuge Technology Company; and Irans uranium enrichment program. Companies and people on the blacklist cannot do business with any American businesses or citizens, and any assets they may have in the United States will be frozen. The new sanctions, which came as a team of inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency was visiting Iran, were likely to anger Iranian officials, who have repeatedly rejected Western and Israeli accusations that their nuclear program is a cover to develop the ability to make atomic weapons.

title: Hark! The Herald Angels Didnt Sing
description: Stanford, Calif.

title: Something Borrowed, but Not Something Blue
description: FOR her formal wedding in September, Faye Juaniza Colon wore a strapless satin gown with tiny buttons down the back. It was a classic elegant ensemble, and the apple-size shoulder tattoo just didnt work.

title: Weighing Options for Expanding School Choice
description: In debates over school choice, like the one brewing as the 83rd legislative session draws closer, traditional public school districts are often cast as stubborn defenders of the status quo.

title: U.S. to Send 2 Missile Units to Turkey to Deter Syrians
description: WASHINGTON  The United States plans to send two Patriot missile batteries and about 400 military personnel to Turkey to defend against a possible Syrian missile attack, two allied officials said Thursday.

title: When It Comes to Race for House Speaker, Secretiveness Rules
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: Putin Backs Penalizing U.S. Judges in Adoptions
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia voiced support on Thursday for sanctions on American judges and others accused of having violated the rights of adopted Russian children in the United States. Such legislation is being proposed here in retaliation for a bill passed by Congress last week to punish people from Russia accused of violating human rights.

title: In Ignorance We Trust
description: A packet of letters arrived the other day from the honors English class at St. Lawrence School in Brasher Falls, N.Y. Snail mail, from high school sophomores? Yes, and honest, witty and insightful snail mail at that. They had been forced to read a book of mine.

title: Back When Americans Were the Illegals
description: The illegal immigrants had crossed the river in defiance of the law, then escaped capture by sneaking past armed patrols in the dark. They did not have the required paperwork and were ordered to leave, but the authorities suspected the immigrants would probably defy them.

title: Shopping Doesnt Have to Mean Suffering
description: To the Editor:

title: Religions Place in American Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Gay Conversion Therapy Ban
description: To the Editor:

title: Reversing Child Obesity
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: From Madison Square Garden to Madison Avenue
description: IT is not surprising that someone who works in advertising once interned at Vogue and has the fashion sense, and looks, to model occasionally. Similarly, it is not unusual to find ex-athletes at agencies. Nor is it out of the ordinary that someone in the industry is also an owner of a bar. Or active in causes like marriage equality and helping the victims of Hurricane Sandy. Or turns up, from time to time, in the gossip columns.

title: Manhattans Print Dealers
description: For a completely Zen shopping experience then, or if you insist, soon, few things are more relaxing than going through the old stock of Manhattans print dealers.

title: Holiday Foot-Dragging and Its Rewards
description: PERSONALLY, I like shopping on Christmas Eve. If you are not gripped by getting the perfect present in the perfect wrapping for the perfect person, its fun to go through a few stores at the end of the day as Midtown is emptying out, and buy whatever strikes your fancy. And for a completely Zen shopping experience then, or if you insist, soon, few things are more relaxing than going through the old stock of Manhattans print dealers.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,147 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: 7 Colleges Seem Ready to Bolt From Big East
description: After looking on as realignment diluted and marginalized the Big East Conference, the seven universities in the league that are not part of the Football Bowl Subdivision are expected to depart in the coming days and form a league revolving around basketball.

title: Holidays Without God
Rutgers Suspends Coach for Three Games, Citing Behavior
description: Rutgers suspended its mens basketball coach, Mike Rice, for three games and fined him $50,000 for a violation of athletic department policy, the university announced Thursday.

title: A Fed Focused on the Value of Clarity
description: WASHINGTON

title: A Mixed-Race Girl in a Mixed-Up World
description: Sweetness OHara, the quiet teenager at the center of the American independent movie Yelling to the Sky, lives in a small house that seems even smaller when her father is raging through it. As played by the young actress Zo Kravitz, Sweetness moves through life like a leaf in the wind. She drifts and scatters and at times gets caught underfoot, including by a gang of local bullies. Every so often, though, she faces down a more frightening, confusing antagonist, her father, Gordon (Jason Clarke), a violent drunk whose menace overruns his erratic charm.

title: The Credit Union Alternative
description: THIS year for the first time in their century-old history, credit unions are on track to surpass $100 billion in mortgage loan originations.

title: A Campus Art Museum, Renewed
description: A sign near the main entrance to the Yale University Art Gallery says, You may carefully touch. Its an invitation to set in motion a sculpture made of fragments of cast iron, broken porcelain and stainless steel by the contemporary American artist Robert Hudson. A modest push and the piece slowly revolves, its blue, rust and chrome chasing each other as if on a miniature carousel.

title: The Cost of Solitary Confinement
description: The New York Legislature greatly improved the treatment of mentally ill inmates in 2008, when it required the prison system to place seriously mentally ill inmates who violate rules into a treatment program instead of solitary confinement, where they were more likely to harm themselves or commit suicide.

title: As a Premier Prepares to Depart, the Talk Is of Lost Opportunities
description: ROME  As Prime Minister Mario Monti prepares to exit the stage, he has burnished Italys image  and his own  abroad, but he is less beloved at home. Italians are irate about higher taxes, while critics say that Mr. Monti failed to carry out the basic structural changes he said were needed, leaving a legacy more of austerity than growth.

title: To Gain From Rising Sales, G.M. Redesigns Pickups
description: PONTIAC, Mich.  Signs of recovery in the housing and construction industries have given a much-needed lift to the market for full-size pickup trucks, which took a beating during the recession.

title: Leader of Atlanta Turnaround Is Above All a Teacher
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga.  Mike Smith had just finished his second season coaching in the N.F.L., but he was already preparing for his retirement. It was late February 2001, and Smith was on his knees at a dusty playground in a village outside Cancn, Mexico, teaching a boy about 9 years old the technique of tackling.

title: The Mother-in-Law Gift Gap
description: My mother-in-law gives me significantly more-modest Christmas gifts than she gives my husband  even though I am the main breadwinner and my hard-earned dollars buy the extravagant presents we give her. Her gifts to me are in the $25 range and help with housework. Last year, she gave my husband a $5,000 present. I dont need anything from her, but our gift exchanges feel like a slap in the face. Are there rules for in-law gifts? Anonymous

title: Elevating Champagnes Unacknowledged Grape
description: PITY the poor pinot meunier grape. Its the third member of the Champagne trinity, yet given the proud superstar status of the other two  chardonnay and pinot noir  pinot meunier is often a humble afterthought, if its given any thought at all.

title: The G.O.P.s Existential Crisis
description: We are not having a debt crisis.

title: Failure to Commit in a World Where Romance Rules
description: Whats eating Sarah (Lizzy Caplan), the failure-to-commit heroine of the mopey comedy Save the Date? Sensitive men  the lead singer in a band (Wolfbird, no less), a gently awkward marine biologist  love her. Shes cute and droll and draws cute pictures. But should a man dare to say he loves her, or worse, propose marriage, she shuts off.

title: Pain Behind the Budget Cuts
description: You might never spot an air marshal on your flight, but its reassuring to know one might be there. In a few weeks, though, many of them are likely to get pink slips  along with food safety inspectors, border patrol agents and countless other government employees who play a crucial if hidden role in everyones lives.

title: Gloom and Doom for the Planet
description: This is appalling, says the actor Jeremy Irons, surveying a reeking mountain of consumer waste fouling a once glorious beach in Lebanon.

title: Merchant Ends Run on HBO
description: Larry Merchant, 81, the boxing commentator and International Boxing Hall of Fame inductee, will work his final regularly scheduled bout for HBO on Saturday when Nonito Donaire and Jorge Arce square off in Houston. It will be the end of a 35-year run for Merchant at HBO. Merchant covered every notable boxer in the previous three decades. Last year, he all but challenged Floyd Mayweather to a fight after a contentious in-ring interview. I wish I was 50 years younger, Merchant said.

title: Egypts Flawed Constitutional Vote
description: On Saturday, voters will begin casting their ballots in Egypt on their new constitution. But the process managed by President Mohamed Morsi has been so corrupted by power plays, division and violent protests that it is hard to see how the referendum can result in the consensus needed to lay a foundation for enduring democratic change. Mr. Morsi should have postponed the referendum, reconvened a constitutional assembly that was less dominated by his Muslim Brotherhood allies and charged its members with writing an amended charter that would respond to the concerns that his more liberal, secular opponents have with the current draft.

title: Report of 80s Sexual Abuse Rattles Yeshiva Campus
description: A tall, imposing rabbi with a black goatee who served as assistant principal and principal during his 27 years at Yeshiva University High School for Boys, George B. Finkelstein was the face of authority to Mordechai Twersky, who graduated in 1981.

title: Perseverance Reigns When Incurable Disease Strikes
description: Jason Becker: Not Dead Yet is really only partly about Mr. Becker, a guitar wizard whose promising career was derailed by one of the most unforgiving afflictions there is, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or Lou Gehrigs disease. This heartfelt documentary is also, more subtly, a tribute to the squadron of caregivers that has enabled Mr. Becker not only to survive for an extraordinarily long time but also to continue to compose music, using virtually the only part of him that still moves, his eyes.

title: Fighting the Power Across the Globe and Time
description: Infinitely less than the sum of its parts, Antonino DAmbrosios Let Fury Have the Hour crams 50 thoughtful artists into a disappointingly muddled film.

title: High-Tech Factories Built to Be Engines of Innovation
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y.  The Obama administration has long heralded the potential of American factories to offer good, stable middle-class jobs in an economy that desperately needs them. But experts say there might be another advantage to expanding manufacturing in the United States: a more innovative economy.

title: This Weeks Movies | Dec. 14, 2012
description: The New York Times critics on The Hobbit, Any Day Now and The Girl.

title: Paper Links Nerve Agents in 91 Gulf War and Ailments
description: Reviving a 20-year debate over illnesses of veterans of the 1991 Persian Gulf war, a new scientific paper presents evidence that nerve agents released by the bombing of Iraqi chemical weapons depots just before the ground war began could have carried downwind and fallen on American troops staged in Saudi Arabia.

title: Lottery Numbers
Quotation of the Day for Friday, Dec. 14, 2012
description: We borrowed a lot of money, but we had no choice. I wasnt going to watch the buildings fall down.

title: Prosecutor Says Morsi Aides Interfered in Inquiry
description: CAIRO  A prosecutor in Cairo is accusing aides to President Mohamed Morsi of applying political pressure to an investigation into the bloody clashes here last week, in order to corroborate Islamists claims about a conspiracy against the president involving thugs paid to foment violence.

title: In Cairo Crisis, the Poor Find Dashed Hopes
description: CAIRO  A faded poster of Hosni Mubarak hangs on a wall in a crumbling neighborhood here, reminding residents of an empty pledge to find jobs for young people. Down the street, a campaign banner for his successor, Mohamed Morsi, hangs across the road, a reminder of more recent promises unkept.

title: Promise vs. Reality in Newark on Mayors Watch
description: NEWARK  When snow blanketed this city two Christmases ago, Mayor Cory A. Booker was celebrated around the nation for personally shoveling out residents who had appealed for help on Twitter. But here, his administration was scorned as streets remained impassable for days because the city had no contract for snow removal.

title: Returning Home by Leaving Big East
description: It has been almost four years since Lou Carnesecca sat cross-legged in Madison Square Garden and diplomatically chose a word to describe the contemporary Big East as a basketball league. Unwieldy, the old coach said as he watched his beloved St. Johns play Georgetown on one of those March tournament afternoons when one could not help but measure the fine line between handsomely bigger and harmfully bloated.

title: Building a Showcase Campus, Using an I.O.U.
description: Some call it the Edifice Complex. Others have named it the Law of More, or the Taj Mahal syndrome.

title: Wake Up and Smell the Coffee
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Theres a certain amount of good-natured hazing that takes place when you go to work at The New York Times, and thats to be expected. Its not easy to get a large newspaper out every day, and having a little fun with the newbies is a good way to blow off steam.

title: Corrections: December 14, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Recent Critic of Jets Settles In as Their New Receiver
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Braylon Edwards took a spot in front of his locker after the Jets practice Thursday and within five minutes was attempting to run a nifty curl route around his recent Twitter message that the idiots calling shots were ruining the Jets.

title: Causes of Death
description: With more children around the world surviving to adulthood, more people are now dying of noncommunicable diseases like cancer or heart disease.

title: Hurricane Sandys Effects Leave Some Municipal Workers as Refugees, Too
description: City welfare workers with flashlights strapped to their heads are trudging up as many as 25 flights of stairs to dark, chilly offices to retrieve computers, Medicaid checks and, if time allows, a childs art project.

title: Hamas Gains Allure in Gaza, but Money Is a Problem
