Casano of Franklin Square, N.Y. Msgr. Thomas J. Harold, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Anne in Garden City.

title: Diana Elkind, Chad Maron
description: Diana Elkind and Chad Paul Maron were married Saturday by Robert S. Smith, an associate judge on the New York State Court of Appeals, at the Battery Gardens Restaurant in Manhattan.

title: Jessica Morgan, Saul Richter
description: Jessica Adrian Morgan, a daughter of Lynn H. Levy of Baltimore and Richard S. Morgan of Beach Haven, N.J., is to be married Sunday evening to Saul Moshe Richter, a son of Devera Dernis Richter and Rabbi Chaim Richter of Hollywood, Fla. The grooms father is to perform the ceremony at Temple Emanu-El in Closter, N.J.

title: Sarah Quick and Riley Stuebe
description: Sarah Kilroy Quick and Lt. Paul Henry Stuebe Jr. were married Saturday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York. The Rev. Thomas Collins, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Jorden Bickham and Eric Blankenbaker
description: Elizabeth Jorden Bickham, a daughter of Kathy Lee Bickham and John R. Bickham of New Canaan, Conn., was married Saturday to Eric Werner Blankenbaker, a son of Eileen Werner Blankenbaker and Robert W. Blankenbaker of Rockville, Md. The Rev. David W. Fleenor performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Transfiguration in New York, where he is an associate priest.

title: Stephanie Wiseman, Randy Beringer
description: Stephanie Beth Wiseman, a daughter of Helene Rudolph of Taunton, Mass., and Michael M. Wiseman of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., was married Saturday evening to Randy Paul Beringer, a son of Arlene Beringer and Jeffery Beringer of Ringwood, N.J. Rabbi Michelle Robinson officiated at the State Room, an event space in Boston, with Cantor Elias Rosemberg taking part.

title: Liz Fye, David Rosenwaks
description: Elizabeth Jane Fye and David Nichan Rosenwaks were married Saturday evening at the Loeb Central Park Boathouse in New York. Rabbi Dennis Math officiated.

title: Grace Kang, Jonathan Shaywitz
description: Grace Ward Kang and Dr. Jonathan Erik Shaywitz were married Saturday in Dana Point, Calif. Rabbi Jonathan Aaron officiated at the St. Regis Monarch Beach, a resort.

title: Sophia Hall and Troy Finkelstein
description: Sophia Barbara Hall and Troy Steven Finkelstein were married Wednesday at the Greek Church of the Holy Resurrection in Brookville, N.Y. The Rev. John Vlahos, a Greek Orthodox priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Allison Kornet, Matthew White
description: Allison Debra Kornet and Matthew Lewis White were married Saturday evening at Capitale, an event space in New York. Rabbi Michael Katz officiated, and Cantor Kalman Fliegelman assisted.

title: Allison Cohn and Kevin McLaughlin
description: Allison Rachel Cohn and Kevin Allen McLaughlin were married Thursday atop Coromandel Peak, which they reached by helicopter, in Wanaka, New Zealand. Beverley A. Clark an independent celebrant in Wanaka, officiated.

title: Amanda Fein, Jonathan Stein
description: Amanda Sharee Fein and Jonathan Micah Stein were married Saturday in Rockville, Md. Rabbi Jonathan A. Schnitzer performed the ceremony at Bnai Israel Congregation, with Rabbi Michael Safra taking part.

title: Alison Lang, Leonard Cooperman
description: Alison Brooke Lang and Leonard Jon Cooperman were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Michael Ehrlich at the Sands Atlantic Beach, an event space in Atlantic Beach, N.Y.

title: Emily Douglas and Jeffrey Neal
description: Emily Wallace Douglas and Dr. Jeffrey Thomas Neal were married Saturday at the Horticulture Center in Fairmount Park in Philadelphia. The Rev. Annie Piper, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Lindsay Rich, Michael Madarash
description: Lindsay Paige Rich and Michael Justin Madarash were married Saturday evening at Cold Spring Country Club in Huntington, N.Y. Rabbi Raphael C. Adler officiated.

title: Alison Hirsh and Jonathan Green
description: Alison Elizabeth Hirsh and Jonathan Darren Green are to be married Sunday in Manhattan. Rabbi Rex D. Perlmeter is to officiate at the Housing Works Bookstore and Cafe.

title: Newswallah: Long Reads Edition
description: In Open magazine this week, Gitanjali Chandrasekharan writes about the people who go missing in Mumbai every year  150 each month, on average, she says. The city also sees a steady influx of children, from places as far away as Bangladesh, Pakistan and Nepal. On some days, the police bring 10 runaways or more to one local shelter.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (VH1) VH1 DIVAS 2012 Ciara, Miley Cyrus, Demi Lovato, Kelly Rowland, Jordin Sparks, Kelly Clarkson, Melanie Fiona, Metric, Pitbull, Natasha Bedingfield, Keri Hilson, Ledisi, Iggy Azalea and Bootsy Collins pay tribute to divas of dance music, including Whitney Houston (above, in 2003) and Donna Summer. Adam Lambert hosts this concert, broadcast live from the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles; Havana Brown is the house D. J. The event will benefit the VH1 Save the Music Foundation, which supports music education in public schools.

title: North Koreas Rocket Launch
description: As interpreted by Heng.

title: First Round of Voting Spurs Dispute in Egypt
description: CAIRO  Supporters and opponents of President Mohamed Morsi sparred on Sunday over the preliminary results of a referendum on a draft constitution, which Egyptians moved toward approving in voting marked by long lines but low voter turnout.

title: The Dismal State of the Dismal Science
description: Menzie Chinn is having a dialogue, or something, with the Heritage Foundation. He pointed out that their arguments against stimulus, aside from being primitive and wrong, would also imply that the fiscal cliff is harmless. They respond in part by claiming that all theyre worried about is the incentive effects  yeah, right  and also by claiming that famous economists made the same arguments.

title: Japan Election Returns Power to Old Guard
description: TOKYO  Japans voters handed a landslide victory to the Liberal Democratic Party in national parliamentary elections on Sunday, giving power back to the conservative party that had governed Japan for decades until a historic defeat three years ago.

title: Naughty and Nice on a Yuletide Saturday Night Live
description: 12:58 p.m. | Updated

title: Gunman Took Big Supply of Ammunition to School After Killing Mother at Home
description: The gunman responsible for the shootings at a Connecticut elementary school on Friday first shot his mother multiple times in her home, then drove to the school armed with four weapons and a large supply of ammunition, officials said on Sunday.

title: Dec. 16 Updates on Connecticut Shooting Aftermath
description: Two days after the massacre at a school in Newtown, Conn., a shattered community headed off to church Sunday in the misty rain, only to have one service interrupted by death threats that forced the evacuation of the church during noon Mass. Investigators continued their struggle to understand what could have prompted Adam Lanzas rampage.

title: Lottery Numbers
Assimilated by the Peterson Borg
description: Oh, dear. This is embarrassing. Yet another Peterson deficit-scold front group has emerged, running a full-page ad in the Times. This time a bunch of national-security types, who should know better  plus Paul Volcker, who really should know better  have signed on.

title: China Plans on Continuity in Economic Policy in 2013
description: BEIJING  An annual conference that helps set economic policy in China ended with a lengthy government statement Sunday warning of difficulties in the global economy as well as industrial overcapacity and financial-sector risks at home.

title: The Hobbit Is No. 1 at the Box Office
description: From its bulbous goblin king to its nearly three-hour running time to its budget  an estimated $400 million, including global marketing costs  everything about The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is supersized. The movies box-office debut was no exception: The Hobbit (New Line Cinema and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer) took in a huge $84.8 million at North American theaters over the weekend to finish No. 1. (The film generated another $138.2 million overseas.)

title: The Freedom of an Armed Society
description: In the wake of the school massacre in Newtown, Conn., and the resulting renewed debate on gun control in the United States, The Stone will publish a series of essays this week that examine the ethical, social and humanitarian implications of the use, possession and regulation of weapons.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Forecast Is Sunnier, but Washington Casts a Big Shadow
description: The American economy could finally have a pretty good year next year  assuming Washington does its part.

title: Disruptions: Instagram Testimony Doesnt Add Up
description: On a late August morning, Kevin Systrom, chief executive of Instagram, took an oath before testifying at a hearing of the California Corporations Department, which sought to determine if Facebooks acquisition of the photo sharing service was in the best interest of Instagram investors. Facebook requested the hearing as a way to speed up the approval of its acquisition.

title: Photos of The Moment | 4 Artists 1 Cause Concert at Terminal 5
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Tongue in Cheek, Aiming at a Sweet Tooth
description: ACCORDING to the Mayan calendar, at least as some have jokingly interpreted it, the world may end on Dec. 21, but before then the Jell-O brand is introducing a tongue-in-cheek commercial about its own effort to avert the apocalypse.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO) PICTURE PARIS In this short film written and directed by Brad Hall, Julia Louis-Dreyfus (Mr. Halls wife) plays Ellen, a suburban mother who plans to fill the gap left by the departure of her youngest child for college by traveling to Paris with her husband, Randy (D. W. Moffett). In preparation she learns the language and the cuisine, flirts with the pool man and makes passionate love to Randy. But then reality intrudes on her fantasy.

title: These Tragedies Must End, Obama Says
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  President Obama vowed on Sunday to use whatever power this office holds to stop massacres like the slaughter at the school here that shocked the nation, hinting at a fresh effort to curb the spread of guns as he declared that there was no excuse for inaction.

title: U.S. Hunger for Yogurt Leads to Gigantic Factory
description: Chobani, the yogurt company that grew from nothing five years ago to a roughly $1 billion powerhouse today, on Monday will formally open one of the worlds largest yogurt-processing plants in Twin Falls, Idaho.

title: Buffeted by the Web, but Now Riding It
description: When the consumer Web exploded in the mid-1990s, part of the promise was that it would transform careers and the concept of work. Remember the signs on telephone poles and banners all over the Internet? Work at home and turn your computer into a cash register! Ask me how. The next generation of Americans would be able to work on their own terms.

title: An Awkward, Articulate Pose by Way of Tel Aviv and Manhattan
description: In Devouring Devouring, an aptly named new work by the choreographer Netta Yerushalmy, the dancers practically ate the stage alive. At the start Joanna Kotze took firm steps along the perimeter of La MaMas Ellen Stewart Theater, where the work was presented from Thursday through Sunday. While facing the back wall, she delivered a high kick and then, as if being sucked through a wind tunnel, ended up on the floor stretched on her side. Quickly she shot a leg up and remained still as a statue.

title: A Syrian Airstrike Kills Palestinian Refugees and Costs Assad Support
description: DAMASCUS, Syria  Government forces for the first time hit Syrias largest Palestinian refugee neighborhood with airstrikes on Sunday, killing at least eight people in the Yarmouk district of Damascus and driving dozens of formerly pro-government Palestinian fighters to defect to the rebels, fighters there said.

title: Onetime Allies in Antitrust Part Ways Over Google
description: In the digital economy, 14 years is an eternity. Fast-shifting technology means that companies, once feared and seemingly invincible, fade, while new powers rise to dominance, raising fresh sets of concerns.

title: The Newtown School Shootings: A Place to Post Your Thoughts
description: In lieu of our usual Student Opinion question, we invite students to post their thoughts and feelings about the news of the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., in which 20 children and seven adults lost their lives.

title: Apps Give Preschoolers a First Look at TV Shows
description: In 2014, the preschool cable network Nick Jr. plans to introduce a television show featuring a little boy, his miniature pet dragon and a magic stick.

title: Two Games, Then a Break
description: ALKMAAR, the Netherlands  Maybe youve read some of the stories and heard some of the rumors about all this transfer stuff. All I can tell you is that Im not worried about any of that. Im doing well here. Im in a good spot, and Im really enjoying myself. I cant worry about all that noise.

title: Rifle Used in Killings, Americas Most Popular, Highlights Regulation Debate
description: It comes in black, tan and camouflage. A pink version was once raffled by a gun store to raise money for breast cancer research.

title: The Paper Trail Through History
description: Since their publication in 1971 the Pentagon Papers have been examined seemingly from every possible historical, political, legal and ethical angle.

title: Guitar Solos Help Close Rolling Stones Tour
description: NEWARK  The Rolling Stones brought their 50th anniversary tour to a close on Saturday night at the Prudential Center here. In a steamroller show, they were joined by several guests  a howling Lady Gaga, a beatific Mick Taylor, a red-faced Bruce Springsteen.

title: Group Aims to Be a Conduit for WikiLeaks Donations
description: A group advocating a more transparent government has formed a nonprofit organization called the Freedom of the Press Foundation to serve as a conduit for donations to organizations like WikiLeaks. The goal is to insulate those groups fund-raising efforts from political and business pressures.

title: No Longer Anytown
description: As relatives and neighbors in Newtown, Conn., tried to process the tragedy at Sandy Hook Elementary School, memorials and holiday decorations blurred into one.

title: Herding Cats for Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELES  Youre making a Hollywood movie. You see some funny cat videos on YouTube. Those cats would love to be in pictures, you think.

title: In the Crowds of New York, To Be Exclusive Is to Know that You Exist.
description: One thing kept bugging me when I was reporting my article on Barneys: Sure, the store in the 80s and 90s was a paragon of cool, but so what? Lots of New York stores have been daring  for their fashion, design and windows. What made the difference at Barneys? An illuminating source was an essay by James B. Lindheim called A New Class, which ran in August 1975 in Harpers. At the time, Lindheim was a vice president of the marketing and research firm Yankelovich, Skelly and White.

title: One-Sided Defeat Leaves the Giants in a Three-Way Tie
description: ATLANTA  All week, Giants players said this year could be different. They had lived through the stress that came with spending the final month of last season with their tiptoes on the precipice and, after they walloped the New Orleans Saints a week ago, it seemed reasonable to think that this time, they really might make the finish a little less dramatic. Maybe, just maybe, they said, they could make it easier on their fans, their coaches and themselves.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released this week includes the current account deficit for the third quarter (Tuesday); housing starts for November (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, final third-quarter G.D.P., existing home sales for November, the Philadelphia Fed index, and leading economic indicators for November (Thursday); and personal income and spending for November and the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for December (Friday).

title: A Concert of Two Works That Were Rejected at First and Embraced Later
description: There can be few worse insults for a composer than having a piece rejected by its intended recipient. William Walton, writing in 1962, recalled his depression decades before when the violist Lionel Tertis rejected his new Viola Concerto and mailed the score back to him.

title: Commenting on a Death Gets a Puppet in Trouble
description: Its been a bad few months for puppets in the media.

title: Aeolian Airs, 50 Years On
description: For any musical institution a 50th anniversary is cause for celebration. But there must be a special pride in the occasion if you happen to be a new-music group responsible for bringing into existence pieces that have attained lives of their own. So it was when the Aeolian Chamber Players, a mixed ensemble that made its New York debut at Town Hall in January 1962, celebrated a half-century with a concert in the Thalia at Symphony Space on Friday evening.

title: You Are All Soft! Embrace Chaos!
description: A reader could easily run out of adjectives to describe Nassim Nicholas Talebs new book Antifragile: Things That Gain From Disorder. The first ones that come to mind are: maddening, bold, repetitious, judgmental, intemperate, erudite, reductive, shrewd, self-indulgent, self-congratulatory, provocative, pompous, penetrating, perspicacious and pretentious.

title: S.E.C. Says Asset Firm Manipulated Trades to Enrich Some Clients
description: Just a few years ago, sitting in his 19th-floor office with panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean, 3,000 miles from Wall Street, Peter J. Eichler Jr., had reached the top of the money management world.

title: Stevie Wonder Songs, Refashioned and Repackaged
description: Jazz musicians taking on Stevie Wonders repertory is an old story, but more recently its acquired a newer, more serious, and almost fashionable purpose. The pianist Robert Glasper was sure to get involved. His work, including this years album Black Radio (Blue Note), has shown how younger jazz musicians can merge naturally with hip-hop and soul without completely yielding to them.

title: Shootings Prompt TV and Movie Changes
description: Some media companies have adjusted their plans because of the school shootings in Connecticut. The Fox network and the Syfy cable channel both quietly changed episodes of series planned for the weekend. Syfy did not broadcast a scheduled episode Friday night of the show Haven because it contained scenes that involved violence in a school. Fox decided on Saturday that it would replace the planned episodes of two animated series, Family Guy and American Dad, that were to be broadcast Sunday night. The network made no official statement, but one executive confirmed that the decision was made because the content of the episodes could have been seen by some viewers as insensitive in light of these recent events. In both cases the networks scheduled repeats to fill those hours. Paramount Pictures has postponed the United States premiere of Jack Reacher in response to the shootings, The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reported. This action film, which stars Tom Cruise and contains a scene in which a sniper attack leaves several people dead, was originally set to be unveiled on Dec. 15 in Pittsburgh, where a large portion of the movie was filmed. The premiere was postponed out of honor and respect for the families of the victims whose lives were senselessly taken, according to a statement from the studio; the event has not been rescheduled. The film, featuring the Reacher character popularized in Lee Childs series of novels, is still set for a nationwide release this Friday.

title: Fresh Take
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Well, this was nice and easy, just as a Monday puzzle should be. Elizabeth A. Longs cat-festooned grid was a smooth and satisfying solve for me. How did you do?

title: The Soundtrack as Co-Star
description: Nashville, the salacious drama about the country-music business that had its premiere on ABC in October, has been fastidious in capturing the citys details: the petty and shortsighted intergenerational squabbling, the paunchy managers with sport coats the color of drywall, the awful fonts on the album covers. This Nashville is a city of flash, which valorizes fame and arena-size ambitions and the machines at work to make those things happen.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Q. I enjoy the Two of a Kind song that plays in one of the commercials for the new Apple iPad Mini. Are there two different singers, or is it one of those gimmicks where its the same person singing a duet with himself?

title: Labor Over Capital
description: To the Editor:

title: New Cancer Treatments
description: To the Editor:

title: Hope in Sex Abuse Verdict
description: To the Editor:

title: College Footballs Excesses
description: To the Editor:

title: Comedian Brings Her Act Home, to Mom and Dad
description: What the comedian Maria Bamford really wants is the approval of her parents.

title: Antibiotics in Livestock
description: To the Editor:

title: A Lifetime Spent Stoking the Flames
description: Happy Birthday! someone from the crowd shouted in the Rose Theater on Saturday night, a handful of songs into Jazz at Lincoln Centers tribute to Eddie Palmieri. Its about time! shot back Mr. Palmieri, the indomitable Latin bandleader and pianist, puckishly noting his age as 26, half a century younger than he is. Then he was back to business, dedicating the next tune to one of his bedrock jazz heroes, Thelonious Monk.

title: Coping in Newtown
description: People devastated by the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School gathered at memorials around Newtown, Conn., to mourn with one another.

title: From Seething to Earnest, a Work Raises Passions
description: Handels Messiah may be the only sure thing in classical music. Though the New York Philharmonic doesnt play Beethovens Fifth every year, and sometimes the Metropolitan Opera gives La Bohme a breather, Messiah never takes a break.

title: Christmas With Bach, Times Two
description: Handels Messiah, it appears, will reign forever and ever over the Christmas season, no matter that it was written for Easter. In theory, Bachs Christmas Oratorio is a better fit, but there are reasons it doesnt receive similar play.

title: Moments of Softness in Catwalk Strut
description: Lets agree that Alvin Aileys Revelations (1960) is one of the great works of the human spirit. The aspects of humanity it demonstrates  sincerity, idealism, ecstasy, among others  build up to a powerful moral statement that audiences love. We dont require that all dance works celebrate these virtues, but its chilling when some negate them. Unfortunately that negation occurs in some other pieces performed by Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: Following the Tradition of Being Untraditional
description: WASHINGTON  Jason Morans vision for jazz programming at the Kennedy Center here, since his appointment as an adviser to the center last year, has been playful and inclusive. His first programmed season, which started in October, runs from jazzs straight-ahead, 1950s-based languages and traditions to more recent, and less American, examples  from, say, the Basie-band saxophonist Frank Wess to the Norwegian pianist Tord Gustavsen, to pick two examples on the schedule. But its up to something else too.

title: A Female Exploration of Myth, From Salzburg to New Zealand
description: A mythic quest involving fellowship and solitude; the startling beauty, by turns lush and austere, of a wild land; imposing jewelry possessed of special power: if you now have visions of The Hobbit floating in your heads, please banish them. The matter at hand is I came here on my own., a video installation by the duo robbinschilds that had its premiere this fall at Art in General.

title: Gold Cup Final in England
description: The final of the Gold Cup, Britains premier bridge event, in Solihull, England, was between the top seeds, Alexander Allfrey, Andy Robson, Peter Crouch, Derek Patterson, Tony Forrester and David Gold, who had come back from the dead in the semifinal; and Janet de Botton, Nick Sandqvist, David Burn, Thor Erik Hoftaniska and Artur Malinowski, who easily won their semifinal.

title: Will the Real Giants Team Stand Up?
description: A capsule look at the Giants 34-0 loss to Atlanta:

title: Life Sentences for Low-Level Crimes
description: To the Editor:

title: Knick Who Didnt Want to Go Is Glad to Be Back
description: Long before the Knicks played the Los Angeles Lakers on Thursday and long after many of his teammates had departed the pregame shootaround, point guard Raymond Felton continued to work on his midrange moves with the assistant Darrell Walker.

title: The Public Square
description: In Times Square, protesters counter an anti-Islamic speech by pastor Terry Jones ... by singing the Beatles.

title: The Public Square
description: Note to Viewers:

title: With a Supermajority, California Democrats Begin to Make Plans
description: LOS ANGELES  The Democratic Party has controlled the California Legislature for a nearly unbroken stretch of 42 years. Yet control goes only so far: it takes two-thirds of the Legislature to enact a host of important legislation in this state, meaning that even the diminished Republican Party has been able to easily frustrate Democratic ambitions.

title: Voting Begins to Give Board Authority to Dissolve N.H.L. Players Union
description: More than 700 members of the N.H.L. Players Association began voting Sunday on whether to give the unions executive board the authority to file a disclaimer of interest, a move that would effectively dissolve the union and allow individual players to file antitrust suits against the N.H.L.

title: The Day the Stars Wept
description: The majority of fighting at Fredericksburg had ground to a halt as the sun slipped below the horizon on Dec. 13, 1862. Ghastly piles of dead men and horses were scattered in the fields, and the woods were littered with abandoned equipment and debris. Sporadic gunfire continued as exhausted survivors on both sides ventured out into the war-blasted landscape to rescue wounded comrades.

title: Good Name Is Restored in Terrain Known for Tea
description: DARJEELING, India  Among connoisseurs, few teas surpass a good Darjeeling. The smooth and mellow taste commands a premium price, and the name itself evokes a bygone era when the British first introduced Chinese tea plants here in the Indian foothills of the Himalayas.

title: That Terrible Trillion
description: As you might imagine, I find myself in a lot of discussions about U.S. fiscal policy, and the budget deficit in particular. And theres one thing I can count on in these discussions: At some point someone will announce, in dire tones, that we have a ONE TRILLION DOLLAR deficit.

title: Same-Sex Marriage Finds Allies in Conservatives of a Certain Age
description: Doug Montzka, a contractor from St. Paul, describes himself as a devout Christian, a very conservative Republican and, only recently, a supporter of same-sex marriage.

title: Stingy City Hall
description: Why is the Bloomberg administration making it so hard for people who need emergency food stamps because of Hurricane Sandy to get them?

title: Do Lower Taxes Create Jobs? Look at Clinton and Bush.
description: For Republican supply-siders, denying that marginal tax rates are the sole way to induce or impede economic growth is equivalent to apostasy.

title: Leadership Meeting in South Africa Confronts Bitter Divisions in the A.N.C.
description: BLOEMFONTEIN, South Africa  When the leaders of the African National Congress gathered here in January to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the founding of their party, there was Champagne, a cake the size of a Ping-Pong table and a festive mood in the air.

title: South Africa Since Mandela
description: JOHANNESBURG

title: Fighting for Relevance and Facing His End as a Jet
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The Jets, in all likelihood, have three games left. Three games for pride. Three games before an off-season of uncertainty and change. Three games until Bart Scott cleans out his locker at the Jets center here for the final time.

title: Alaskas Open Spaces Open Up Even More
description: ANCHORAGE  A quietly profound generational change is about to sweep through federal agencies here in the nations biggest and wildest state  but also by many measures, its most government-dependent  where hundreds of millions of acres of public land are set aside for national parks and preserves.

title: Its Restaurants Empty and Its Trains Stalled, Hoboken Encounters Storms Increasing Toll
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  It is happy hour at the Hotel Victor Bar and Grill on a Friday and the place is nearly empty. The evening commuters who would normally be emerging from the PATH train station across the street about this time, filling streets with thousands of potential customers, are nowhere in sight.

title: In Town at Ease With Its Firearms, Tightening Gun Rules Was Resisted
description: People in the rural, hilly areas around Newtown, Conn., are used to gunfire. In one woodsy stretch, southeast of downtown, the Pequot Fish and Game Club and the Fairfield County Fish and Game Protective Association, where members can fish in ponds and hunt pheasant, lie within a mile of each other, and people who live nearby generally call them good neighbors.

title: Texans Cement Supremacy in Division and Look Beyond
description: HOUSTON  Arian Foster and Dwight Freeney embraced at midfield and, after a few heartfelt words, began pulling their shoulder pads over their heads. They exchanged jerseys, Foster giving up his Houston Texans No. 23 and Freeney handing over his Indianapolis Colts No. 93  one that will hang in Fosters collection to commemorate Houstons second consecutive A.F.C. South division title.

title: Coming Soon: The Beer of Kings
description: Fans of the HBO series Game of Thrones will have an opportunity to raise a flagon of ale in its honor next spring, when a new line of beers inspired by that series is introduced. HBO is set to announce that it will team up with Brewery Ommegang, a Belgian-style brewery in Cooperstown N.Y., to create beers based on themes and characters in the fantasy series adapted from the novels by George R. R. Martin.

title: Media Spotlight Seen as a Blessing, or a Curse, in a Grieving Town
description: NEWTOWN, Conn.  Wolf Blitzer understands that his presence here is not appreciated by some local people, who wish that the TV satellite trucks, and the reporters who have taken over the local Starbucks, would go away and leave them to ache, grieve and mourn in peace.

title: Google Antitrust Case Is Said to Be Nearing End
description: 10:08 p.m. | Updated  Adding that Google and the F.T.C. declined to comment.

title: Lights at Dusk and Dawn
description: On the street there are only a few New Yorkers. A man walking a dog the size of his shoe. A young woman carrying a yoga mat. Cyclists, joggers, aluminum can collectors. Tall brown bags of new bread lean against a restaurant door. Some taxis prowl and some rush headlong down the avenues  empty nearly all of them. The sky overhead is just now going from cast iron to a light gray Teflon, with dawn just offshore.

title: Ailing Mayor of Boston Says Hes Still Up to the Job
description: BOSTON  He was an accidental mayor, not even aspiring to the job. Plenty of people thought he was not up to it. But after almost 20 years in City Hall, Thomas M. Menino is the longest-serving mayor in Boston history and fits this city like an old shoe.

title:
A Painful Duty: Consoling a Town
Preparing to Bury Its Children
description: Rabbi Shaul Praver watched closely as the grieving mother stepped into the funeral home where her son, Noah, 6, lay.

title: How to Fight Homelessness
description: Despite the economic downturn, the Obama administration has managed to keep the homeless population steady over the last four years, for which it deserves considerable credit. But many people remain at risk of finding themselves on the street, especially poor families. This means that ways must be found to enlarge underfinanced rental assistance programs that now reach only about a quarter of the low-income families that qualify.

title: Mets Show Gratitude With a Pitch in the Dirt
description: The title of R. A. Dickeys memoir is Wherever I Wind Up, a nod to his dancing knuckleball and itinerant pitching career. He wrote the book before he won the National League Cy Young Award this year, a feat that should have answered the question of where his journey would lead.

title: Big Decision on Afghanistan
description: One only has to read the Pentagons progress report on the Afghanistan war effort released last Monday to understand how pointless it is to keep 68,000 American troops there any longer. The mounting evidence makes it clear that they should be pulled out as soon as it can be done safely, instead of waiting until the end of 2014, the date set by the United States and NATO.

title: The Nation Heads Back to School With New Worries About Safety
description: In Boston, the public schools have asked the police to step up visits to elementary schools throughout the day on Monday.

title: Mets Agree to Trade Dickey, a Cy Young Winner, to Toronto
description: After making his Mets debut in May of the 2010 season, R. A. Dickey came to represent a once-every-five-days antidote for fans sickened by losing records, late-season collapses, financial difficulties, unrelenting bad luck and prolonged bad play. A 38-year-old knuckleballer, he won 20 games and the National League Cy Young Award last season.

title: Lottery Numbers
2 Correction Officers Are Killed in Brooklyn Crash
description: Two New York City correction officers died early Sunday after their vehicle veered into oncoming traffic on a wide Brooklyn road and slammed into a sport utility vehicle driven by an off-duty police officer, the authorities said.

title: Michigan Effort Shows G.O.P. Sway in State Contests
description: As Republican leaders in Washington grappled after the election with their failure to unseat President Obama, Dick DeVos, one of Michigans wealthiest men, began dialing up state lawmakers in Lansing.

title: Matchup: Jets (6-7) at Titans (4-9)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN

title: Rape Case Unfolds on Web and Splits City
description: STEUBENVILLE, Ohio

title: Fleeing Taxes and Insult, Grard Depardieu Says Au Revoir, La France
description: PARIS  The actor Grard Depardieu, who was best known until recently as a pillar of French cinema with an occasionally embarrassing tendency to over-imbibe, this week made an ignominious name for himself as a tax evader, drawing the ire of the government, the news media and a good number of his fellow French citizens.

title: A Playoff Chase Full of Falls, Rises and Surprises
description: When the N.F.L. began rejiggering its schedule to push more division games into the final weeks of the season, it hoped to conjure days like Sunday, when the entire season seemed to tilt within the space of a few hours. What the N.F.L. could not have imagined was that on the most compelling day of the 2012 season, when six games paired winning teams  the latest on the calendar that has ever happened  it was the nondivision games that provided the most intrigue, even in their noncompetitiveness, and cast the most shadow onto a murky playoff picture.

title: Roger Prigent, 89, Photographer and Antiquarian, Dies
description: Roger Prigent, who gave up a promising career in fashion photography when his eyesight began to fail three decades ago and who became a prominent Manhattan antiques dealer, leading a popular new wave in French Empire furnishings, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 89.

title: Giants Rookies Step Into Larger Roles With Frustrating Results
description: ATLANTA  On Saturday night in their shared room at the Loews Hotel, cornerback Jayron Hosley and tailback David Wilson resisted the urge to discuss the magnitude or calculate the improbability of two rookies from the same university starting a game for the defending Super Bowl champions.

title: Dr. John Rosen, Who Pushed to Prevent Lead Poisoning, Dies at 77
description: Dr. John F. Rosen, a pediatrician whose discovery of high levels of lead poisoning among the New York City children he treated propelled him to campaign for a national effort to prevent the condition, died on Dec. 7 in Greenwich, Conn. He was 77.

title: Troops Mass in Fought-Over City, Raising Fear of New Violence in Congo
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Hundreds of troops from opposing sides have been moving into new positions around Goma, a strategic, contested city in the Democratic Republic of Congo, aid organizations said Sunday, raising worries of yet another explosion of violence.

title: Preserving the Darjeeling Name
description: Now, a cup of Darjeeling tea will have to be made only from tea grown around Darjeeling, India.

title: Reviewing Week 15 in the N.F.L.
description: DAYS BEST

title: Jeni LeGon, Singer and Solo Tap-Dancer, Dies at 96
description: Jeni LeGon, a singer and tap dancer who hoofed her way from the South Side of Chicago to Hollywood, where she shared the screen with Bill Bojangles Robinson and Cab Calloway, and to Broadway, where she performed to the music of Fats Waller, died on Dec. 7 in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was 96.

title: First a Batting Champion, Next a Cy Young Winner Depart Flushing
description: In their half century of existence, the Mets have made their fair share of history: Most losses in a season, for instance, and two memorable World Series wins. Until last year, they were also one of the few teams never to have thrown a no-hitter.

title: Teachers Being Targeted and Murdered in Thailand
description: HONG KONG  In Thailand, its the teachers who are being targeted and killed  in their schools, during the day, in front of their students, with assault weapons.

title: Newtown Grieves
description: Photos show the mourning of the Connecticut town where two days earlier a gunman killed 27 people, including 20 first graders.

title: For Spaniards, Having a Job No Longer Guarantees a Paycheck
description: VALENCIA, Spain  Over the past two years, Ana Mara Molina Cuevas, 36, has worked five shifts a week in a ceramics factory on the outskirts of this city, hand-rolling paint onto tiles. But at the end of the month, she often went unpaid.

title: A.I.G. Sells Remaining Stake in Asian Insurer for $6.5 Billion
description: 10:21 p.m. | Updated

title: Chvez Party Wins Vote Amid Uncertainty
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  With President Hugo Chvez cancer-stricken and potentially unable to continue in office, Venezuelans showed overwhelming support for his party in elections for governor on Sunday, giving it control over almost all of the nations 23 states.

title: Knicks Speak on Lins Return
description: The Knicks will meet Jeremy Lin for the second time this season on Monday night but for the first time at Madison Square Garden, where Linsanity reigned briefly and intensely last season before Lin departed as a free agent and joined the Houston Rockets.

title: Actor Renounces His Citizenship in Snit Over French Tax Burden
description: PARIS  Grard Depardieu, the famous French actor, will be French no more, so exasperated is he with French taxes and the French government, he declared in an angry open letter to Frances prime minister on Sunday.

title: Obama Expected to Name Kerry as Secretary of State
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is leaning strongly toward naming John Kerry, the Massachusetts senator and unsuccessful Democratic nominee for president eight years ago, to succeed Hillary Rodham Clinton as secretary of state, according to administration officials and friends of Mr. Kerry.

title: When Youkilis Became a Bar Mitzvah
description: Kevin Youkilis is part of the small fraternity of Jewish major leaguers, a point that was underscored last week when he signed a one-year contract to play in New York, where his background will create considerable interest.

title: I.B.M. Looks Ahead to a Sensor Revolution and Cognitive Computers
description: The year-end prediction lists from technology companies and research firms are  lets be honest  in good part thinly disguised marketing pitches: These are the big trends for next year, and  surprise  our products are tailor-made to help you turn those trends into moneymakers.

title: Giants Replay: Week 15
description: Action from the Giants 34-0 loss to the Falcons in Atlanta that left them in a three-way tie for first place in the N.F.C. East.

title: Word of the Day | victuals
description: victuals \vi-tls\ noun

title: Vaccine Rule Is Said to Hurt Health Efforts
description: A group of prominent doctors and public health experts warns in articles to be published Monday in the journal Pediatrics that banning thimerosal, a mercury compound used as a preservative in vaccines, would devastate public health efforts in developing countries.

title: Despite Obstacles, Studying and Working Hard
description: Raphia Smith has a lot on her plate. She looks fashionable, with cropped, bleached-blond hair and a tank top that reads Sexy in glittery italics. She likes photography and listens to hip-hop and reggae, but Ms. Smith, 21, does not have the freedom to go out and do the things a young woman her age typically might.

title: N.F.L. Replay: Week 15
description: The A.F.C. South and the N.F.C. North divisions were won while the N.F.C. East division has a three-way tie.

title: Corrections: December 17, 2012
description: NEW YORK

title: U.S. Women Circumspect on Latest Soccer League
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Moments after her team completed a 10-city exhibition tour with a 4-1 victory over China, United States midfielder Megan Rapinoe fielded a question Saturday night about the latest attempt to start a womens professional soccer league in this country.

title: Dake Shines at Garden Wrestling Event
description: Cornells Kyle Dake, a 21-year-old senior who is the top-ranked wrestler at 165 pounds, defeated No. 13 Zach Toal of Missouri and No. 3 Tyler Caldwell of Oklahoma State and was named the outstanding wrestler at Grapple at the Garden, the first collegiate wrestling event Madison Square Garden has staged since it opened in 1879. Dake, a three-time N.C.A.A. champion, is widely considered the top college wrestler in the country.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, Dec. 17
description: We cant accept events like this as routine. Are we really prepared to say were powerless in the face of such carnage?

title: News Quiz | December 17, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: For 200 Million Indians, a Life Steeped in Discrimination
description: One in six Indians  approximately 200 million people in all  is born a Dalit. From the day a Dalit is born, life is predestined. Caste discrimination seeps through social symbols, practices and traditions, dooming Dalits to a lifetime of inequity and a position on the lowest rung of Indian society.

title: IHT Quick Read: Dec. 17
description: NEWS President Obama vowed on Sunday to use whatever power this office holds to stop massacres like the slaughter at the school in Connecticut that shocked the U.S., hinting at a fresh effort to curb the spread of guns as he declared that there was no excuse for inaction. Mark Landler reports from Newtown, Connecticut, and Peter Baker from Washington.

title: A Gift of Flowers
description: Dear Diary:

title: From Darjeeling, Distinguishing Between Flushes
description: Tea is tea, or so I thought before a recent trip to Darjeeling. I had not realized there were different tea seasons. And I had never associated the word flushes with tea.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Dec. 17, 2012
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Pete Diamantis at Math for America from the article For PC Virus Victims, Pay or Else.

title: A Photographic Vision in Lourdes
description: Its easy enough to caricature the spectacle of the pilgrims who flock to Lourdes. On crutches, wheelchairs and gurneys, the broken in body  but not in spirit  pray and meditate in the very grotto where a 14-year-old Bernadette Soubirous said she saw the Virgin Mary in 1858.

title: Week 15 Quick Hits: A Cowboys-Steelers Classic
description: Andy Benoit takes a tour of Sundays Week 15 games. Share your thoughts.

title: Portraits From the Kochi Biennale: Video Artist Angelica Mesiti
description: At the Kochi-Muziris Biennale in the Kerala State city of Kochi, India Ink interviewed several exhibiting artists about their work, their expectations for the biennale and the politics of art. The fair will continue until March 13. Angelica Mesiti, 36, who lives in Sydney, works with video and performance. Her video installation is about immigrant musicians.

title: In the Middle: Why Elderly Couples Fight
description: George and Gracie (lets call them that because using their real names would make them even unhappier than they already appear to be) are in their 80s and have been married for more than 65 years. Until recently they seemed to ride the waves that are inevitable in any marriage that spans nearly seven decades; through good and bad, they were partners and best friends.

title: Car Bomb Kills 17 in Pakistani Tribal Region
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A powerful car bomb exploded near government offices in a town in the northwestern tribal belt on Monday, killing at least 17 people and wounding dozens, local officials said.

title: Safety Agency Widens Inquiry on Ford Floor Mats
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has intensified an investigation into whether 480,000 Ford, Lincoln and Mercury vehicles have floors designed so that floor mats  if not properly secured  are nudged forward to snag the gas pedal and possibly cause unintended acceleration.

title: Amid Global Trade Fight, a Bright Year for Solar Use in the U.S.
description: The United States installed more solar panels in 2012 than in any previous year, according to a new report, with residential use of solar power up 70 percent over 2011.

title: The Early Word: Solace
description: In Todays Times

title: A Real Right to Work
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.

title: A Nation Mourns
description: In These Tragedies Must End, Obama Says, Mark Landler and Peter Baker report on the memorial service for the 27 victims, including 20 children, that took place on Friday in Newtown, Conn.

title: More Evidence of Strong 3rd Quarter for U.S. Ad Spending
description: A second service that tracks advertising spending is reporting a relatively strong increase in the United States in the third quarter.

title: A Mother Returns to the College Search, With Daughter No. 2 in Tow
description: Its hard to believe that last month I found myself sitting, again, in the tiered classroom of my local high school, listening to a presentation about precollege testing.

title: U.S. colleges courting Chinese students
description: HONG KONG  The first question some Chinese students ask when they see a sign for Samford University is, Is it in the top 10? Why is its mascot not the Stanford tree?

title: Behind the Cover Story: Cathy Horyn on the Man Who Bought Barneys
description: Cathy Horyn, the fashion critic for The Times, wrote this weeks cover story about Richard Perry, a hedge-fund manager whose firm acquired Barneys, the iconic New York clothing store, earlier this year. She last wrote for the magazine about thedesigner Stella McCartney.

title: Homelands Season Finale, With a Twist
description: The season finale of Homeland on Sunday had a surprise ending, all right.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Dec. 17, 2012
description: Update: Dec. 18, 2012

title: This Week in Small Business: Free iPads
description: Your Fiscal Cliff Update: Its a Snooze

title: The Anxiety of the Long-Distance Meditator
description: You want to cultivate the crackling intensity of the ninja, Daniel Ingram told me. Ingram made a living as an emergency doctor, but his real passion was teaching advanced meditation. It was day one of a 30-day solitary retreat, and this was my first meditation instruction. We were sitting in Ingrams straw bale guesthouse, a squat round building next to the main house at the end of a long country road in rural Alabama. Behind the house a thick forest buzzed with insect life.

title: Finding Our Student and Teacher Resources on the Shootings in Newtown, Conn.
description: Over the weekend we published two posts to help students and teachers grapple with Fridays massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School. Because of the way the blog publishes, however, those posts are now buried by our usual weekday features.

title: Victor Cruz Comforts Family of Shooting Victim
description: Giants receiver Victor Cruz didnt have a good game at Atlanta on Sunday, but he may play the rest of his career and not have a greater day.

title: Between the Dates in the History Books
description: MOSCOW  I was in my mid-20s the first time I reported from a war zone. Over the following decade, I would get almost used to  or, like many war correspondents, addicted to  the sudden sense of immersion, the immense vividness of sound, the slowing down of time and then the head-spinning intake of the air of peace on the way out. But that first time I was struck by the way people get used to living in war, sleeping through blasts, cooking on an open fire on the sidewalk and constantly bickering about things that dont matter.

title: Anything Goes in Bangalores Wild West Real Estate Market
description: BANGALORE On her annual summer visit to Bangalore this year, Vibha Pingle, founder of a nonprofit based in Cambridge, Mass., set out to help her aging parents sell their large suburban home and buy a centrally-located apartment. Ms. Pingle accomplished neither task, but she did get a crash course on the untamed ways of Bangalores real estate trade.

title: Sprint Nextel Reaches a Deal to Buy Rest of Clearwire
description: 7:07 p.m. | Updated

title: First Quantum Offers $5.2 Billion for Inmet Mining
description: 9:30 a.m. | Updated

Blast Kills 10 Girls in Eastern Afghanistan; Car Bomber Targets Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber driving a car packed with explosives targeted the compound of a private military contractor on the eastern outskirts of Kabul on Monday, killing at least one person and injuring at least 15 others, including foreigners, the police said.

title: Opinion Report: Emergency Food Stamps
description: From the editorial page

title: Sun Life to Sell U.S. Annuity Business for $1.35 Billion
description: Sun Life Financial, Canadas third-largest life insurance company, announced on Monday a deal to sell its annuity and some life insurance businesses in the United States for $1.35 billion.

title: Before Facebook Deal, Instagrams Talks With Twitter
description: BEFORE FACEBOOK DEAL, INSTAGRAMS TALKS WITH TWITTER | Facebooks deal to buy Instagram for $1 billion stunned Wall Street and Silicon Valley when it was announced in April. But executives at Twitter had an additional reason to be surprised. Instagrams founders held several meetings as late as March with top Twitter executives, The New York Timess Nick Bilton reports. The sides had verbally agreed weeks earlier on a price for Instagram of $525 million in cash and Twitter shares, Mr. Bilton reports, citing people on both sides of the talks, who requested anonymity because the talks were private and because they were concerned about legal repercussions.

title: Reimagining the Coral Market
description: In the international trade in live coral, most of which ships to the United States for ornamental marine aquariums, the source is quickly shifting from wild harvesting to farming, researchers report in a new study.

title: Working but Waiting
description: The Timess Suzanne Daley reports on struggling Spanish workers who have avoided losing their jobs but often face weeks or months without paychecks.

title: Modi Casts His Vote in Second Day of Gujarat Elections
description: Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party and the Congress Party stalwart Shankarsinh Vaghela, the partys likely candidate for chief minister, were among prominent voters during the second round of voting in Gujarat on Monday.

title: Win-Win: Kaepernick and 49ers
Monday Reading: Getting a Mortgage from a Credit Union
Worried Thoughts, Brave Thoughts About Newtown
description: I, too, have been employing Nancy Rappaports worried thought, brave thought strategies to manage my own sometimes out-of-control emotions surrounding the shootings in Newtown, Conn. Like many of us, I found myself at holiday parties over the weekend, ambivalent and conflicted over conversation about this event, or about anything else.

title: New Inquest to Be Held Into Death of Amy Winehouse
description: More than a year since the death of Amy Winehouse, the sideshow surrounding her demise and the investigation into it has yet to subside. Officials in London said that a new inquest would be held into Ms. Winehouses death next month because the coroner who conducted the original examination lacked proper qualifications, The Associated Press reported. Ms. Winehouse, the Grammy-winning soul singer who performed hit songs like Rehab and Valerie, was found dead in her apartment in the London borough of Camden on July 23, 2011.

title: Tim Scott to Be Named for South Carolina Senate Seat, Republicans Say
description: 10:17 a.m. | Updated  Gov. Nikki Haley of South Carolina has chosen Representative Tim Scott to replace Jim DeMint in the United States Senate, according to three Republican officials. The move will make Mr. Scott the first black senator from the South since the late 19th century.

title: Joh. A. Benckiser to Buy Caribou Coffee for $340 Million
description: Joh. A. Benckiser seems to be quite the coffee aficionado.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Reporting From Newtown, and a Puppet Provocateur
description: The senseless murders of 20 schoolchildren and six adults who cared for them at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., has shocked the nation, and the world, drawing round-the-clock news coverage to the town, Peter Applebome and Brian Stelter report. Nearly every newscast on CNN since Friday night has been broadcast from Newtown, for example, as has been true for nearly every network television morning and evening newscast. There has been tension, however, with some townsfolk lashing out at reporters, and others welcoming the chance to share their grief with the rest of the country. Big-name anchors can be spotted going door-to-door, seeking interviews. The anchors, Mr. Applebome and Mr. Stelter write, said they know when no means no.

title: What Were Reading
description: Love & Olive Oil: Proof that there are at least 570 active food blogs: thats the number of participants in the recent 2nd Annual Great Food Blogger Cookie Swap. And its not just virtual cookies; they shipped more than 20,000.  Julia Moskin

title: Are Delhis Buses Safe For Women?
description: If youre a woman, youre not safe on public buses in Delhi.

title: Fill-In | Bad Taste, All in Fun
description: Directions: Fill in the blanks in the first eight paragraphs of the article Bad Taste, All in Fun by Guy Trebay.

title: European Mobile Stocks Fall After Costly Spectrum Auction
description: BERLIN  Shares of four big European cellphone operators fell Monday after they paid more than twice what investors had been expecting in a spectrum auction in the Netherlands, raising concern that a damaging bidding war could sap the industry.

title: Nurse Caught in Royal Prank Buried in India
description: Jacintha Saldanha, the Indian-born nurse who was found hanging in her room after she answered a prank call about the Duchess of Cambridges medical care at a London hospital, was buried in her hometown of Shirva in Karnataka on Monday.

title: Some Unlikely Democrats Join in Push for New Gun Laws
description: 3:19 p.m. | Updated  Congressional Democrats showed signs on Monday of a more aggressive push on gun control in the wake of the Newtown killings, while Republicans and gun rights advocates remained largely silent on policy matters.

title: Dec. 17 Updates on Connecticut Shooting Aftermath
description: Two of the children killed in Fridays shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., were buried Monday, as investigators continued to try to piece together the motive behind Adam Lanzas rampage, which claimed the lives of 20 children and six adults at the school and Mr. Lanzas mother before Mr. Lanza killed himself.

title: Leading Off: After a Pause, Games Go On
description: Sports broadcasts get interrupted by real life all the time, setting off the kind of TV juggling that aims to skate through the uncomfortable moment before returning to the regularly scheduled distraction. But Sunday night brought something different altogether, and not just because the Patriots-49ers game was actually knocked off NBC for a presidential speech brought on by tragedy, nor because Patriots made the telling and painfully appropriate move of silencing their usual celebratory musket fire.

title: Amour on Top, Sort of
description: Various critics groups on the East and West Coasts have shared their top film choices in the last month. There was the New York Film Critics Circle and the National Board of Review, both going with Zero Dark Thirty, while the Los Angeles Film Critics Association went with Amour. What say the New York Times chief film critics, who dont vote in those polls?

title: 25 Lessons About First Graders
description: Among the many horrors associated with the killing of 20 children at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., is that they were all first graders. On Sunday I spoke with Joanne Strongin, a longtime first-grade teacher at E.M. Baker Elementary School in Great Neck, N.Y. Together we put together a list of 25 things we have learned about first graders.

title: Daily Report: Legal Allies Against Microsoft, Divided on Google
description: Two lawyers who helped build the antitrust case against Microsoft in the 1990s are playing important roles in an antitrust investigation of Google. But this time, Gary L. Reback and Susan A. Creighton are on opposite sides, Steve Lohr reports on Monday in The New York Times.

title: Preventing Gun Violence
description: TimesCast: At Newtown vigil, president says nation is not doing enough. | Residents react to Obamas speech. | The hard facts about public policy and gun violence.

title: Michiko Kakutanis 10 Favorite Books of 2012
description: THE PASSAGE OF POWER: THE YEARS OF LYNDON JOHNSON by Robert A. Caro (Alfred A. Knopf). In the latest installment of his magisterial, multivolume biography, Mr. Caro uses his wondrous narrative gifts to tell the dramatic story of how Johnson was catapulted to the White House in the wake of the assassination of John F. Kennedy, and how he used his potent political skills to push his predecessors civil rights legislation through Congress and lay the groundwork for his own revolutionary war on poverty.

title: Debt Reckoning: Updates on the Fiscal Deadline
description: This feature follows the talks between President Obama and Congressional leaders over the so-called fiscal cliff. It aims to explain the major economic and fiscal issues, examine public opinion and analyze the options that the parties are considering as the deadline approaches.

title: Hobbit Ears and Other Makeup Contenders
description: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey topped the box office this weekend. But forget the lavish 3D and accelerated frame rate; maybe moviegoers were just taken by its shaggy and pointy-eared faces.

title: Whats Your Meme? Changing the Climate Change Conversation
description: Yes we can! Ermahgerd. Occupy. I had a dream. Haters gonna hate. Tear down this wall! Gangnam Style. Drill, baby, drill.

title: Dwight Garners 10 Favorite Books of 2012
description: POEMS 1962-2012 by Louise Glck (Farrar, Straus & Giroux). An event. Ms. Glcks collected poems have a great novels cohesiveness and raking moral intensity. This is a poet with a prosecutorial mind: in supple and exact language, she interrogates the world around us. She is fearsome. And fearless.

title: Janet Maslins 10 Favorite Books of 2012
description: BRING UP THE BODIES by Hilary Mantel (Henry Holt). The second installment in this splendid, sharp-clawed historical trilogy is even better than the first. Both center on Ms. Mantels brilliant reimagining of Thomas Cromwell, a minor player in most tales of Henry VIII but the major schemer in this ingenious version. Wolf Hall was a superb but not essential prologue to the second books more fine-tuned war of nerves. Tightly focused on sparring between Cromwell and Anne Boleyn, it mixes 16th-century ambience with timeless bitchery.

title: Musical Moments
description: Anthony Tommasini performs favorite classical music moments sent in by readers.

title: A Pleasure to Read (and Even Reread)
description: EACH year at this time the daily book critics for The New York Times make lists of favorite books. Favorite is not synonymous with best, so this process can be painful. Brutal honesty is required. We pick what we actually liked, not what we only admired, although ideally our favorites fit both descriptions. But if any of us had fallen for the Fifty Shades of Grey books, wed have to say so. We didnt, so we dont.

title: Musical Moments, Part V: La Bohme
description: Last month, in an Arts & Leisure article and a series of videos, I discussed and analyzed some of my favorite moments in music and invited Times readers to send in theirs.

title: Image of the Day: Dec. 17
The Over-the-Wall Portfolio for Excess Cash
description: Carl Richards is a financial planner in Park City, Utah, and is the director of investor education at the BAM Alliance. His book, The Behavior Gap, was published this year. His sketches are archived on the Bucks blog.

title: Computer in Connecticut Gunmans Home Yields No Data, Investigators Say
description: Investigators have not managed to retrieve any data from a computer they took from the house where the gunman in the Newtown, Conn., school shootings lived with his mother because he had all but destroyed the hard drive, a senior law enforcement official said Monday.

title: Feeling For | Heather Taylor Homes Linens
description: I like to try to create a sense of warmth in a world that can feel cold, says the gallerist and budding lifestyle guru Heather Taylor. Taylor De Cordoba, the space she owns with her husband, Alex De Cordoba, in Los Angeless Culver City gallery district not only shows emerging artists in an atypically cozy environment, but also hosts food-and-flower-festooned events like trunk shows for fashion-designer friends and Eating Our Words, a series teaming literary readings with artisanal tastings. (The New Yorker writer Dana Goodyear recited poetry as guests sampled desserts by ChocoVivo; the Wild author Cheryl Strayed was paired with I Heart Pies and Carmela ice cream.) These multisensory goings-on  along with Taylors frequent dinner parties and crafting sessions with haute-bohemian pals like Kirsty Hume and Shiva Rose  are documented on Taylors popular blog, L.A. in Bloom. Taylor, also a skilled knitter and weaver, holds a special fondness for the tactile pleasures of tabletop textiles: Even if Im just throwing together a quick dinner for myself, I want it to look beautiful, she says. When Im setting a table, I feel an endorphin rush of excitement. Taylor intends to spread that feeling with Heather Taylor Home, her new collection of decorative linens inspired by memories of convivial, casually chic meals in Mexico and Greece. The festive cocktail and dinner napkins, place mats and table runners are made from unprocessed linen hand-embroidered in India with folkloric motifs for a look thats at once rustic and refined. A last-minute holiday or hostess gift that will, no doubt, keep on giving.

title: In Performance: Jackie Hoffman
description: The actress performs a scene from her solo show, A Chanukah Charol, at New World Stages.

title: Voluntary Disclosure on Corporate Political Spending Is Not Enough
description: One of the challenges that the Securities and Exchange Commission will face next year is how to address investor concerns about corporate political spending.

title: New Museum of Mathematics: Where Math is Cool
description: This week we continue to celebrate the opening Manhattans Museum of Mathematics (nicknamed MoMath), the nations first museum devoted to the exploration, discovery, and fundamental coolness of math. The museum, which features 30 hands-on exhibits in a 19,000-square-foot space on the north side of Madison Square Park, is the brainchild of the retired hedge fund analyst Glen Whitney. We want to send a message that its cool to love math, says Mr. Whitney, and the museum succeeds brilliantly.

title: Guns and the Decline of the Young Man
description: 2:05 p.m. | Updated This post originally contained an article that was not ready for publication. The correct version appears below.

title: Britains National Portrait Gallery Buys a Defaced Self-Portrait
description: The National Portrait Gallery in London has purchased a self-portrait by the highly regarded British artist Craigie Aitchison that is covered with slash marks put there by the artist himself, the BBC reported. Mr. Ferguson, defaced the painting, which dates from the late 1950s or early 60s, in response to a comment that called it flattering, and said he would only permit its restoration if the marks were kept visible. He kept the painting until his death in 2009.

title: Have an N.F.L. Question? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: 5:36 p.m. | Updated Just how good are the Seahawks? And the Broncos? Are the Bears done? Are the Vikings alive? And where, exactly, are the Giants? Judy Battista, the N.F.L. reporter for The New York Times, will answer questions from readers this week. Use the comment field below for your questions. Answers will appear Friday on The Fifth Down.

title: Matthew McConaughey, Song (and Dance) Man
description: Is there anything Matthew McConaughey cant do? (Dont answer that.) The actor, an Oscar hopeful for his supporting role in Magic Mike (and on the strength of his performances this year in Bernie and Killer Joe), is also on the Academys shortlist of nominatable original songs. To watch him croon Ladies of Tampa in a cowboy hat and leather vest

title: Facts on Guns and Regulation
description: Daniel Webster, a professor at Johns Hopkins University, discusses some of the research surrounding regulation and gun violence following the Newtown, Conn., massacre.

title: On Our Radar: Navigating a Parched Mississippi
description: Barge operators prepare to begin blasting large rock formations that are impeding navigation south of St. Louis on the Mississippi River, where water levels are 20 feet lower than normal because of a prolonged drought. Meanwhile, 40 representatives of government, business and labor meet to address the challenge of keeping the river open. Over the weekend, the Army Corps of Engineers began releasing water into the river from Carlyle Lake in southern Illinois. [The Chicago Tribune, The News-Democrat]

title: For the Social Wrasse, News, Good and Bad
description: Luiz Rocha, the curator of ichthyology at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Belize, where he conducts research on one of the worlds most endangered fish, social wrasse.

title: Street Style: Fair Isle
description: The best of readers photos from the week of Dec. 10.

title: Veterans Feel Anxiety, and Relief, After School Shooting
description: When I heard the initial report of a school shooting in Newtown, Conn., my heart sank. As the story played out, the number of dead climbed higher until it reached a ghastly toll: 20 dead children, ages 6 to 7, along with 7 adults.

title: Walkabout  12/17: Click for a Taxi, and Travelers Abroad Hit a Billion
description: Click Instead of Hail New York Citys Taxi and Limousine Commission approved a pilot program that would allow people to hail cabs by smartphone app. (New York Times)

title: Astronomers Say North Korean Satellite Is Most Likely Dead
description: The North Korean satellite launched into space last week appears to be tumbling in orbit and is most likely dead, astronomers are reporting. The evident failure will not cause the spacecraft to fall quickly back to earth but seems to represent a major blow to the Norths portrayal of the launching as a complete triumph.

title: Getting Water to New Yorkers Is a Family Business
description: New York is many things: dynamic and dense, artistic and competitive, vivacious and sometimes, particularly in summer, a bit smelly. The list of traits goes on and on, but the word quaint isnt on it. And yet one of the citys most familiar signposts is a charming, rustic throwback: the wooden water tank.

title: In a Rare Move, a Cravath Partner Leaves for Another Firm
description: It is almost unheard of for a partner to leave Cravath, Swaine & Moore, one of the countrys most profitable and prestigious law firms. It is even rarer still for a partner to leave Cravath for another firm.

title: Elliott Bids $2.3 Billion for Compuware
description: Elliott Management has pulled out a trusted strategy from its technology investment playbook.

title: Wheelies: The Supercar Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: R. A. Dickey Climbs Mountains; the Mets Dig Holes
description: Day to day, game to game, Alderson wants to win, and he wants to win now.The New York Times, May 21, 2011Im glad Sandy has come to terms with his win-now mania.

title: Is the Gun Lobby Invincible?
Dickey and Blue Jays Reach Agreement
description: R.A. Dickey and the Toronto Blue Jays have reached an agreement for a two-year contract extension worth $25 million, according to a person with knowledge of the deal.

title: Congressman Is Chosen to Succeed DeMint as South Carolina Senator
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Tim Scott of South Carolina, who arrived in Congress two years ago on the wave of the Tea Party movement, was appointed on Monday to succeed Jim DeMint in the United States Senate, an elevation that makes him the first black senator from the South since the late 19th century.

title: Bill to Expand Birth Control Is Approved in Philippines
description: MANILA  After a ferocious national debate that pitted family members against one another, and some faithful Catholics against their church, the Philippine Congress passed legislation on Monday to help the countrys poorest women gain access to birth control.

title: Bills Sink Fans Into Further Agony
description: Beware the ides of March. Julius Caesar was stabbed to death on March 15 in 44 B.C., and weve been wary of the infamous day ever since Shakespeare immortalized the phrase in his play Julius Caesar. But somehow, Bills fans, myself included, forgot about the ominous significance of this day when our team signed free-agent defensive end Mario Williams to a ridiculous six-year, $96 million contract on March 15 this year.

title: Accounts and People of Note in Advertising
description: Allegiant Travel Company, Las Vegas, selected SK&G Advertising, Las Vegas, as agency of record for media planning and buying. Billings were not disclosed. The assignment had previously been handled internally at Allegiant.

title: Bill Clinton Documentary, Directed by Martin Scorsese, Coming to HBO
description: As a director of nonfiction features, Martin Scorsese has chronicled artists like the Band and George Harrison. Now, in his next documentary film, he will take on the life of a famous saxophonist, albeit one who is better known for his work in other spheres of American life.

title: Poisoned Agents Wife Faces Financial Duress
description: LONDON  Since the moment of her husbands death, Marina Litvinenko has seemed to blend discomfort at her presence in the glare of media coverage with a fierce determination to use her prominence there to push for justice and closure.

title: Newtown Reacts to Obamas Speech
description: Residents of Newtown Conn., share their thoughts on President Obamas address at the vigil for victims of the Sandy Hook massacre.

title: No Deal, Continued
description: Update: And now I hear whispers suggesting that there may be more movement than that. I guess well see.

title: Fresh Kills: Landfill to Park
description: The once notorious Fresh Kills Landfill on Staten Island is being developed into an urban park. Michael Kimmelman, architecture critic, tours the site.

title: Errors in Newtown Shootings Coverage Reflect Growing Pressures
description: Many Times readers wrote to me over the weekend with concerns about the coverage of the unfathomable events in Newtown, Conn. Ill do my best over the next few days to answer and shed some light on the major questions and complaints.

title: Rising Inequality, Even Among College Presidents
description: Eye-popping tales of growing income inequality are hardly new. By now, nearly every American must be painfully aware of the widening pay gap between top executives and shop floor laborers; between Master of the Universe financiers and pretty much everyone else.

title: Staten Island Landfill Park Proves Savior in Hurricane
description: During Hurricane Sandy, the Fresh Kills landfill on Staten Island absorbed a critical part of the storm surge. Its hills and waterways spared nearby neighborhoods like Travis, Bulls Head, New Springville and Arden Heights much worse flooding. The 2,200-acre site, which closed a decade ago and is being turned into a park, was also temporarily reopened as a transfer station, helping officials and relief agencies clear debris from around the city.

title: This Effort Opens a New Window, Every Month
description: Editors Note: With this issue, In Advertising begins its annual year-end hiatus, returning on Jan. 14. All the best for the holidays and a wonderful 2013.

title: Please, Mom and Dad: Just Have a Taste
description: MY childhood tasted of bland roast chicken and canned crescent rolls  starchy fare that typically came out of a box, plopped on our plates by our tireless working mom. Dining out usually meant wielding our trays down the line at Lubys Cafeteria in San Antonio for mashed potatoes and a factory-cut square of fried fish, with a clover-shaped dinner roll on the side.

title: Anthony Will Be Game-Time Decision
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Carmelo Anthony remains a game-time decision for Monday nights game against the Houston Rockets. Anthony, the Knicks star, did not participate in the teams shootaround Monday morning, but Coach Mike Woodson said Anthony was at the teams training facility here to receive treatment for his sprained left ankle.

title: Something (Everything) Rotten in the State of Macro
description: Brad DeLong links to a blog post from 2011 about saltwater/freshwater and all that making some points I think Ive also made, but maybe not that clearly. The key grafs:

title: Reflections on the Third Anniversary of My Pink Slip
description: Today marks the third anniversary of my pink slip from corporate America. Three years ago, the bankruptcy trustees at the corporation where I had worked for close to a decade fired me. The next day, I started working on building my loan brokerage.

title: In Recent Years, a Drop in Public Support for Gun Control Laws
description: Support for gun control measures has steadily dropped over the last decade, and previous mass shootings had little effect on public opinion about gun laws. It is too early to tell ifthe age and the number of the victims in the killings in Newtown, Conn., will now have an impact on attitudes toward gun control.

title: Procrastinating Holiday Shoppers Abound
description: I spent a lot of the weekend shopping online for Christmas gifts I should have bought, and shipped, weeks ago. Try as I may, I cant overcome my procrastinator tendencies.

title: Israeli Embassy Deletes Christmas Thought Attacking Palestinians From Facebook
description: Last Update, 3:10 p.m. A Christmas thought, suggesting that if Jesus lived in the modern world he would probably end up being lynched in Bethlehem by hostile Palestinians, was deleted from the official Facebook page of Israels embassy in Ireland on Monday, just a few hours after it was posted.

title: Childhood: A Little Sugar Does Seem to Ease the Pain
description: Giving a bit of sugar to a baby about to get a shot might reduce the pain, a large review of studies suggests.

title: Fashion News Were Reading Now: Dec. 17
description: The British Fashion Council has announced the shortlist of nominees for the BFC/Vogue Designer Fashion Fund 2013 prize. Roksanda Ilincic, Mary Katrantzou, Nicholas Kirkwood, Peter Pilotto and Emilia Wickstead are up for the 200,000 grant and strong yearlong mentoring program.

title: Movement in the Negotiations
description: With new concessions from Republicans on raising taxes, Annie Lowrey reports that eyes will be on how much Democrats are willing to change entitlements.

title: A Big, and Risky, Energy Bet
description: RAS LAFFAN INDUSTRIAL CITY, Qatar  The compact assembly of towers, tubes and tanks that make up the Oryx natural gas processing plant is almost lost in a vast petrochemical complex that rises here like a hazy mirage from a vast ocean of sand.

title: Monday Motorsports: Grosjean Is Champion of Champions
description: Romain Grosjean, a Lotus Formula One team driver, defeated Tom Kristensen, the eight-time Le Mans winner, on Sunday in the final of the 2012 Race of Champions.

title: Probes Crash Into the Moons Dark (Not Far) Side
description: Ebb and Flow are no more. The two spacecraft of NASAs Grail mission crashed on the Moon at about 5:28 p.m. Eastern time, about 30 seconds apart, one of the few times that cheers and claps have been heard in the control room to celebrate the loss of a spacecraft.

title: Syria Warns Refugees Not to Aid Rebels
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syria warned its Palestinian refugee population on Monday not to aid the insurgency that is fighting President Bashar al-Assad, as hundreds of Palestinians fled the Yarmouk neighborhood of Damascus.
