As Ms. Alibar and her co-writer, the director Benh Zeitlin, discovered, its one thing to say, as Hushpuppys father does, Im worried about you because youre so stupid, to a preteen; quite another when shes a tiny girl.

title: A Bloody Price in Syria
description: TimesCast: Winter descends on Aleppo as it slips into disaster. | Syrian refugees struggle to survive. | The Timess C.J. Chivers follows fighters from the Free Syrian Army.

title: Piers Morgan Shows Disgust While Interviewing Gun Owners Advocate
description: Anybody who has been watching Piers Morgan Tonight on CNN since the shootings at the Sandy Hook elementary school could discern he is no fan of guns, but on Tuesday night he made it clear that he doesnt much like the people who own them either.

title: U.N. Seeks New Aid for Syria Crisis and Predicts 1 Million Refugees by Mid-2013
description: GENEVA  The United Nations appealed on Wednesday for $1.5 billion in new aid to handle the humanitarian crisis created by mounting violence in Syria, and it predicted that the number of refugees would double to more than one million in the next six months.

title: In Performance: Tracee Chimo
description: The actress performs a scene from Joshua Harmons comedy Bad Jews.

title: Car Donations Could Take Your Clunker to the Crusher or Cambodia
description: Thinking of converting your clunker into an end-of-year tax deduction? Then hear the tale of my familys 1997 Mercury Sable, which we donated to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation in August, when the engine gave out at 107,000 miles.

title: Reminder: Our College Application Help Line Goes Live at 8 P.M. on Facebook
description: If you are (a parent of) a high school senior who is scrambling to finish and submit your college applications, we encourage you to stop by our College Application Help Line, which is happening live Wednesday night, on The New York Timess Facebook page.

title: Look of The Moment | Ladies in Red
description: Crimson and oxblood, two of the fall runways favorite colors, were practically destined to dominate the holiday season. The trick to wearing it best: with a lot of texture and high contrast. Here, Anne Hathaway is coming up roses in a vintage velvet Mafalda sheath; Rihanna cozies up in a cardinal feathered fur, enhanced with a sexy red lip; and Beyonc Knowles wears a trompe loeil bustier dress by Markus Lupfer in Miami.

title: The Full Pollard Report
description: This 200-page report by Nick Pollard, published by the BBC Trust, traces in detail what it describes as a chain of events that was to prove disastrous for the BBC.

title: Does the Next Head of the Louvre Need to Be French?
description: PARISWith the announced departure of the president of the Louvre, speculation is growing about who will succeed him in a fraught period when the new Socialist government is making cuts in the culture budget for the first time in 30 years.

title: A Wave of Start-Ups Helps Small Companies Outsource Their Tasks
description: Small-business owners are like Swiss Army knives: expected to handle dozens of specialized tasks without falling apart. But even the sharpest entrepreneurs have it tough this time of year  inevitably, some will outsource part of their workload to other enterprising people.

title: Glengarry Revival, With Pacino and Cannavale, Recoups on Broadway
description: Send the word to Mitch and Murray and all the guys down at the home office: those broken, backstabbing salesmen of Glengarry Glen Ross have turned a profit on the latest Broadway revival of that David Mamet play.

title: Michael Haneke Finds His Brando
description: In the competition for the Oscar for best foreign-language film, the early favorite is the Austrian submission, Michael Hanekes Amour, and not just because it won the top prize at the Cannes Film Festival last spring and nearly swept the European Film Awards this month. The story of a Parisian couple, retired music teachers in their 80s, confronting their own decline also features powerfully affecting performances by Jean-Louis Trintingant and Emmanuelle Riva.

title: Exploring a Proposed Carbon Diet for American Power Plants
description: Earlier this week, Daniel Lashof of the Natural Resources Defense Council blogged about the groups new proposal for cutting carbon dioxide emissions from American power plants  not just at the plant itself but by creating incentives for end users to conserve electricity. That means you, me and the businesses that we rely on. Heres the opener, a link to the rest and a short Q&A I did with Dan to dig in on a couple of questions:

title: How Small Businesses Use Fiverr, TaskRabbit and Other Services
description: In an article The Times has just published, I profile four young ventures vying to help shorten to-do lists for small-business owners this holiday season. Please chime in at the bottom of this post with your own experiences offloading tasks to services that promise to lighten your load. To get things rolling, Ive reached out to a few small businesses that use the companies featured in the article. Here are their tales:

title: Keeping Score: Stepping Back for a Bigger Payoff
description: Carmelo Anthony has received near-universal acclaim for leading the Knicks to an 18-6 start this season, making him an early favorite for the leagues Most Valuable Player award.

title: Really, Really Final Free-Shipping Deadlines
description: Im not sure if this is a good thing, since it encourages people like me to wait as long as possible to send holiday gift items. But if you still want to ship gifts free, in time for Christmas, you have a few options. But this is it. Really.

title: A Sad Close to the Tebow Show
description: Of all the questions hanging in the air in the midst of the Jets demolition derby of a season, the biggest one will never get answered: Why on earth did they trade for Tim Tebow?

title: Syrian Refugees Struggle to Survive
description: Michael Slackman, deputy foreign editor for The Times, speaks with Andrew J. Tabler of the Washington Institute on the humanitarian crisis plaguing Syria.

title: Capturing America, Fact by Fact
description: College graduates have less leisure time than high school dropouts. More people are injured on toilets than by skiing or snowboarding. More households have dogs as pets than cats, but cat lovers are more likely to have multiple pets. And more foreigners visited New York (9.3 million) than any other American city (Los Angeles was a distant second with 3.7 million).

title: Favorite Book Cover Designs of 2012
description: Some of the years best book covers, chosen by people in and around the world of graphic design.

title: Obama Vows Fast Action in New Push for Gun Control
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama declared on Wednesday that he would make gun control a central issue as he opens his second term, promising to submit broad new firearm proposals to Congress no later than January and to employ the full power of his office to overcome deep-seated political resistance.

title: Image of the Day: Dec. 19
Designers on Their Favorite Book Covers of 2012
description: We recently asked people in and around the world of graphic design to name one of their favorite book covers from 2012 and briefly describe its appeal. We didnt allow for repetition of choices, but several of those polled mentioned the cover chosen by the designer Jon Gray, who writes:

title: Hundreds of Political Parties Are Indias Pressure Valve Against Unrest
description: NEW DELHI  It is hard to say something nice about any Indian political party, especially within 900 words, but in my latest Letter From India column I argue that an important factor in maintaining a largely peaceful India is that there are so many political parties. The 2009 general elections were contested by 364 parties, many of them representing in very specific ways the concerns, biases and hopes of various communities. As the power of older, larger parties erodes, the many smaller parties are gaining influence because the major parties need them in order to assemble a governing coalition.

title: A Look at Fine and Dandy
description: At Fine and Dandy, a mens wear store in midtown, its not quite all vintage  only the ideas.

title: House Democrats Call on Boehner to Take Up Gun-Control Issue
description: House Democrats, coming out in force in the wake of the Newtown, Conn., shooting massacre, called on House Speaker John A. Boehner to bring a ban on high-capacity ammunition magazines to a vote by Saturday as a first step in a broader effort to rein in guns next year.

title: Forget In-Flight Movies; Preflight Is the Way to Go
description: Imagine that before you leave for the airport to board a flight, you receive an e-mail with a video embedded that greets you by name and supplies details on the departure and boarding time and gate, and arrival time and gate, as well as information on mileage-boosting offers and upgrade costs for the route.

title: Why Gun Control Is Not Enough
description: In the wake of the school massacre in Newtown, Conn., and the resulting renewed debate on gun control in the United States, The Stone will publish a series of essays this week that examine the ethical, social and humanitarian implications of the use, possession and regulation of weapons. Other articles in the series can be found here.

title: Obama Speaks on Gun Control
description: In the aftermath of a deadly shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary in Newtown, Conn., President Obama addresses the nation on gun control and also talks about ongoing fiscal negotiations.

title: Anti-Casual Friday Headquarters
description: ONE recent afternoon, two men were sitting in facing chairs in the small below-grade space that serves as the storefront of Fine and Dandy, a shop specializing in the accouterments of the well-dressed life.

title: 12:22 P.M., Cromwell Avenue, Staten Island
Musical Moments, Part 8
description: Anthony Tommasini performs favorite classical music moments sent in by readers.

title: Ballet Opening Night at La Scala Is Canceled as Chorus Members Go on Strike
description: Chorus members at La Scala theater in Milan, protesting having to wear costumes and make gestures without extra pay during a dance performance, have gone on strike. The strike forced the cancellation on Wednesday of opening night of Berliozs Romo et Juliette, with choreography by Sasha Waltz. The choristers said the extra duties violate their contract, but management argued they were no more than normally called for, according to Italian new reports. James Conlon, the American conductor and the music director of the Los Angeles Opera, was to have led the performance. Strikes or the threat of labor action at La Scala cause frequent disruptions, usually in opera productions.

title: The Newtown Aftermath
description: David Brooks: Gail, since the shootings in Newtown, Conn., the debate has gone off on two tracks, the gun control track favored mostly by liberals and the mental health track favored mostly by conservatives. If you dont buy my distinction, just compare the editorials and op-eds that have appeared respectively on our own fine pages and the comparable pages of The Wall Street Journal.

title: Is the Second Amendment Absolute?
description: Opponents of gun controlof even the most reasonable, basic safeguards like background checks or limits on the size of ammunition clipswere silent directly after the Newtown shooting. But they are starting to emerge from hiding, and most of what theyve had to say suggests theyve learned little, if anything, from the killings.

title: Musical Moments, Part 9
description: Anthony Tommasini performs favorite classical music moments sent in by readers.

title: Army Seeking Death Penalty in Massacre of 16 Afghans
description: SEATTLE  The United States Army will seek the death penalty against Staff Sgt. Robert Bales, who is accused of killing 16 civilians in Afghanistan, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Below the Line: Bringing Light to Lincoln
description: When charged with the task of determining how to frame and light a president he saw as iconic, the cinematographer of Lincoln often decided on one way: iconically.

title: New Label Alert | Roomeur
description: Best friends since studying fashion design together in Israel, Hagit Kassif and Omer Pozner had always planned on starting a label together. Different paths brought them to New York  Diane von Furstenberg for Kassif, Elie Tahari for Pozner  then separated them again when Kassif headed to London to start a masters degree at the Royal College of Art. But six months into her program, she called Pozner and told him it was time to stop dreaming and get to work. I said, Quit your job, this is it,' she remembers. Reunited in New York and designing under the name Roomeur, the pair have just shown their first collection for prefall. Inspired by photographs of Frida Kahlo as well as by her artwork, it imagines the feminist icon transplanted to modern-day Gotham and in possession of, among other things, a brocade shorts suit and a draped black silk frock with a vibrant botanical print and a wrapped waist. We were thinking of the two sides of Fridas character, Pozner says. The hard and the soft.

title: Outcry Over Instagram Policy
description: TimesCast Media+Tech: New terms of service at Instagram result in online reaction. | Viral video Nyan Cat inspires a pop-up shop. | David Pogue reviews two Android cameras in 60 seconds.

title: Photo Replay: December 19
description: A view of the day in sports, including Joel Parkinsons return to Australia after winning his first world surfing title, in Oahu, Hawaii.

title: At News Conference, Reporters Skip Past Gun Control and Face Instant Criticism
description: 3:34 p.m. | Updated The harshest judges of those in news media are often others in the news media, and, with the benefit of Twitter, that intrajournalistic watchdog role can be performed simultaneously with the journalism being criticized.

title: The Kitten Makes Way for the Cat
description: SCARLETT JOHANSSON doesnt like making pat statements about herself. She tends to pepper her insights with swear words, self-deprecation or a short, raspy laugh. But during a 90-minute interview recently there was one truth that she acknowledged simply: She did a lot of growing up in the three years between her Broadway debut, at the age of 25 in A View From the Bridge, and her return this month as Maggie in another American classic, Tennessee Williamss Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.

title: TimesCast Media+Tech: Outcry Over Instagram Policy
description: New terms of service at Instagram result in online reaction. Viral video Nyan Cat inspires a pop-up shop. David Pogue reviews two Android cameras in 60 seconds.

title: Test Run: Addappt, a Connected Address Book for iPhones
description: Youve probably heard this story before: A friend loses his cellphone, buys a new one and then invites hundreds of people on Facebook to join a group called Lost my phone. Post your numbers please.

title: Morgan Stanley Makes Donation After Sandy Hook Massacre
description: Morgan Stanley, where three employees lost family members in the Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings, has donated $150,000 to charities honoring the victims.

title: Family Sentenced to Prison in England Over Forced Labor
description: DUBLIN  Five members of an Irish family who enjoyed lavish lifestyles from the proceeds of forced labor were jailed in England on Wednesday after a three-month trial.

title: 4 Are Out at State Dept. After Scathing Report on Benghazi Attack
description: WASHINGTON  Four State Department officials were removed from their posts onWednesdayafter an independent panel criticized the grossly inadequate securityat a diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, that was attacked on Sept. 11, leading to the deaths of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens and three other Americans.

title: Former Wisconsin Coach Climbs Back Into Hot Seat
description: MADISON, Wis.  Two squares of sticky tape remained where Bret Bielemas nameplate had been. Barry Alvarez moved back into the head football coachs office overlooking Camp Randall Stadium at the University of Wisconsin this month for convenience, but he has no plans to settle in. Alvarez took only one significant thing from his athletic directors office with him: a glass candy jar filled with gumballs of assorted colors.

title: Remembering the Passion of a Teacher Who Died Protecting Students
description: STRATFORD, Conn.  She has come to be known for her instinctive heroism in saving the lives of many of her young students, but at her funeral on Wednesday, Victoria Soto, a first-grade teacher at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, was remembered in a way that only those closest to her would have known.

title: General Grants Infamous Order
description: I, a peaceable, law abiding citizen, pursuing my legitimate business at Paducah, Kentucky, where I have been a resident for nearly four years, have been driven from my home, my business, and all that is dear to me, at the short notice of twenty-four hours; not for any crime committed, but simply because I was born of Jewish parents, said a young merchant named Cesar Kaskel to reporters in late December 1862. The accompanying headline disclosed why Kaskel was so abruptly ordered out. It read: Expulsion of Jews from General Grants Department.

title: Saul Steinberg
description: To the Editor:

title: Surge of Sales for Jenni Rivera; Swift Remains No. 1
description: Taylor Swift has topped the Billboard album chart once again, with her album Red (Big Machine) holding at No. 1 for a fifth week with 208,000 sales, according to Nielsen SoundScan. The new album by Bruno Mars, Unorthodox Jukebox (Atlantic), also did well, opening at No. 2 with 192,000.

title: Inside the App
description: To the Editor:

title: France Details Plan to Shrink Banking Risk
description: PARIS  Franois Hollande began his campaign for the French presidency in January with the declaration that he and his Socialist party were prepared to break from policies that they said had contributed to the financial crisis, notably promising a separation of investment banking from consumer banks.

title: Student Crossword | 2012 in Review
description: Play our crossword (PDF) to see what you remember about the year that was. You can find the answers here.

title: A Worthy Painter
description: To the Editor:

title: Looking Back at 2012: Ideas for Reflecting on the Year and Teaching With Retrospectives
description: A Google video that tried to capture the Zeitgeist of 2012 through its searches.

title: As Last Member of NBC Team Escapes Syria, More Details on Hostage Drama Emerge
description: Last Updated, Thursday, 2:20 p.m. NBC News announced on Wednesday that an employee who had been kidnapped in Syria last week along with the correspondent Richard Engel arrived safely in Turkey, as more details of the hostage drama were released by opposition media activists.

title: Messiah, Informed by History
description: December is a decidedly gluttonous month for Messiah fans in New York, who can feast on myriad versions offered by ensembles across the city. The New York Philharmonic wades energetically into the Messiah fray each season with five consecutive performances, a testament (not that any proof is needed) to this oratorios enduring popularity.

title: Pogues 12 Days of Gadgets: Cirago iAlert Tag and Cobra Tag
description: Oh, holy night  youve forgotten your phone!

title: Buying a Gift Card, and Checking It Twice
description: Although they may lack the drama of a brightly wrapped package, gift cards remain popular holiday presents for finicky or otherwise hard-to-buy-for recipients. The National Retail Federation deems them the seasons hottest gift.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Dec. 20
description: Hot pink isnt waiting until spring to show off; for Barneys New York, pajamas in bulldog, fox, leopard and anchor print; basic pieces by Daryl K will now be carried by Steven Alan stores; and for nails, try silver glitter.

title: Europe Proposes New Tobacco Rules
description: BRUSSELS  Health warnings should cover 75 percent of cigarette packs but governments should also have leeway to require plain packaging, the European Commission said Wednesday.

title: Israel Defies Allies in Move to Bolster Settlements
description: JERUSALEM  Israel pushed ahead with aggressive new settlement building on Wednesday, brushing aside a growing chorus of international opposition, including criticism by its Western allies, that the move threatened to destroy the peace process with the Palestinians.

title: Dont Worry: Donkey Cheese Is Still Available
description: Donkey cheese is irresistible, or at least articles about it are. A week ago, several British newspapers, notably The Daily Telegraph and The Daily Mail, reported that Novak Djokovic, the top-ranked mens tennis player, had bought the entire world supply of pule, a Serbian donkey cheese, for his restaurants.

title: New Online Privacy Rules for Children
description: In a move intended to give parents greater control over data collected about their children online, federal regulators on Wednesday broadened longstanding privacy safeguards covering childrens mobile apps and Web sites. Members of the Federal Trade Commission said they updated the rules to keep pace with the growing use of mobile phones and tablets by children.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Guess Whos Coming to Dinner, and Maybe the Wedding

title: Has Fiction Lost Its Faith?
description: A seminary student has an affair with an insurance adjuster he met in an office building near Riverside Church; then they go their separate ways  and thats the whole story.

title: Bork and Liberalism
description: The death of Robert Bork at the age of 85 has naturally turned attention back to the famous hinge moment in his long career  the confirmation hearings that transformed him from Robert Bork, illustrious conservative legal scholar into Robert Bork, icon of the culture wars, and made his last name a synonym for the demagogic, by-any-means-necessary takedown of a judicial nominee. How much of a turning point the hearings really represented in our progress toward polarization can be debated, but they certainly changed the way law and politics intersect: Everything from the shape of confirmation hearings to the career choices of would-be jurists to the trajectory of the modern conservative legal movement has been stamped by Borks defeat at the hands of Ted Kennedy, Joe Biden, and a united front of liberal interest groups.

title: Challenging France to Do Business Differently
description: PARIS  Louis Gallois, one of Frances most influential industrialists, knew he was about to make waves for the countrys Socialist president.

title: An Undersea Grotto to Soothe Restless Children
description: Its a struggle faced by many bleary-eyed parents: getting their children to sleep at night. The Tranquil Turtle from Cloud B is here to lend a helping flipper by combining three sleep aids in one: a plush toy, a night light and a music box.

title: Polymers Make These Gloves Hot
description: Electrically heated gloves can save your fingers in extreme cold, but there are two challenges in making them. One is getting the heat evenly distributed. The other is preserving battery power so they stay hot as long you need.

title: Aleppos History Under Threat
description: Last Updated, Thursday, 9:59 a.m. As my colleagues Chris Chivers, Tyler Hicks and Ben Solomon report in text, photographs and video, civilians are suffering from shortages of food and medicine, among other hardships, in Aleppo, Syrias largest city, which is being torn apart in urban warfare between rebels and forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad.

title: 2 Former UBS Traders Exposed in Rate-Rigging Case
description: As the Justice Department announced its case against UBS, prosecutors also took aim at two former UBS trader at the center of the rate-rigging scheme, the first criminal action against individuals tied to the broad investigation.

title: Obama and Boehner Diverge Sharply on Fiscal Plan
description: WASHINGTON  Hopes for a broad deficit-reduction agreement faded on Wednesday as President Obama insisted he had offered Republicans a fair deal while Speaker John A. Boehner moved for a House vote as early as Thursday on a scaled-down plan to limit tax increases to yearly incomes of $1 million and up, despite Senate opposition and Mr. Obamas veto threat.

title: Ally Repays Last of Debt Borrowed Under F.D.I.C. Guarantee
description: Ally Financial, the former G.M.A.C., said Wednesday that it had repaid the last of the debt it had borrowed in response to the financial crisis under a Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation program.

title: Turner Steps Out of Awkward Pre-Firing Tap Dance
description: The end of an N.F.L. season is always awkward for coaches who know they will be fired shortly after the final whistle. Most choose to deal with it by not dealing with it, deflecting all questions and refusing to acknowledge the pink-slip-clad elephant in the room.

title: F.D.A. and States Discuss Regulation of Drug Compounders
description: SILVER SPRING, Md.  The Food and Drug Administration conferred with public health officials from 50 states on Wednesday about how best to strengthen rules governing compounding pharmacies in the wake of a national meningitis outbreak caused by a tainted pain medication produced by a Massachusetts pharmacy.

title: Q&A: Tablet Typing on Real Keys
description: Q.

title: Tip of the Week: Clean Up Your Web Mail Address Book
description: Got a bunch of duplicate entries in the address book of your Web-based mail service, especially for people who use more than one e-mail address? Gmail, Yahoo Mail and Hotmail all include tools that let you weed out or merge the dupes.

title: Q&A: Finding a Specific Font
description: Q.

title: Karmazin Leaves Sirius XM Earlier Than Expected
description: Sirius XM Radio has appointed James E. Meyer as its interim chief executive officer, the company announced on Wednesday, as Mel Karmazin steps down from the top spot earlier than expected.

title: In Most Rich Countries, Women Work More Than Men
description: In most of the developed world, women spend more time working each day than men do, if you include unpaid work.

title: Man Fatally Beats Grandmother With Tusk, Police Say
description: Updated, Thursday | The police said on Wednesday that an emotionally disturbed man in Hamilton Heights fatally bludgeoned his grandmother and, as officers attempted to arrest him, struck a police officer in the head with a plastic elephant tusk, injuring him.

title: Commercial Buddhism in Thailand
description: Buddhism has been a way of life in Thailand for centuries, but inside the most popular temples is a trend that critics call fast-food Buddhism.

title: Beauty Gift Guide: Saving Santas Back
description: Is your loved ones stocking stuffed with a few too many oranges? Try these pint-size, prettifying gifts instead.

title: I.R.S. Leader Says Inaction on Tax Will Affect Returns of Millions
description: The acting commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service said Wednesday that if Congress fails to act this year to prevent the alternative minimum tax from expanding, as many as 100 million households  of the 150 million total taxpayers  will be unable to file their taxes on time as the I.R.S. scrambles to reprogram its computers. Some 30 million tax-filers will see an unexpected tax hit.

title: On the Path of a Next Rising Star
description: THE invitation to HBOs In Vogue: The Editors Eye party had arrived, but Kilo Kish was lacking adequate formal wear. There was a time when she might have gone in her street clothes  say, a vintage tank top with an image of Marvin Gaye, stonewashed jeans and socks patterned with marijuana leaves.

title: Smile, and Say Android
description: Android camera. Wow, that has a weird ring, doesnt it? You just dont think of a camera as having an operating system. Its like saying Windows toaster or Unix jump rope.

title: In Wake of Deadly Riot, Egyptian Team Plays On
description: NAGOYA, Japan  Ahmed Fathi, a defensive midfielder, ran for his life when he saw thousands of Egyptian opposition supporters streaming toward him on the field. His team, Al Ahly of Cairo, had just lost a local league game in February to Al Masry in the city of Port Said.

title: Obama Talks Tough
description: In the course of just a few hours, President Obama warned House Speaker John Boehner that he would veto his so-called Plan B for the so-called fiscal cliff. And he appointed Vice President Joe Biden to lead a task force on guns. Thats not terrible for a guy who makes even his most ardent supporters wonder if hes willing to fight for tough causes.

description: SEVEN-BEDROOM MANOR HOUSE NEAR CAPE TOWN

title: Near Cape Town, a 300-Year-Old Farm
description: The manor house on this 300-year-old property in South Africas Western Cape dates to 1692. The property, encompassing two other houses, is on the market for $3.4 million (30 million rand).

title: Prefall Collections
description: A look at prefall collections, including Oscar de la Renta, Proenza Schouler and Jason Wu.

title: Last Day of Fall? On the Calendar Only
description: WHETHER or not the clothes the designers are showing in their early fall collections are new, their images have changed a lot this season. Jack McCollough and Lazaro Hernandez of Proenza Schouler pointed out the difference in their prefall snaps  well, theyre snappier, looser and definitely not those robotic images that were used to on digital look books.

title: The World Through a Flurry of Snow
description: THE holiday windows of the flagship Saks Fifth Avenue in New York always prompt sidewalk pileups. But this year the window with the largest crowd snapping cellphone pictures is the one containing 150 snow globes.

title: Harvesting Fragments From a Chilean Master
description: If Roberto Bolaos Woes of the True Policeman were a pop music CD  rather than a posthumous novel from this Chilean writer who, since his death at 50 in 2003, has emerged as the most significant Latin American literary voice of his generation  it would undoubtedly be described as a collection of outtakes, alternate versions and demos. Any assessment, as a consequence, would have to come with an advisory that its primary appeal is to completists only.

title: The Legacy of Suzanne Belperron, Jeweler
description: Her designs are so singular that they tend to strip away ones assumptions about jewelry in the latter half of the 20th century.

title: Harmonies, New and Old, for Charming Madonnas
description: In the Medieval Sculpture Hall of the Metropolitan Museum of Art there are no drama queens. The Madonnas who dot the great vaulted room have been perfecting their calm, inward poise for centuries, exuding a graceful stillness that nevertheless pulsates with life through the artfully curved folds of a robe or the attentive slant of a head.

title: Modern, Before the World Was
description: THE Paris jeweler Suzanne Belperron began working in 1919 at age 19, and continued without stopping for the next 56 years. She died in 1983. Her life and career spanned the modern movement in the arts, feminism and the emergence of fashion as a big business. Yet anyone looking at the work of this remarkable woman cant help but feel she was interested only in her own ideas.

title: Create and Track Your Gift List, or Send a Silly Holiday Card
description: Its the holiday season, and Im so jam-packed with cheer that it doesnt matter that Ill be spending the holidays on a beach in a country where the chances of a white Christmas  weather I always hope for  are small.

title: Sleight of Hand and Illusions of the Theater
description: LOS ANGELES  Whether its seducing the audience into suspending disbelief as seemingly normal folk burst into song, or, more basically, convincing us that what appears before us has some meaningful reality, theater is on some fundamental level a feat of make-believe.

title: Homes for $2.4 Million
description: Properties in Key Biscayne, Seattle and Hawaii.

title: What You Get for ... $2.4 Million
description: KEY BISCAYNE, FLA.

title: All Across the City, Coming Together to Make Joyful Noise
description: A crowd of hundreds assembled under the Washington Arch early Saturday evening. Most were fiddling with their iPhones. A few dazed revelers in full Santa dress looked on, outliers of the drunken Santacon hordes. Tourists craning their necks to make out what was at the center of the crush of bodies were puzzled to find a man in horn-rimmed glasses handing out cassettes and black retro boomboxes.

title: Camaro Production Returning to the United States
description: The next Chevrolet Camaro will be built in the United States at the Lansing Grand River Assembly Plant in Lansing, Mich., General Motors announced on Wednesday.

title: Scouting Report
description: OPENINGS

title: Arthur C. Clarke E-Books for Sale in U.S.
description: Thirty-five titles by the celebrated science fiction writer Arthur C. Clarke, the author of 2001: A Space Odyssey, among other classics, will be released in digital form for the first time in the United States, the independent e-book publisher RosettaBooks said on Wednesday.

title: A Gender-Bender Parody, Gangnam Style Included
description: The question about Les Ballets Trockadero de Monte Carlo has long been: how seriously should we take the dancing? This male ballet troupe, affectionately known as the Trocks, is certainly comic, but these men in point shoes are also good enough  technically, stylistically  that you want them to be better.

title: Where a Thousand Words Paint a Picture
description: PERHAPS one place to start when trying to account for the singular, layered power of Peter Sackss paintings  the way they suggest a meticulous, almost penitential attention to detail even as they convey a larger visual narrative  is with the walks he took growing up in South Africa during the 1950s and 60s. It was on these walks around the Drakensberg Mountains that Mr. Sacks, the son of liberal white parents (his father, a renowned doctor, taught in a black medical school), encountered ancient cave paintings made by the original South African bushmen.

title: The Holidays After a Tragedy
description: As we have anguished in recent days over how to talk to our children about the Newtown, Conn., shootings, there has been an another, unspoken question beneath the surface: how do we talk to ourselves?

title: Hands Off My Clothes, Mommy
description: TRADITIONAL rules of retailing hold that popular adult brands, like the Gap and J. Crew, will inevitably create a childrens line (Gap Kids, Crewcuts). Even designer labels like Fendi and Marc Jacobs have joined in, with coral tulle baby dresses and $150 bootees for those who cannot yet walk.

title: A Seasonal Meal With a Warm Heart and Tasty Comedy (Who Needs Chestnuts?)
description: The singer Maureen McGovern radiated the comfort, joy and good humor of a benign Christmas angel at Tuesdays opening-night performance of her holiday show at 54 Below.

title: A Life of Its Own
description: Anyone fascinated by automates will enjoy Max Byrds new thriller. In fact, to enjoy this book, you probably have to be fascinated by the windup robots that were all the rage in 18th-century Europe. Byrd certainly is. And he has done his research to prove it, notably into Jacques de Vaucanson, the eccentric Frenchman who garnered great fame and considerable fortune by building, wait for it, a defecating duck.

title: Pictures of the Day: Pakistan and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Pakistan, Connecticut, South Korea and Greece.

title: A Cold Heart, but Hints at Warmth
description: Exactly one rap star has an Instagram account wholly devoted to affectionate, intimate, cute pictures of his child: Chief Keef. This is the same Chief Keef who had another of his Instagram accounts suspended in September for posting a photo of himself receiving oral sex. The same person who spent a significant portion of 2012 under house arrest in connection with gun charges. The same one whose music is in part a catalog of gang-related boasts and threats. Chief Keef is 17, and appears happy for the most part to be seen as a problem child.

title: The Music Is Timeless, but About the Rockers ...
description: THERE was Roger Daltrey, 68, with his open shirt revealing a Palm Beach perma-tan, and abs so snare-tight that they immediately raised suspicion. (Implants! charged a few skeptical members of the Twittersphere.)

title: 60 Seconds With Pogue: Android Cameras
description: David Pogue reviews the Nikon Coolpix S800C and the Samsung Galaxy Camera.

title: WikiLeaks, Hollywoods Next Muse
description: LOS ANGELES  At the end of Alex Gibneys not-quite-finished documentary We Steal Secrets  about Julian Assange and WikiLeaks  is a screen crawl describing the fate of Pfc. Bradley Manning, the Army intelligence analyst who now faces trial for the release of confidential military and diplomatic documents.

title: Betsey Johnson, Back in the Pink
description: DESPITE repeated pleas, Betsey Johnson would not sit still.

title: Supporting Actor Category Is Thick With Hopefuls
description: Few directors would have the temerity to throw lines at Robert De Niro. Then theres David O. Russell. Mr. Russell, the writer and director of Silver Linings Playbook, which stars Mr. De Niro as an obsessive but caring father, had a loose interpretation of following the script: he shouted bits of dialogue for his actors to repeat as the cameras were rolling.

title: Up Front
description: Paul Elies essay in this weeks issue, about Christianitys waning presence in contemporary American fiction, is in some ways a counterpoint and a natural follow-up to his first book, The Life You Save May Be Your Own (2003). In that book, Elie offered a group biography of four midcentury Catholic writers who took faith as a central theme: Thomas Merton, Dorothy Day, Flannery OConnor and Walker Percy.

title: Angels, Santas and Carrots
description: The ornament collection of Bonnie Mackay.

title: Tree of Life
description: MALDEN BRIDGE, N.Y.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Tech Leaders for Gun Safety, and Every Last Tweet
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Giving Gardens a Hand
description: A NOTABLE no-fire zone in the garden war is Santa Monica, Calif., where residents are encouraged to uproot grass lawns in favor of more sustainable landscaping. In 2008, the city started a garden-sharing program to pair homeowners who have land with gardeners looking for fertile ground. We act as the matchmaking service, said Wendy Pietrzak, the city employee who runs the program. The homeowners work out the arrangements.

title: The Battlefront in the Front Yard
description: JASON HELVENSTON was at work on his second crop, spreading compost to fertilize the carrots, bok choy, kale and dozens of other vegetables he grows organically on his property in Orlando, Fla., when the trouble began.

title: Be Ready for the End of the World, or an Emergency of a Lesser Sort
description: We may have only a few hours to live. On Friday, the Mayan calendar will come to an end, leading some to predict that the world will spiral into chaos. It could be the end of days. Locusts could swarm the earth, destroying crops. Tornadoes the size of Florida could shred Europe. Thousand-foot waves could crash over Idaho. Zombies! Flesh-eating viruses, human sacrifice, dogs and cats living together.

title: The N.R.A. Protection Racket
description: Edina, Minn.

title: N.Y.S.E. Is in Talks for Merger
description: An $8 billion exchange merger is in the works that underscores how the global market for derivatives has eclipsed that for stocks.

title: In Texas, a Showroom for Artful Furniture
description: For nearly a decade, Jamey Garza, 48, has made custom furniture in Marfa, Tex., eventually introducing his own designs. But until last week, he didnt have a proper showroom in which to display his pieces as well as those made by his wife, Constance Holt-Garza, 47. The couple spent six months renovating two commercial buildings on a corner lot they bought three years ago, across the street from their home. Wed pull pieces out, and theyd be hot and dusty, Ms. Holt-Garza said. We decided we needed a nice clean space to show the furniture. The 900-square-foot showroom is now filled with Mr. Garzas saddle leather, wood and powder-coated steel furniture; Ms. Garzas table linens and throw pillows; and works on paper by the local artists Leslie Wilkes and Meghan Gerety. Prices range from $24 for a linen tea towel to $3,050 for a 48-inch round cafe table: (432) 729-1946, garzamarfa.com.

title: Chatter of Doomsday Makes Beijing Nervous
description: BEIJING  By the time Saturday rolls around (or not) it will be self-evident whether the doomsday predictions espoused by some Christian sects and New Age followers of the Mayan end-of-world prophecy were off the mark.

title: SportAccord World Mind Game
description: The second SportAccord World Mind Games took place in Beijing from Dec. 12 through Wednesday. There were competitions in bridge, checkers, chess, Chinese chess and go.

title: Sales at Ethan Allen Express, Nemo Tile and Others
description: All Ethan Allen Express items, as well as Ethan Allen decorative accessories, are 15 percent off through Sunday (the Radial table, regularly $599, is about $509); 1010 Third Avenue (60th Street), (888) 324-3571, ethanallen.com.

title: Anger Over New Instagram Policy
description: The Times's Jenna Wortham explains what the new Instagram terms of service portend for users.

title: A Deep Dive Into Nordic Folkways
description: The graphics of Klaus Haapaniemi look like the work of someone at least 90 years old. They are folkloric and deeply enchanting, busy with creatures set against jewel-toned backgrounds. Mr. Haapaniemis woodland-themed Taika dishware for Iittala, for example, might have rolled off a trolls table in a Scandinavian fairy tale.

title: Time-Honored Tax Deductions
description: Compared with other tax expenditures, the deduction for interest on state and local bonds is relatively small.

title: Neighborhood Is Torn Over a Killers Legacy
description: TOULOUSE, France  In the spring, shortly after her sons murder, Latifa Ibn Ziaten took a taxi to Les Izards, a hard-up immigrant neighborhood here, hoping to understand. She approached a group of young men to ask, Do you know Mohammed Merah?

title: Mirror, Mirror, Made From Scratch
description: When Mat Driscoll made a midcareer decision to open a woodworking shop, the world lost an advertising art director but gained some nice furniture.

title: An Updated Chair for a Restored Masterwork
description: Returning the Mies van der Rohe masterwork Villa Tugendhat, an outstanding example of early modernism, to its former glory was a huge undertaking. The house, built in 1930 in Brno, Czechoslovakia, with an innovative iron frame, had been neglected after the Tugendhat family fled the Nazis in 1938. Vladimir Ambroz, the head designer of A.M.O.S Design in what is now the Czech Republic, oversaw much of the recently completed two-year project, including the restoration of all the Mies-designed furniture. Mr. Ambroz thought that the original Brno chair, an endlessly copied classic, needed a companion piece that would be softer and more comfortable. This low lounge seat pays homage to the original  the tubular steel, for example, is the same  but the chair is wider and deeper for contemporary users. The chair, in Spinneybeck leather, is $1,365: 011-420-542-212-898 or amosdesign.cz.

title: Ireland Passes Law to Bolster Housing
description: Irelands Parliament passed a sweeping new law on Wednesday that could let thousands of borrowers reduce the amounts they owe on their mortgages.

title: Mormon Women Set Out to Take a Stand, in Pants
description: LAS VEGAS  A call for Mormon women to wear pants to church, begun this month by a small group of women, has stretched across the globe, but not before creating a backlash and even generating death threats.

title: For Holidays, Cuomo Shows His Successes in 1900 Style
description: ALBANY  The portrait was of William Jennings Bryan, but it was the octopus that got all the attention, its tentacles wrapped around emblems of American industry while Lady Liberty took aim at the monster with an ax of democracy.

title: Power Company Loses Some of Its Appetite for Coal
description: WASHINGTON  Coal took another serious hit Wednesday  in the heart of coal country.

title: Looking for Lessons in Newtown
description: After my column a few days ago urging tighter gun control, I faced incoming salvos from firearm enthusiasts. Let me respond to some of their arguments:

title: Bahrain Jails Activist for Covering Protests on Twitter
description: Last Updated, Thursday, 1:19 p.m. Bahrain jailed a leading rights activist for posts on Twitter documenting a protest on Monday in the capital, Manama, the kingdoms official news agency reported. The activist, Said Yousif al-Muhafda, was being held for disseminating false information regarding the clashes between the security forces and protestors in the Manama souq last Monday, December 17th, on his Twitter account, The Bahrain News Agency said.

title: Mikulski to Take Top Job on Appropriations Committee
description: Senator Barbara A. Mikulski of Maryland will become the first woman to head the Senate Appropriations Committee, after Senator Patrick D. Leahy of Vermont decided to pass up the chairmans job, their offices announced on Wednesday.

title: The Liberation of General Motors
description: Like Willy the whale, General Motors has finally been freed  or nearly so.

title: For One Russian Lawmaker, Bequeathing 31 Aye Votes
description: MOSCOW  Vyacheslav K. Osipov, a governing party lawmaker, was absent on Wednesday but still cast 31 votes in the lower house of Parliament, all of them ayes.

title: A SoHo Pioneer, With a Warehouse of Global Treasures, Pulls Up Stakes
description: Long before it was de rigueur to install a Buddha in your home, set up a shrine to Shiva or toss suzani textiles on your sofa, Jacques Carcanagues filled his SoHo gallery with exotica. For 40 years, Mr. Carcanaguess shop has hosted a convocation of curiosities from India, North Africa, the Far East and Central and South America.

title: Next Challenge for the Health Law: Getting the Public to Buy In
description: On its face, the low-key discussion around a conference table in Miami last month did not appear to have national implications. Eight men and women, including a diner owner, a chef and a real estate agent, answered questions about why they had no health insurance and what might persuade them to buy it.

title: Foundation Seeks Focus on Business in 2013 Race
description: For months New York City business executives and civic leaders have fretted about a possible change in the direction of local government after one of their biggest boosters, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, leaves office at the end of 2013.

title: Where the Uninsured Live
description: Six states hold half the nations uninsured, but rates vary widely.

title: On Location | East Village
description: A couple applies a healthy coat of imagination in decorating their 1,100 square-foot East Village apartment.

title: Once More, With Felines
description: ALEXANDRA CUNNINGHAM, the 31-year-old director of exhibitions at the Design Miami furniture fairs in Florida and Switzerland, has three loves: artistic furniture; Seth Cameron, 30, her boyfriend of two years; and their three cats. Each has been vital to the look of the 1,100 square-foot East Village apartment they all share.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. What sort of bedding looks best for showings?

title: Britain Orders New Criminal Investigation Into Hillsborough Stadium Disaster
description: A court in London on Wednesday overturned the original inquest verdicts of accidental death in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster, when 96 Liverpool soccer fans died in a stadium crush.

title: Filling In the Blanks
description: WHEN I met my wife, I lived in an apartment where the entire wall dcor consisted of a patch of Spackle shaped like Mr. Peanut  and which, once named, clearly could not be painted.

title: The Ravens Fearsome Defense Is Staggered by Injuries
description: OWINGS MILLS, Md.  The memories are as vivid as the purple on the uniforms of the Baltimore Ravens.

title: South Koreas New President Must Challenge the North
description: Medford, Mass.

title: Twitter Reacts to Anonymous Attacks on Westboro Baptist Church
description: The last few days have seen a flurry of Twitter activity from Anonymous, the hacker collective, and more recently, from Twitter itself.

title: Suzuki Re-Signs With Yankees
description: Trying to bolster their bench for the playoffs last season, the Yankees surprisingly traded for Mariners outfielder Ichiro Suzuki.

title: Weighing Mayoral Bid, and Shaking Up the Race
description: He has never run for public office. His partys registered voters are outnumbered by more than six to one. He has most recently been in charge of mollifying the grouchiest of constituencies, New York City subway riders, while also raising their fares.

title: Amgen Workers Helped U.S. in Marketing Inquiry
description: I hope no one is taping this, the Amgen manager remarked at a company sales meeting in 2005.

title: Shopping for Wineglasses
description: Nicola Marzovilla, the owner of I Trulli, shops for wineglasses to match the heft of a vintage.

title: Oh, My Goblet
description: NICOLA MARZOVILLA is rarely seen without a wineglass at hand. The Puglia-born owner of I Trulli restaurant on East 27th Street in Manhattan also has a wine distribution company (Domenico Valentino) and a vineyard (Massoferrato) just outside Florence.

title: Ryans Cold Shoulder Leaves Tebow Baffled as Jets Look for Answers
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.

title: Council Speaker to Amend Campaign Finance Proposal
description: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, said on Wednesday that she would amend a proposed change to campaign finance laws that spurred concerns about a flood of unregulated spending by unions and advocacy groups in New York Citys coming elections.

title: In $18 Million Theft, Victim Was a Canadian Maple Syrup Cartel
description: OTTAWA  It was an inside job of sorts. Thieves with access to a warehouse and a careful plan loaded up trucks and, over time, made off with $18 million of a valuable commodity.

title: Cayman Islands: Premier Is Named to Replace Ousted Predecessor
description: The governor of the Cayman Islands on Wednesday appointed Juliana OConnor-Connolly as the new premier of the British territory. The former premier, W. McKeeva Bush, was ousted Tuesday by the Legislative Assembly, a week after his arrest in a corruption investigation. Ms. OConnor-Connolly, a former teacher and lawyer, became the first female minister of the Caymans in 1997, heading the Ministry of Community Affairs, Sports, Women, Youth and Culture.

title: Apps to Regulate Apps
description: NOBODY ever said that big cities make for easy living. The apps of the moment, Uber and Airbnb, try to mitigate matters by letting you book a car ride or rent someones apartment using your smartphone or computer. They are beloved by those contemplating scarce taxis or $500 hotel rooms. But theyre considerably less popular among city regulators, whose reactions recall Ned Ludds response to the automated loom.

title: Mexico: A Guzmn Is Deported
description: A woman believed to be the daughter of the most-wanted drug trafficker in the world, Joaqun Guzmn Loera of Mexico, has been deported to Mexico after two months in custody in California, her lawyers and American law enforcement officials said Wednesday. The woman, Alejandrina Gisselle Guzmn Salazar, 31, pleaded guilty in federal court on Monday to carrying a fake visa as she tried to enter the United States at the San Ysidro border crossing in October. She was sentenced to time served and returned by immigration authorities to Mexico on Tuesday. A law enforcement source said that officials were pretty confident that Mr. Guzmn is her father, but her lawyer said that played no role in her case.

title: Poignant Endorsements in Weight-Loss Campaign
description: THE three largest weight loss companies offer contrasting approaches to slimming down, but when it comes to marketing, they are identical in one way: they all hire celebrity endorsers.

title: U.S. Office Rejects 2nd Apple Patent
description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office has dealt a blow to Apple in its legal battle with Samsung Electronics over smartphone patents, declaring that a patent that helped Apple win $1.05 billion in damages against Samsung in a jury trial should not have been granted.

title: Spain: Separatist Parties in Accord
description: The two main separatist parties in Catalonia signed an agreement on Wednesday to form a government, as well as allow the 7.5 million citizens of what is Spains most powerful economic region to vote in 2014 on whether to secede. That puts the Catalan president, Artur Mas, on a collision course with Spains prime minister, Mariano Rajoy, who sees any independence referendum as a violation of the countrys Constitution. In last months regional elections in Catalonia, separatist parties won 74 of the 135 seats in the Catalan Parliament. Yet the vote turned out to be a setback for Mr. Mas himself, because his party lost 12 seats.

title: Fears of an Asian Quota in the Ivy League
Asians: Too Smart for Their Own Good?
description: Evanston, Ill.

title: President Cites Other Shootings Since Newtown
description: When President Obama announced Wednesday that Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. would lead a new effort to address the problem of gun violence, he cited several other cases of people around the country who were also shot and killed since the school shootings last Friday in Newtown, Conn.

title: Revolt of the Cliff Dwellers
description: Attempts to avert the infamous fiscal cliff are like a super-high-stakes card game. But you have to imagine a game in which one player needs to go into a back room before he makes his bet and get the approval of a herd of rabid ferrets.

title: Religious Leaders Push Congregants on Gun Control, Sensing a Watershed Moment
description: Religious leaders across the country this week vowed to mobilize their congregants to push for gun control legislation and provide the ground support for politicians willing to take on the gun lobby, saying the time has come for action beyond praying and comforting the families of those killed.

title: Municipalities Fight a Proposal to Tax Muni Bond Interest
description: Timothy L. Firestine, the top government administrator in Montgomery County, Md., is crunching numbers in his battle to preserve the hallowed tax exemption on municipal bonds.

title: Forgetting Football, Cruz Visits Family of 6-Year-Old Hero
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As Victor Cruz made the drive to Newtown, Conn., he had no idea what to expect.

title: Mr. Abes Second Chance
description: The Liberal Democratic Party of Japan and its leader, Shinzo Abe, are basking in Sundays election victory over the incumbent Democratic Party. A few short years ago, many were counting out Mr. Abe and his party as relics of an exhausted postwar political order. Now both are back, handed a huge parliamentary majority and a new chance to shape the future of a country with the worlds third-largest economy behind the United States and China.

title: Its the Guns
description: President Obama on Wednesday gave Vice President Joe Biden Jr. a month to complete a job that he could have finished that afternoon. It is time to come up with, as Mr. Obama put it, a set of concrete proposals to make the nation safer from guns. The ways to do this are well-known because the nation has grappled with gun massacres many times before. It is Congress that hasnt.

title: U.N. Vote Planned on Mali Security
description: The United Nations Security Council was expected to vote Thursday on a resolution that would approve the deployment of a multinational African force in Mali, along with Western training and equipment for the Malian Army, to help retake the northern part of the country from Islamist militias.

title: Lessons in Politics and Fine Print in Assault Weapons Ban of 90s
description: More than two decades before Newtown, there was Stockton.

title: A Grateful Knicks Rookie Waited a Long Time for His Shot
description: Chris Copeland, a 28-year-old N.B.A. rookie, was given an order Saturday that he thought would bring grim news: he was called into Mike Woodsons office.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Probing the Mentality Behind a Massacre
A Liberal Arts Education
description: To the Editor:
