description: Playoff positioning was the story of the day as the regular season drew to a close, and a few records changed hands, too.

title: Community Center Says It Has Been Told to Cease Its Storm Relief Program
description: People began showing up at the Ocean Bay Community Center in Arverne, Queens, on Sunday morning, braving the harsh cold to collect numbered tickets from a tall, dreadlocked man named Jamal Skrine. As he handed the tickets out, Mr. Skrine told the recipients to return later to pick up food and supplies.

title: Indian Women March: That Girl Could Have Been Any One of Us
description: NEW DELHI  Neha Kaul Mehra says she was only 7 years old the first time she was sexually harassed. She was walking to a dance class in an affluent neighborhood of New Delhi when a man confronted her and began openly masturbating.

title: Chvez Faces New Complications After Surgery
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Hugo Chvez of Venezuela is facing new complications arising from a respiratory infection following cancer surgery in Cuba, Vice President Nicols Maduro said in a televised statement on Sunday night.

title: Thomas the Tank Engine to Receive a Multimillion-Dollar Sheen
description: LOS ANGELES  One of the oldest preschool entertainment and toy franchises, Thomas the Tank Engine, is about to get a new marketing push.

title: Body of Connecticut Gunman Has Been Claimed for Burial
description: The body of Adam Lanza, who fatally shot 26 people, including 20 children, at an elementary school this month, has been claimed for burial, according to the Connecticut chief medical examiners office.

title: A Showdown Long Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON  The titanic struggle over how to reach a broad Congressional tax agreement is not just the latest partisan showdown, but rather the culmination of two years of escalating fiscal confrontations, each building on the other in its gravity and consequences. On Sunday, lawmakers could not seem to find one final way out.

title: Wild-Card Matchups: A.F.C.
description: 3. Texans (12-4, South) vs. 6. Bengals (10-6, wild card)

title: Troubled Past for Suspect in Fatal Subway Push
description: Long before Erika Menendez was charged with pushing a stranger to his death under an oncoming train at a Queens elevated station, she had years of contact with New York Citys mental health and law enforcement establishments. She was treated by the psychiatric staffs of at least two city hospitals, and caseworkers visited her family home in Queens to provide further help. She was also arrested at least three times, according to the police, twice after violent confrontations.

title: Heading for the Cliff
description: Discussion and debate continues on the so-called fiscal cliff.

title: Lottery Numbers
Duff & Phelps to Be Sold for $665.5 Million
description: Duff & Phelps, which provides valuation and merger advice to other companies, is finding itself on the other side of the table.

title: Again, Supermarket Mogul Weighs Running for Mayor
description: John A. Catsimatidis, the Greek-born billionaire owner of the Gristedes supermarket chain, settled into a shabby conference room at his 11th Avenue office the other day and happily explained, in his wheezy, genial way, why he could be the next mayor of New York City.

title: Wild-Card Matchups: N.F.C.
description: 6. Vikings (10-6, wild card) at 3. Packers (11-5, North)

title: Japans New Leader Endorses Nuclear Plants
description: TOKYO  The newly elected prime minister of Japan, Shinzo Abe, said Sunday that he would seek to build nuclear reactors, reversing within a week in office a campaign pledge to move Japan away from nuclear power.

title: What You Think You Know (but Dont) About Wise Eating
description: Lets start the new year on scientifically sound footing by addressing some nutritional falsehoods that circulate widely in cyberspace, locker rooms, supermarkets and health food stores. As a result, millions of people are squandering hard-earned dollars on questionable, even hazardous foods and supplements.

title: Corrections: December 31, 2012
description: The Times welcomes comments and suggestions, or complaints about errors that warrant correction. Messages on news coverage can be e-mailed to nytnews@nytimes.com or left toll-free at 1-888-NYT-NEWS (1-888-698-6397). Comments on editorials may be e-mailed to letters@nytimes.com or faxed to (212) 556-3622.

description: Theo Walcott put on a pretty good impersonation of Thierry Henry on Saturday, scoring three times as Arsenal thumped Newcastle, 7-3. Rob Hughes investigates the comparison, and the prospects of its continuing at the Emirates beyond this season. Read his column here, and come back to comment.

title: Blatter Critical of M.L.S. in Interview
description: FIFA President Sepp Blatter is many things  well pause this post briefly so you can insert your own description here  but he is apparently not a fan of Major League Soccer.

title: Two Rookies Summon Redskins Glory Days
description: LANDOVER, Md.  Joe Gibbs, the Hall of Fame Washington coach, was at FedEx Field on Sunday night. So was the star running back Clinton Portis, the Super Bowl-winning quarterback Joe Theismann and a host of former players, all braving the frigid air and ghosts of seasons past because they had to see it with their own eyes.

description: Our most-read and commented-on Europe posts ranged from Great Power Politics and the future of European Construction to well, British royal tops and bottoms. But readers had something to say  and much of it very personal  about just about everything.

description: She was studious, ambitious and about to be married.

title: IHT Quick Read: Dec. 31
description: NEWS Indian women poured their anger into public demonstrations last week, reacting to news of the gang rape of a young woman who had moved to the city from a small village, with a new life in front of her. Many women in India say they are still subject to regular harassment and assault during the day and are fearful of leaving their homes alone after dark. Now they are demanding that the government, and a police force that they say offers women little or no protection, do something about it. Heather Timmons and Sruthi Gottipati report from New Delhi.

title: Israels Flourishing Russian Culture
description: Its fair to say that Oded Balilty knows Israel. He grew up in Jerusalem and has been covering the country as a photographer for The Associated Press since 2002.

title: From Montreal, DataWind Says Aakash Not Main Focus
description: A somewhat shabby former newspaper office in downtown Montreal seems an improbable place to make components for an ultralow-cost tablet computer for Indian students.

title: Bringing Sunlight to Africa, and Western Investors
description: Solar power use in the United States is booming, as we reported a few weeks ago.

title: Sharers, Takers, Carers, Makers
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She recently edited and contributed to For Love and Money: Care Provision in the United States.

title: Best Players of the 2012 N.F.L. Season
description: The Pro Bowl is a great honor but the All-Pro team is even better. It represents the absolute best of the best at each position. Based on film study throughout the season, here is my 2012 All-Pro Team.

description: Q.

title: The Worse, the Better
description: MOSCOW  Ive long told myself and anyone else who would listen that things in Russia will get a lot worse before they get better. I have even thought, in accordance with an old dissident adage, that the worse, the better: the faster and more cruel the crackdown, the sooner the regime itself will crack. What I did not realize was just how bad worse was going to feel.

title: A Conversation With: DataWinds Suneet Singh Tuli
description: Suneet Singh Tuli, the chief executive of DataWind, the company behind the $40 Aakash tablet, spoke to The New York Times in New York on Nov. 29, a day after the worlds cheapest computer was unveiled by Ban Ki-moon, the United Nations secretary general, at the United Nations headquarters.

title: Ryan Block: Why Im Quitting Instagram
description: The flap over Instagrams changing its terms of service has not died down even weeks after its announcement and subsequent partial reversal. People are still arguing whether Instagrams users will stay loyal to the service. Ryan Block, former editor in chief of AOLs Engadget and the co-founder of the popular tech community site Gdgt, writes in a guest post for Bits about his reasons for quitting the Facebook-owned service.

title: In Images: A History of Premier Automobiles
description: The black and yellow Padmini taxi is as identifiable with Mumbai as the Volkswagen Beetle taxi in Mexico City or the once ubiquitous Checker cab in New York. Alternately loathed and romanticized, the Padmini  or some version of it  was produced in Mumbai from 1964 to 2000 by Premier Automobiles. It became a favorite of taxi drivers in the 1970s because it was cheaper, easier to drive and more maneuverable than the tank-like Hindustan Ambassador, its main competition in Bombay, as the city was known then. For the individual motorist, it was attainable and passed for sporty in a tightly controlled automotive industry.

title: Jets Will Pick at No. 9; Changes Are Ahead
description: Jets fans have reasons to welcome 2013.

title: Monday Reading: Busting Some Common Food Myths
The Best in Books
description: The best books of 2012 talked about trees, murder and even the lifelong quest for the perfect interior. See interactive feature >>

title: Daily Report: India Still Waits for Cheap Tablet
description: The idea was, and still is, captivating: in 2011, the Indian government and two Indian-born tech entrepreneurs unveiled a $50 tablet computer, to be built in India with Googles free Android software. The government would buy the computers by the millions and give them to its schoolchildren.

title: Kanye West Has a Couple of Year-End Announcements
description: Having emerged as only the second- or third-most talked about artist at the 12-12-12 benefit concert for Hurricane Sandy, Kanye West was not about to let 2012 elapse without making sure that he and his expanding family were back in the spotlight.

description: 6:12 p.m. | Updated

title: Little Changes in Big Ways
description: Readers: Clyde Habermans next venture, the Breaking Bread column, runs every other Monday in the N.Y./Region section. You can read past ones here.

title: What Were Reading
description: BBC: The writer and provocateur Will Self says that Britains unhealthy national obsession with food must end. He is calling for a nationwide vomitorium on the whole topic.  Julia Moskin

title: 12 New Years Resolutions for Happier Families
description: As I wrote around this time a year ago, I love making New Years resolutions. For me, its a moment to take stock of where I am, and where I want to be, and of all the things Ive said I hoped to do and have or havent done  and why. The resolutions I fail at are always the ones I didnt really want to keep.

title: Ryan Stays; Tannenbaum Goes; Other Answers Are Scarce
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  A distinct pattern has emerged for the Jets these last two years: the day after their final game is as bizarre and disorienting a spectacle as their season itself. It is a tradition like no other.

title: Tentative Deal Is Reached to Raise Taxes on the Wealthy
description: WASHINGTON  Furious last-minute negotiations between the White House and the Senate Republican leadership on Monday secured a tentative agreement to allow tax rates to rise on affluent Americans, but not in time for Congress to meet its Dec. 31 deadline for averting automatic tax increases and spending cuts deemed a threat to the economy.

title: On Our Radar: Shells Errant Arctic Drilling Vessel
description: The Kulluk, a mobile oil drilling rig owned by Royal Dutch Shell, is said to be adrift again off the Alaskan coast after losing towlines from two vessels that were trying to hold it in place in pummeling winds and high seas. On Saturday, its crew was evacuated by helicopter. [The Anchorage Daily News]

title: Ending the Year With a Feud or Two
description: The annual best-of lists and other year-end assessments have filtered out, and so have the thornier judgments. The final beefs of 2012  some of which may stay with us to next year  include the controversy over the torture in Zero Dark Thirty, the differences of opinion about the warbling face close-ups in Les Misrables, and the dust-up between Spike Lee and Django Unchained.

title: Shares End Higher on Hope for Fiscal Deal
description: Stocks were driven sharply higher on the last day of the year by signs that a resolution to the fiscal negotiations in Washington could come within days.

title: Three People Are Killed in a House Fire in the Bronx
description: As deadly flames ripped through a three-story Bronx home early Monday morning, the green metal window canopies that provided residents with shade became improvised escape routes.

description: The best of readers photos from the week of Dec. 24.

title: F.D.A. Approves Drug for Resistant Tuberculosis
description: The Food and Drug Administration announced on Monday that it had approved a new treatment for multidrug-resistant tuberculosis that can be used as an alternative when other drugs fail.

title: On Not Learning, Continued
description: Robert Murphy replies to Brad DeLong, and DeLong is not happy  for good reason. But I think theres also a broader point.

title: Rosecrans to the Rescue
description: There was no joy in the White House on Christmas day in 1862. December had been calamitous for President Abraham Lincoln and the Union war effort.

description: A few years back, after a reporting trip to Mississippi, my then-editor called me into his office. He was looking at my expense report, and his brow was furrowed.

Delhi Starts Womens Hotline
description: The Delhi government started a 24-hour hotline for women on Monday, in an effort to address sexual harassment and violence against women in the city.

title: Winter Salads Need Not Be Sad
description: This weeks City Kitchen column is all about classic (some would say old-fashioned) French salads. Full disclosure: Im in Paris for a few weeks and my inner Francophile is feeling nostalgic. So I want leeks,frise and carrots, dressed in traditional bistro garb.

title: Views of Global Warming in 1992 and Now
description: 5:26 p.m. | A clarification below |Its useful to review shifts in knowledge and perceptions  including ones own perceptions  of tough issues over time. So I thought it worth reflecting on my most thorough treatment of human-driven climate change, Global Warming: Understanding the Forecast. I wrote this book to accompany the 1992 exhibition of the same name by the American Museum of Natural History.*

title: The Worlds Worst Poker Player
description: Many reports in the past hour or two suggesting that Obama is about to cave on the fiscal cliff  water down his tax demands in return for some minor Republican concessions  concessions that wont involve taking the debt ceiling off the table.

description: KRUGER NATIONAL PARK, South Africa  They definitely did not look like ordinary big-game hunters, the stream of slender young Thai women who showed up on the veld wearing tight bluejeans and sneakers.

title: Subway Closings and Detentions Frustrate Protesters and New Years Revelers in Delhi
description: For New Years Eve, a night that some call the least safe in Delhi, the Metro Rail Corporation management said it had shut three stations in central Delhi.

title: Letter From the American West: Gun Debate Misses the Mark
description: TUCSON, Arizona  In the Philippines, as in most places, gun violence has some definition to it; you can calculate odds in any given situation. In Manila and Mindanao, just recently, my street-smarts alarm barely buzzed.Then I came home to Arizona.

title: A Roman Numerals Puzzle
description: Happy New Year! Our final post for 2012 is this original and intriguing challenge from puzzle creator Alexandre Owen Muiz.

title: Vegan Pantry Dinners for the New Year
description: Here is a New Years project for you. Take an inventory of your pantry, freezer, and refrigerator and cook for a week without buying anything except items that you and your children may consume on a daily basis (for me that means bananas). That is what Im doing this week and I have decided that I will also make my meals vegan.

title: Warm Lentil Salad With Balsamic Roast Squash
description: This recipe started out as something else. I had in my pantry a bag of mixed sprouted lentils  black, green, and brown. I cooked them with the intention of making dal, but I so liked the integrity of the cooked lentils  green and black lentils remain intact even after they soften  that I didnt want to mash them. Meanwhile I had roasted some squash with balsamic vinegar. I ended up warming the lentils in a cumin-scented vinaigrette and serving them with the squash.

title: Copy of Beatles Album With Unusual History Sells for Nearly $20,000
description: When Chris Collins and his sister, Liz Chambers, put their prized copy of the Beatles Please Please Me album up for auction in early December they expected it to fetch 15,000 (about $24,400). They had reason to be hopeful: the album not only was an original pressing, on the black-and-gold Parlophone label that was discontinued (and replaced with a sleeker, black-and-yellow update) a few months after the album was released, but it is also autographed. But when bidding reached only 12,000 ($19,500), they withdrew the disc. Now the BBC reports that they have sold it privately for the price they had turned down at the auction.

title: Vegan Pho With Carrots, Noodles and Edamame
description: When I was testing my vegan pho broth for a Recipes for Health series last spring I froze a few containers of the broth; I had forgotten how good it is. I didnt have some of the traditional ingredients for pho  bean sprouts, cilantro, scallions, green chiles  so I used what I had and it was definitely pho. I used cayenne for heat and a chiffonade of romaine lettuce was a good stand-in for the bean sprouts, crunchy and fresh. Lots of chives stood in for scallions. I did without cilantro or Thai basil but had plenty of Italian basil and mint from my garden.

title: For Sam and Me, Just Say Knicks
description: For years I was furious with the New York Knicks for robbing me of what should have been an important part of my relationship with my son Sam growing up.

title: Rice Bowl With Sweet and Sour Purple Cabbage, Red Peppers and Baked Marinated Tofu
description: I cooked up a pot of Thai purple sticky rice that had been lingering in the pantry, and then decided how I would turn it into a meal. It was too sticky to use for stir-fried rice so I made stir-fried vegetables and oven-baked tofu, and served up rice bowls topped with both. I thought it might be an altogether too purple meal, but it was quickly devoured, and we are all the more anti-oxidant rich because of the anthocyanins in the red and purple foods.

title: It Was a Big Year for Long-Form Journalism at The Times
description: As George Harrison once sang, its been a long, long, long time. Im talking about 2012, when many long, long, long stories appeared in The Times.

title: Visa Issue in China Forces Out Times Reporter
description: BEIJING  A correspondent for The New York Times was forced to leave mainland China on Monday after the authorities declined to issue him a visa for 2013 by years end.

title: In Performance: Baba Brinkman
description: The actor in a scene from his solo show Ingenious Nature.

title: In Starting Over, No Time to Lose
description: Even by the tumultuous standards of the end of an N.F.L. season, this Monday  Black Monday, as it is annually called  stood out.

title: Let Diversification Do Its Job
description: Investors typically set up a diversified investment portfolio to reduce their risk. Just hold a good mix of different kinds of stocks, along with some bonds and cash, and your problems are over.

title: Human Bait
description: How a new pill turns humans into bedbug bait.

title: Better Coffee Depends on Good Grinding
description: BEFORE you rush online to sign up for a barista lesson or a class in how to brew, make sure that you have already taken the first step to making better coffee. In the kitchen, next to your kettle, do you have a good grinder?

title: Learning to Create the Perfect Cup of Coffee
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Spoiler Alert! List of Reviled Words Tries to Fight Fiscal Cliff
description: A group of language scolds has released its annual list of words and phrases to be exorcised from the English language, and  Spoiler alert! Spoiler alert is among them.

title: Do the Foreign-Film Dance as We Bid 2012 Adieu
description: As 2012 ticks away, Oscar voters and movie fans are scrambling to catch up with the latest at the box office. There are cheats, of course  here are hundreds of the years cinematic offerings, compressed into six minutes:

title: Slow Return for a Former Speakeasy That Crumpled
description: It was a restaurant where F. Scott Fitzgerald had a tryst with a woman in a booth  supposedly. It was a bar with front steps that were built expressly to trip up Prohibition-era policemen who would periodically rush in to spoil the party  maybe. And it had bootlegging tunnels that led from inside the bar far out into the street  probably not.

title: Clock Time and Sun Time
description: Q. Is there a scientific reason that adopting year-round daylight saving time would not be feasible?

title: Looking Into Lopezs Sudden Resurgence
description: In the two games since Avery Johnson was relieved of his duties as coach of the Nets, Brook Lopez has averaged 29.5 points and 11 rebounds in consecutive Brooklyn wins. In the two victories, Lopez has lived near the rim and shot 68.5 percent from the field while getting to the line 19 times. Essentially, he returned to the All-Star form he showed in the first month of the season as he propelled the Nets to an 11-4 start.

title: Iran Tests New Version of Missiles in Exercise
description: Iranian forces fired what military officers said was a new generation of surface-to-air missiles on Monday during a wide-ranging naval exercise that focused on striking hypothetical unmanned aircraft and vessels in international waters to the south of the country, Iranian news media reported.

title: What New Years Resolution Should Your Loved One Make?
description: Every year around this time, people make their little lists of things they will do differently in the days to come.

title: Really? Dieting Is a Short-lived New Years Resolution
description: THE FACTS

title: Look of the Year | Kristen Stewart
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Walkabout  12/31: Vermont Ski Resort Doles Out Green Cards; 2012 Safest Year in Airplane Travel
description: Ski for Green Cards Developers with big plans for Jay Peak, a ski resort in Vermont, and the nearby town Newport have got millions in financing under a program that gives foreigners a green card in exchange for a $500,000 investment. (New York Times)

title: In a Place for the Dead, Studying a Seemingly Immortal Species
description: PETERSHAM, Mass.  On a sparkling New England afternoon, as hawks coasted overhead and yellow leaves drifted to the ground, Anne Pringle stood before a large granite obelisk that marked the graves of a family called French.

title: An Endless Subject, and a Way to End Bedbugs?
description: This week: we take up infinity (though this podcast will be finite) and a secret weapon against the bloodsuckers of the night  you, on deworming pills.

title: When the Fat Lady Sings
description: As I explained last year on this date, I took this photo in Paris in 1980, at the sleepy peak of the August vacances, when most shops, including this watch store, were shuttered. The elderly gentleman, to my eye, seemed particularly uncomfortable on his walk as he passed the hand of time.

title: Tribulations in Spain
description: With a huge deficit, Spain has introduced one austerity measure after another.

title: Looking Ahead to Civil and Criminal Cases to Come
description: It is not really of question of whether there will be a major white-collar crime that captures the publics attention in 2013; its a question of when and how costly it will be.

title: Poets Who Look Death in the Eye
description: The poets C. K. Williams and Cynthia Cruz, at first glance, couldnt seem more different. Mr. Williams owns a Pulitzer and has published more than 20 books; her latest book is just Ms. Cruzs second. He casts long, serpentine lines upon the page; she savors the cryptic burst. And Mr. Williams was born into the same 1930s Newark that shaped Philip Roth, while Ms. Cruz came of age in Santa Cruz, Calif., skateboarding and listening to punk.

title: Latvias Growth Is Cited as Austerity Success Story
description: With Latvia experiencing economic growth after deep budget cuts, many have suggested the results could be replicated elsewhere.

title: In Ireland, Recession and Austerity
description: The effects of slashed budgets have pummeled the countrys fragile economy, leaving scars that are likely to take years to heal.

title: President Obama on the Fiscal Talks
description: President Obama says a deal is within sight, less than 24 hours before the so-called fiscal cliff.

title: Inflammation Byproduct Linked to Stress
description: Using data from two large studies, Danish researchers have found that higher blood levels of C-reactive protein, or CRP, are associated with a greater risk of psychological stress and clinical depression.

title: Ford Fusion Energi MPGe Hits Triple Digits, E.P.A. Says
description: The 2013 Ford Fusion Energi plug-in hybrid has received an E.P.A. certification of being able to achieve the equivalent of 108 miles per gallon in city driving, the automaker has announced.

title: Conceder In Chief?
description: OK, Ive had my own sorta-kinda briefing on the apparent fiscal cliff deal, and Im pretty much with Noam Scheiber. Viewed on its own, its a bad and upsetting deal but not as terrible as initial rumors had it. But the strategic consequences are likely to be very bad indeed, and in very short order too.

title: Promoter Who Revamped Capitol Theater Buys It
description: The concert promoter who revitalized the Capitol Theater in Port Chester, N.Y., this year as a rock music hall has bought that landmark building from its previous owner. The promoter, Peter Shapiro, who is also a partner in the Brooklyn Bowl, said he paid $11.5 million for the 1,800-seat theater, closing a deal on Friday with the previous owner, Marvin Ravikoff.

title: Worms Produce Another Kind of Gold for Growers
description: SONOMA, Calif.  Under rows of old chicken sheds, Jack Chambers has built an empire of huge metal boxes filled with cattle manure and millions of wriggling red worms.

title: Where the Melvillean Things Are
description: In last weekends Lives They Lived issue, the longtime contributor to the magazine Christoph Niemann sketched a clever, touching tribute to Maurice Sendak. Niemann (self-rendered in a way that recalls Calvins father in Calvin & Hobbes) recreates an afternoon in 2011 when he listened to the childrens book author being interviewed on the car radio. His drive was taken over by images from Sendaks work the way Maxs bedroom is overrun by jungle in Where the Wild Things Are, with glimpses of Max, wild things, Jennie the dog, Mickey, a couple of bakers.

title: A Ride in a 1954 Bentley R-Type Sedan
description: In their criticism of Lindsay Lohan for her portrayal of Elizabeth Taylor in Lifetimes recent Liz & Dick, reviewers missed an assured, if brief, appearance by 59-year-old Madame, who came out of semiseclusion to take on the role as conveyance to a cuckold.

title: Silencing the Smartphone
description: Resolutions to change behavior are common at this time of year, but they usually involve exercising more or smoking less. Now, some companies are adopting policies aimed at weaning employees from their electronic devices.

title: Knowing You Carry a Cancer Gene
description: I jogged into the Stanford Cancer Clinic with my boyfriend, the youngest people there by two decades. We stood there sweating and holding hands, a jarring sight in the sickly light.

title: Sound vs. Noise, and the Elusive Quest for Quiet
description: Mike Goldsmith has assembled a lot of facts about noise, some familiar (trucks are noisy), some worth noting (the Big Bang was silent) and some nearly lost to history: The ill-fated Concorde was so loud that in 1976 Congress banned its landing in the United States (a decision quickly overturned by the secretary of transportation). A fatal crash in 2000 led to the doom of the Concorde entirely.

title: City Rooms Top Animal Posts of 2012
description: 2012 was a big year for news in New York, and City Room was there for Hurricane Sandy, developments in the Etan Patz case, the brazen daytime shooting in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Health Care Hackers and Guns for Christmas
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Europes Debt Crisis: No Relief on the Horizon
description: European Union officials have struggled to turn things around  debating new treaties, shoring up banks, securing more funding.  The people of Greece, Spain, Portugal, Ireland and Latvia have dealt with economic troubles in various ways.

title: Birds Found to Have Emotional Reactions to Song
description: The human brain responds to music in different ways, depending on the listeners emotional reaction, among other things. Now researchers report that the same holds true for birds listening to birdsong.

title: Grapes Can Be Different by Location in Vineyard
description: Wine enthusiasts, consider this: The same grapes from different parts of a vineyard can be quite different.

title: Big Data: Rise of the Machines
description: For a column that laid out some second thoughts on Big Data, one of the people I talked to was Thomas H. Davenport, who has worked in the fields of knowledge management and analytics for 15 years. Data analytics is the predecessor to Big Data. He knows the context  whats new and whats not with Big Data  as well as anyone.

title: Pill Could Join Arsenal Against Bedbugs
description: THE HYPOTHESIS

title: Youthful Orchestra Abets the Voice of a Clarinet
description: Mozart wrote several remarkable works for the Austrian clarinetist Anton Stadler, his friend and fellow Mason, including the great Quintet for Clarinet and Strings, and the Clarinet Concerto, the last major score Mozart completed, shortly before dying. He was clearly inspired by his colleagues virtuosity and artistry. From all reports, Stadler could bend a gentle phrase with uncommon delicacy. Johann Schink, a Viennese critic, wrote that he would not have thought it possible for a clarinet to imitate the human voice so deceptively, as Stadler did.

title: Outmaneuvered at Their Own Game, Antivirus Makers Struggle to Adapt
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The antivirus industry has a dirty little secret: its products are often not very good at stopping viruses.

title: Mourning for Rape Victim Recasts New Years Eve in India
description: As my colleague Sruthi Gottipati reports, thousands of protesters marched on Monday in New Delhi, pledging to take back the night, as India remained in mourning for the 23-year-old victim of a gang rape who died on Saturday.

title: The Human Toll of Europes Economic Statistics
description: An interactive presentation of how the debt crisis has affected five European countries accompanies this post. We urge you to view it.

title: We Lost Things and We Can Replace Those Things
description: ORTLEY BEACH, N.J.  Stefanie Pypers last prehurricane memory of her house on Fourth Avenue is one of bliss: the bike ride up to the Lavallette Boardwalk, seeing a school of dolphins in the ocean, the oasis of calm amid the turmoil of raising five children ranging in age from 8 to 18.

title: Motor Skills May Predict Success in School
description: Poor motor function in childhood may be an important factor in predicting poor academic achievement in adolescence.

title: The Confusion of Pill Coloring
description: New research suggests that changing the color of a persons pills  by switching to a generic from a brand name drug, for example  sharply reduces the chances that the patient will continue to take it.

title: The Life of Pi, and Other Infinities
description: On this day that fetishizes finitude, that reminds us how rapidly our own earthly time share is shrinking, allow me to offer the modest comfort of infinities.

title: An Environmentalist Weighs the Fallout of Flying
description: I FLY a lot. And honestly, flying now is a means to an end, although I used to enjoy it. Its not that I hate it or am paranoid. Its just that its a chore.

title: Mortality: H.I.V.-Positive Smokers Lose More Years to Tobacco Than to the Virus, a Study Says
description: H.I.V. patients who obtain good treatment but who smoke lose more years of life to tobacco than to the virus, a new Danish study has found.

title: Juggling Diabetes and Cancer
description: Nine years ago, Brenda Gray, a former schoolteacher in North Carolina, discovered she had Type 2 diabetes.

title: Yankees at Payroll Threshold, at Least for Now
description: On the final day of 2012 the Yankees will coincidentally close out the year at a landmark position in baseballs payroll standings, the sports own fiscal cliff, which will arrive before the 2014 season. It is a spot they expect to revisit again in one year, but for now they are only passing it by.

title: Coldplay Delivers in the Usual Way
description: Near the end of its allotted time at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn on Sunday night, Coldplay offered up Fix You, a vow of encouragement about as earnest and ingenuous as its title suggests. The song opens like a processional hymn and stays in that realm awhile before tipping decisively toward rock grandeur: a cue for Chris Martin, the voice and face and soul of the band, to shrug off any lingering scrap of pensiveness or decorum.

title: Why Elliott Carter Wasnt in The Music They Made
description: Over the weekend, Alex Ross, the New Yorker music critic and author of the excellent books The Rest Is Noise: Listening to the Twentieth Century and Listen to This, called for a protest against the Times Magazine. He had his reasons: The annual mix I make honoring the musicians who died the previous year did not  once again  include any classical musicians.

title: Remarks by the President on Fiscal Cliff Negotiations
description: The following is the full text of President Obamas statement from the White House on the fiscal talks on Monday.

title: Light Absorption Speeding Arctic Ice Melt
description: The record-setting disappearance of Arctic sea ice this fall was an indication to many climate scientists and ice experts that the pace of climate change was outstripping predictions.

title: Building a Better Goal Post
description: A look at the manufacturing of a football goal post that, with the push of a button, sinks to the ground in less than a minute.

title: Irving Azoff to Leave Live Nation
description: Irving Azoff, the executive chairman of Live Nation Entertainment, the concert and ticketing giant, is leaving the company, Live Nation announced on Monday.

title: Fearing Fighting, Residents Flee Capital of Central African Republic
description: JOHANNESBURG  As efforts to broker a deal to stop a rebel advance failed, residents of the capital of the Central African Republic were packing up their belongings and fleeing into the countrys vast hinterlands, fearing a major battle between government troops and guerrilla fighters.

title: Albums from Buddy Miller and Jim Lauderdale, and the Max Johnson Trio
description: BUDDY MILLER AND JIM LAUDERDALE

title: Revisiting a Beatles Archive
description: Henry Grossman took more than 7,000 photos of the Beatles in the mid-1960s. A new book includes about 1,000 of them.

title: Big Innovations in Football Are Just Past the End Zone
description: In its home opener in 2005, the Central Florida football team ended a 17-game losing streak with an upset of Marshall. Fans swarmed the field and, in a time-honored tradition, tore down one of the goal posts at the Florida Citrus Bowl in Orlando.

title: New Frontier for Topics in Science: Social Media
description: The largest and most sophisticated rover landed safely on Mars and the worlds most famous Moon visitor died, but the space event that most captured the publics imagination in 2012 involved a journey to Earth.

title: The Kardashian Family Grows on Twitter
description: When Kanye West announced on stage last Sunday that his girlfriend, Kim Kardashian, is pregnant, it came as a surprise, not only to the audience, but reportedly also to Ms. Kardashian as well. So how did the Kardashian clan respond? On Twitter, of course, where they offered their congratulations. And sure enough, #kimye was again a trending hashtag. An E! special must be in this babys future.

title: Obama Won New York City, in Case Anyone Was Wondering
description: However this fiscal cliff thing turns out, President Obama can take heart in one piece of news that broke on Monday: he won the election in New York City.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Central African Republic, Gaza Strip, West Bank and India.

title: Academy Members Get an Extra Day to Vote
description: LOS ANGELESThe Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has been having a tough time with deadlines: After extending the time limit for the documentary branch to compile its shortlist in the fall, the Academy is now giving all members an extra day to cast their entire Oscar nominating ballots.

title: The More Things Change, the More a Band Can Do
description: More an apparition than a band, the Golden Palominos have materialized, vanished and reconfigured over the past 30 years, according to the impulses of the drummer Anton Fier, the bands only constant. The Golden Palominos have been a noise-funk band, a globally tinged pop band, a rock band and a folk-pop band, while their studio albums have featured guest lead vocalists like Michael Stipe of R.E.M. and John Lydon of Public Image Ltd.

title: Prospecting for Treasure Behind Urban Padlocks
description: I moved into my current apartment in November 2001, on the heels of the Sept. 11 attacks, boxing everything up for a move away from downtown Manhattan to an equally spacious but less forgivingly laid out place uptown. As part of the move I exiled some things to a storage outfit in Nassau County, N.Y., and there the pile rested, a ghost whose existence was proved only by the monthly checks Ive written ever since.

title: The Return of the Natives
description: STEVEN and Loraine Summer adore their sons Jason, 20, a junior at the University of Maryland, and Ari, 22, a graduate student at the University of Colorado. When the boys returned home in suburban Denver to visit at Thanksgiving, their parents enjoyed the adult conversation and learning about their sons career ambitions and new interests.

title: Photo Replay: Dec. 31
description: A view of the years final day in sports, including basketball in the pros, football in the bowls and bike racing in the snow.

title: Revis Focuses on Return, One He Hopes Is With the Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Darrelle Revis was a helpless spectator as the Jets season careened out of control.

title: A Year of Market Gains, Despite Turmoil
description: A year ago, some thought 2012 was destined to be the year that the euro zone  and maybe even the entire European Union  broke up. The banks that supported their governments, and that in turn depended on those same governments for bailouts if they went broke, were deemed to be particularly vulnerable to disaster.

title: Live From Times Square: New Years Eve
description: Thinking about spending the last few moments of 2012 in Times Square? Yes, its a New York tradition, the first gathering having taken place in 1904. But for the 2012-13 party, its probably already too late.

title: Chief Justice Prods Congress to Resolve Budget Talks and Control National Debt
description: WASHINGTON  Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. used his year-end report on the federal judiciary to give Congressional budget negotiators a little nudge.

title: The Beatles, Seen From Unusual Angles
description: When Time magazine first asked Henry Grossman to photograph the Beatles, at their American television debut on The Ed Sullivan Show in February 1964, he thought of it as just another assignment  a journey into the realm of teenage fads, and less exciting than the sessions he had done with world leaders, actors and opera singers. Mr. Grossman, who was 27 at the time, preferred classical music; at 76, he still shoots production photos for the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Actors, Offstage and Off Guard
description: For many actors rehearsal is a place to make mistakes. For Glenn Fitzgerald its a place to make art. Starting in 1998, when he took portraits of Nathan Lane and other cast members in Jon Robin Baitzs Mizlansky/Zilinsky, or Schmucks, Mr. Fitzgerald has captured scenes of productions in which hes appeared.

title: Worlds in a Snapshot
description: The actor Glenn Fitzgerald talks about photos hes taken of two shows in which hes appeared.

title: Race and Medicine (2 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Recovery After Trauma
description: To the Editor:

title: Independence for Elderly
description: To the Editor:

title: Spiritual Landscapes of the Gilded Age
description: In 1880, according to a frequently cited report, 4,000 churches were under construction in the United States. This Gilded Age frenzy of ecclesiastical building created a terrific demand for designers who could make houses of worship that were also theaters of spiritually inspiring beauty. And every church seemed to require at least one spectacular stained-glass window to transport the faithful into imaginary realms of transcendental bliss. The man who most famously fulfilled that need was Louis Comfort Tiffany (1848-1933).

title: Humpback Whales Seek Pairings Based on Size
description: Going underwater with video cameras and sonar, scientists have gained new insights into the mating behavior of humpback whales.

title: Playing by Heart, With or Without a Score
description: It would seem that the filmmaker Michael Haneke, who wrote and directed the wrenching and poignantly acted new French movie Amour, is swept away by the mystique of a pianist, alone onstage, conveying mastery and utter oneness with music by playing a great piece from memory. The drama of playing from memory is at the crux of a scene involving the elegant French pianist Alexandre Tharaud, who, portraying himself, has a small but crucial role.

title: Seasoned With Invention and Irreverence
description: ONE school of criticism holds that chefs should faithfully honor any cuisine they pilfer. But theres an equally valid case for bold, fearless theft. A good pickpocket does not waste time with introductions.

title: Thirty Acres
description: This restaurant challenges your sense of geography, starting with its location.

title: Added In or Left Out, Fees Remain the Focus
description: IN a move being watched by competitors, American Airlines is experimenting with a new pricing option that eliminates the potential penalty fee for changing flights for customers who pay a little extra for a basic coach ticket.

title: A Podcast That Has Old-School Smarts
description: In 2012 I spent more time with comedy podcasts than I did with sitcoms and talk shows combined. Its not something I would recommend to everyone.

title: Found Moments
description: The actor Glenn Fitzgerald takes photos of shows in which he appears.

title: Piazza, the Marlin, And a Shared Fixation
description: One is a corporate lawyer from Southern California with few hobbies and only the mildest interest in sports. The other is a college student from Miami who is less than half his age and has amassed a stash of memorabilia that matches his love of baseball.

title: A Luminous Kingdom, Awaiting on a Blustery Night
description: BOSTON  Whats new about Boston Ballets new Nutcracker is the expensive part: scenery and costumes, both by Robert Perdziola. The dances and the story appear largely the same. This is a shrewd way for any company to proceed: take a production and keep building it. On the day I arrived here, The Boston Globe reported that the productions attendance and revenues were up.

title: Enjoying the New Years Holiday
description: Dresden, Germany, the home of Volkswagens Transparent Factory, is also the site of a spectacular New Years Eve fireworks display. So well take this opportunity to wish everyone a Happy New Year and to remind you that drinking and driving dont mix. Well be off on Tuesday but back with you on Wednesday. If youre behind the wheel, stay safe and sober.

title: Marveling Over a Marlin
description: Jerry Dworkin of Irvine, Calif., is on the chase to collect all of the 120-plus Mike Piazza Florida Marlins trading cards issued between 1998 and 2005.

title: 12 Foreign Stories From 2012 Worth Revisiting
description: There were hundreds of memorable foreign stories from Times correspondents in 2012. Here is a sampling of 12 from across the world in chronological order.

title: Announcing the Latest Big Thing
description: These past few weeks, every media outlet on the Internet, from Vogue to CNN, has been commemorating the hottest trends of 2012: donating to Kony 2012, taking placenta pills, wearing peplums, compulsively watching the Weather Channel. The lists go on and on.

title: The Emancipation of Abe Lincoln
description: ONE hundred and fifty years ago, on Jan. 1, 1863, Abraham Lincoln presided over the annual White House New Years reception. Late that afternoon, he retired to his study to sign the Emancipation Proclamation. When he took up his pen, his hand was shaking from exhaustion. Briefly, he paused  I do not want it to appear as if I hesitated, he remarked. Then Lincoln affixed a firm signature to the document.

title: How Many Slaves Work for You?
description: New Brunswick, N.J.

title: After Crispy Pig Ears, 10 Trends for 2013
description: IN our newly omnivorous nation, restaurant trends often have the same viral spread and short life span as boy bands  witness 2011s crispy pig ears and sea buckthorn berries. Eating around the country on reporting trips in 2012, I saw food lovers everywhere embracing new interpretations of farm-to-table and nose-to-tail as fast as they came along.

title: Hurting Knicks Uncertain of Tuesdays Lineup
description: The Knicks are stepping carefully into the new year, not quite sure just who will be on the court and who will be sitting and watching, when they take on the Portland Trail Blazers at Madison Square Garden on Tuesday night.

title: Pursuing a First Win in the Bowls Since 1949
description: EVANSTON, Ill.  From the sidelines at a recent practice, Northwestern Coach Pat Fitzgerald looked as if he could have been a player. Fitzgerald, a baby-faced 38-year-old, wore a black, long-sleeved T-shirt and black shorts that revealed muscular calves. He was a bundle of energy, sprinting from player to player during drills, bumping chests and shouting encouragement. Only his clipboard and whistle gave him away.

title: Bond Craze Could Run Its Course in New Year
description: The big story in the markets this year was not about stocks.
